verses.sanskrit: तवां हय अग्ने सदम इत समन्यवो देवासो देवम अरतिं नयेरिर इति करत्वा नयेरिरे अमर्त्यं यजत मर्त्येष्व आ देवम आदेवं जनत परचेतसं विश्वम आदेवं जनत परचेतसम |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ hy aghne sadam it samanyavo devāso devam aratiṃ nyerira iti kratvā nyerire amartyaṃ yajata martyeṣv ā devam ādevaṃ janata pracetasaṃ viśvam ādevaṃ janata pracetasam

translations.griffith: 1, THEE Agni, have the Gods, ever of one accord, sent hither down, a God, appointed messenger, yea, with their wisdom sent thee down.  The Immortal, O thou Holy One, mid mortal men, the God-devoted God, the wise, have they brought forth, brought forth the omnipresent God-devoted Sage.

verses.sanskrit: स भरातरं वरुणम अग्न आ वव्र्त्स्व देवां अछा सुमती यज्ञवनसं जयेष्ठं यज्ञवनसम रतावानम आदित्यं चर्षणीध्र्तं राजानं चर्षणीध्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: sa bhrātaraṃ varuṇam aghna ā vavṛtsva devāṃ achā sumatī yajñavanasaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ yajñavanasam ṛtāvānam ādityaṃ carṣaṇīdhṛtaṃ rājānaṃ carṣaṇīdhṛtam

translations.griffith: As such, O Agni, bring with favour to the Gods thy Brother Varuṇa who loveth sacrifice,  True to the Law, the Āditya who supporteth men, the King, supporter of mankind.

verses.sanskrit: सखे सखायम अभ्य आ वव्र्त्स्वाशुं न चक्रं रथ्येव रंह्यास्मभ्यं दस्म रंह्या अग्ने मर्ळीकं वरुणे सचा विदो मरुत्सु विश्वभानुषु तोकाय तुजे शुशुचान शं कर्ध्य अस्मभ्यं दस्म शं कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: sakhe sakhāyam abhy ā vavṛtsvāśuṃ na cakraṃ rathyeva raṃhyāsmabhyaṃ dasma raṃhyā aghne mṛḷīkaṃ varuṇe sacā vido marutsu viśvabhānuṣu tokāya tuje śuśucāna śaṃ kṛdhy asmabhyaṃ dasma śaṃ kṛdhi

translations.griffith: Do thou, O Friend, turn hither him who is our Friend, swift as a wheel, like two car-steeds in rapid course, Wondrous! to us in rapid course.  O Agni, find thou grace for us with Varuṇa, with Maruts who illumine all.  Bless us, thou Radiant One, for seed and progeny, yea, bless us, O thou Wondrous God.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्ने वरुणस्य विद्वान देवस्य हेळो ऽव यासिसीष्ठाः यजिष्ठो वह्नितमः शोशुचानो विश्वा दवेषांसि पर मुमुग्ध्य अस्मत |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḷo 'va yāsisīṣṭhāḥ yajiṣṭho vahnitamaḥ śośucāno viśvā dveṣāṃsi pra mumughdhy asmat

translations.griffith: Do thou who knowest Varuṇa, O Agni, put far away from us the God's displeasure.  Best Sacrificer, brightest One, refulgent remove thou far from us all those who hate us.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं नो अग्ने ऽवमो भवोती नेदिष्ठो अस्या उषसो वयुष्टौ अव यक्ष्व नो वरुणं रराणो वीहि मर्ळीकं सुहवो न एधि |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ no aghne 'vamo bhavotī nediṣṭho asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau ava yakṣva no varuṇaṃ rarāṇo vīhi mṛḷīkaṃ suhavo na edhi

translations.griffith: Be thou, O Agni, nearest us with succour, our closest Friend while now this Morn is breaking.  Reconcile to us Varuṇa, be bounteous enjoy the gracious juice; be swift to hear us.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य शरेष्ठा सुभगस्य संद्र्ग देवस्य चित्रतमा मर्त्येषु शुचि घर्तं न तप्तम अघ्न्याया सपार्हा देवस्य मंहनेव धेनोः |||
verses.transliteration: asya śreṣṭhā subhaghasya saṃdṛgh devasya citratamā martyeṣu śuci ghṛtaṃ na taptam aghnyāyā spārhā devasya maṃhaneva dhenoḥ

translations.griffith: Excellent is the glance, of brightest splendour, which the auspicious God bestows on mortals-  The God's glance, longed-for even as the butter, pure, heated, of the cow, the milch-cow's bounty.

verses.sanskrit: तरिर अस्य ता परमा सन्ति सत्या सपार्हा देवस्य जनिमान्य अग्नेः अनन्ते अन्तः परिवीत आगाच छुचिः शुक्रो अर्यो रोरुचानः |||
verses.transliteration: trir asya tā paramā santi satyā spārhā devasya janimāny aghneḥ anante antaḥ parivīta āghāc chuciḥ śukro aryo rorucānaḥ

translations.griffith: Three are those births, the true, the most exalted, eagerly longed-for, of the God, of Agni.  He came invested in the boundless region, pure, radiant, friendly, mightily resplendent.

verses.sanskrit: स दूतो विश्वेद अभि वष्टि सद्मा होता हिरण्यरथो रंसुजिह्वः रोहिदश्वो वपुष्यो विभावा सदा रण्वः पितुमतीव संसत ||
verses.transliteration: sa dūto viśved abhi vaṣṭi sadmā hotā hiraṇyaratho raṃsujihvaḥ rohidaśvo vapuṣyo vibhāvā sadā raṇvaḥ pitumatīva saṃsat

translations.griffith: This envoy joyeth in all seats of worship, borne on his golden car, sweet-tongued Invoker:  Lovely to look on, with red steeds, effulgent, like a feast rich in food, joyous for ever.

verses.sanskrit: स चेतयन मनुषो यज्ञबन्धुः पर तम मह्या रशनया नयन्ति स कषेत्य अस्य दुर्यासु साधन देवो मर्तस्य सधनित्वम आप ||
verses.transliteration: sa cetayan manuṣo yajñabandhuḥ pra tam mahyā raśanayā nayanti sa kṣety asya duryāsu sādhan devo martasya sadhanitvam āpa

translations.griffith: Allied by worship, let him give man knowledge: by an extended cord they lead him onward.  He stays, effectual in this mortal's dwelling, and the God wins a share in his possessions.

verses.sanskrit: स तू नो अग्निर नयतु परजानन्न अछा रत्नं देवभक्तं यद अस्य धिया यद विश्वे अम्र्ता अक्र्ण्वन दयौष पिता जनिता सत्यम उक्षन |||
verses.transliteration: sa tū no aghnir nayatu prajānann achā ratnaṃ devabhaktaṃ yad asya dhiyā yad viśve amṛtā akṛṇvan dyauṣ pitā janitā satyam ukṣan

translations.griffith: Let Agni -for he knows the way- conduct us to all that he enjoys of God-sent riches,  What all the Immortals have prepared with wisdom, Dyaus, Sire, Begetter, raining down true blessings.

verses.sanskrit: स जायत परथमः पस्त्यासु महो बुध्ने रजसो अस्य योनौ पर शर्ध आर्त परथमं विपन्यं रतस्य योना वर्षभस्य नीळे सपार्हो युवा वपुष्यो विभावा सप्त परियासो ऽजनयन्त वर्ष्णे || ||
verses.transliteration: sa jāyata prathamaḥ pastyāsu maho budhne rajaso asya yonau pra śardha ārta prathamaṃ vipanyaṃ ṛtasya yonā vṛṣabhasya nīḷe spārho yuvā vapuṣyo vibhāvā sapta priyāso 'janayanta vṛṣṇe

translations.griffith: In houses first he sprang into existence, at great heaven's base, and in this region's bosom;  Footless and headless, both his ends concealing, in his Bull's lair drawing himself together.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकम अत्र पितरो मनुष्या अभि पर सेदुर रतम आशुषाणाः अश्मव्रजाः सुदुघा वव्रे अन्तर उद उस्रा आजन्न उषसो हुवानाः |||
verses.transliteration: asmākam atra pitaro manuṣyā abhi pra sedur ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ aśmavrajāḥ sudughā vavre antar ud usrā ājann uṣaso huvānāḥ

translations.griffith: Wondrously first he rose aloft, defiant, in the Bull's lair, the homeof holy Order,  Longed-for, young, beautiful, and far-resplendent: and sevendear frieuds sprang up unto the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: ते मर्म्र्जत दद्र्वांसो अद्रिं तद एषाम अन्ये अभितो वि वोचन पश्वयन्त्रासो अभि कारम अर्चन विदन्त जयोतिश चक्र्पन्त धीभिः |||
verses.transliteration: te marmṛjata dadṛvāṃso adriṃ tad eṣām anye abhito vi vocan paśvayantrāso abhi kāram arcan vidanta jyotiś cakṛpanta dhībhiḥ

translations.griffith: Here did our human fathers take their places, fain to fulfil the sacred Law of worship.  Forth drave they, with loud call, Dawn's teeming Milch-kine bid in the mountainstable, in the cavern.

verses.sanskrit: ते गव्यता मनसा दर्ध्रम उब्धं गा येमानम परि षन्तम अद्रिम दर्ळ्हं नरो वचसा दैव्येन वरजं गोमन्तम उशिजो वि वव्रुः |||
verses.transliteration: te ghavyatā manasā dṛdhram ubdhaṃ ghā yemānam pari ṣantam adrim dṛḷhaṃ naro vacasā daivyena vrajaṃ ghomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ

translations.griffith: Splendid were they when they had rent the mountain: others, around, shall tell forth this their exploit.  They sang their song, prepared to free the cattle: they found the light; with holy hymns they worshipped.

verses.sanskrit: ते मन्वत परथमं नाम धेनोस तरिः सप्त मातुः परमाणि विन्दन तज जानतीर अभ्य अनूषत वरा आविर भुवद अरुणीर यशसा गोः |||
verses.transliteration: te manvata prathamaṃ nāma dhenos triḥ sapta mātuḥ paramāṇi vindan taj jānatīr abhy anūṣata vrā āvir bhuvad aruṇīr yaśasā ghoḥ

translations.griffith: Eager, with thought intent upon the booty, the men with their celestial speech threw open,  The solid mountain firm, compact, enclosing, confining Cows, the stable full of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: नेशत तमो दुधितं रोचत दयौर उद देव्या उषसो भानुर अर्त आ सूर्यो बर्हतस तिष्ठद अज्रां रजु मर्तेषु वर्जिना च पश्यन |||
verses.transliteration: neśat tamo dudhitaṃ rocata dyaur ud devyā uṣaso bhānur arta ā sūryo bṛhatas tiṣṭhad ajrāṃ ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan

translations.griffith: The Milch-cow's earliest name they comprehended: they found the Mother's thrice-seven noblest titles.  This the bands knew, and sent forth acclamation:with the Bull's sheen the Red One was apparent.

verses.sanskrit: आद इत पश्चा बुबुधाना वय अख्यन्न आद इद रत्नं धारयन्त दयुभक्तम विश्वे विश्वासु दुर्यासु देवा मित्र धिये वरुण सत्यम अस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: ād it paścā bubudhānā vy akhyann ād id ratnaṃ dhārayanta dyubhaktam viśve viśvāsu duryāsu devā mitra dhiye varuṇa satyam astu

translations.griffith: The turbid darkness fled, the heaven was sp, endid! up rose the bright beam of celestial Morning.  Sūrya ascended to the wide expanses, beholding deeds of men both good and evil.

verses.sanskrit: अछा वोचेय शुशुचानम अग्निं होतारं विश्वभरसं यजिष्ठम शुच्य ऊधो अत्र्णन न गवाम अन्धो न पूतम परिषिक्तम अंशोः |||
verses.transliteration: achā voceya śuśucānam aghniṃ hotāraṃ viśvabharasaṃ yajiṣṭham śucy ūdho atṛṇan na ghavām andho na pūtam pariṣiktam aṃśoḥ

translations.griffith: Then, afterwards they looked around, awakened, when first they held that Heaven allotted treasure.  Now all the Gods abide in all their dwellings. Varuṇa, Mitra, be the prayer effective.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वेषाम अदितिर यज्ञियानां विश्वेषाम अतिथिर मानुषाणाम अग्निर देवानाम अव आव्र्णानः सुम्र्ळीको भवतु जातवेदाः |||
verses.transliteration: viśveṣām aditir yajñiyānāṃ viśveṣām atithir mānuṣāṇām aghnir devānām ava āvṛṇānaḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatu jātavedāḥ

translations.griffith: I will call hither brightly-beaming Agni, the Herald, all-supporting, best at worship.  He hath disclosed, like the milch cows' pure udder, the Sorria's juice when cleansed and poured from beakers.

verses.sanskrit: यो मर्त्येष्व अम्र्त रतावा देवो देवेष्व अरतिर निधायि होता यजिष्ठो मह्ना शुचध्यै हव्यैर अग्निर मनुष ईरयध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: yo martyeṣv amṛta ṛtāvā devo deveṣv aratir nidhāyi hotā yajiṣṭho mahnā śucadhyai havyair aghnir manuṣa īrayadhyai

translations.griffith: THE, Faithful One, Immortal among mortals, a God among the Gods, appointed envoy,  Priest, best at worship, must shine forth in glory . Agni shall be raised high with man's oblations.

verses.sanskrit: इह तवं सूनो सहसो नो अद्य जातो जातां उभयां अन्तर अग्ने दूत ईयसे युयुजान रष्व रजुमुष्कान वर्षणः शुक्रांश च |||
verses.transliteration: iha tvaṃ sūno sahaso no adya jāto jātāṃ ubhayāṃ antar aghne dūta īyase yuyujāna ṛṣva ṛjumuṣkān vṛṣaṇaḥ śukrāṃś ca

translations.griffith: Born for us here this day, O Son of Vigour, between both races of born beings, Agni,  Thou farest as an envoy, having harnessed, Sublime One! thy strong-muscled radiant stallions.

verses.sanskrit: अत्या वर्धस्नू रोहिता घर्तस्नू रतस्य मन्ये मनसा जविष्ठा अन्तर ईयसे अरुषा युजानो युष्मांश च देवान विश आ च मर्तान |||
verses.transliteration: atyā vṛdhasnū rohitā ghṛtasnū ṛtasya manye manasā javiṣṭhā antar īyase aruṣā yujāno yuṣmāṃś ca devān viśa ā ca martān

translations.griffith: I laud the ruddy steeds who pour down blessing, dropping oil, flectest through the thoualit of Order.  Yoking red horses to and fro thou goest between you Deities and mortal races.

verses.sanskrit: अर्यमणं वरुणम मित्रम एषाम इन्द्राविष्णू मरुतो अश्विनोत सवश्वो अग्ने सुरथः सुराधा एद उ वह सुहविषे जनाय |||
verses.transliteration: aryamaṇaṃ varuṇam mitram eṣām indrāviṣṇū maruto aśvinota svaśvo aghne surathaḥ surādhā ed u vaha suhaviṣe janāya

translations.griffith: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, and Indra with Viṣṇu, of the Gods, Maruts and Aśvins-  These, Agni, with good car and steeds, bring hither, most bountiful, to folk with fair oblations.

verses.sanskrit: गोमां अग्ने ऽविमां अश्वी यज्ञो नर्वत्सखा सदम इद अप्रम्र्ष्यः इळावां एषो असुर परजावान दीर्घो रयिः पर्थुबुध्नः सभावान |||
verses.transliteration: ghomāṃ aghne 'vimāṃ aśvī yajño nṛvatsakhā sadam id apramṛṣyaḥ iḷāvāṃ eṣo asura prajāvān dīrgho rayiḥ pṛthubudhnaḥ sabhāvān

translations.griffith: Agni, be this our sacrifice eternal, with brave friends, rich in kine and sheep and horses,  Rich, Asura! in sacred food and children, in full assembly, wealth broad-based and during.

verses.sanskrit: यस त इध्मं जभरत सिष्विदानो मूर्धानं वा ततपते तवाया भुवस तस्य सवतवांः पायुर अग्ने विश्वस्मात सीम अघायत उरुष्य |||
verses.transliteration: yas ta idhmaṃ jabharat siṣvidāno mūrdhānaṃ vā tatapate tvāyā bhuvas tasya svatavāṃḥ pāyur aghne viśvasmāt sīm aghāyata uruṣya

translations.griffith: The man who, sweating, brings for thee the fuel, and makes his head to ache, thy faithful servant,—  Agni, to him be a self-strong Protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief.

verses.sanskrit: यस ते भराद अन्नियते चिद अन्नं निशिषन मन्द्रम अतिथिम उदीरत आ देवयुर इनधते दुरोणे तस्मिन रयिर धरुवो अस्तु दास्वान |||
verses.transliteration: yas te bharād anniyate cid annaṃ niśiṣan mandram atithim udīrat ā devayur inadhate duroṇe tasmin rayir dhruvo astu dāsvān

translations.griffith: Who brings thee food, though thou hast food in plenty, welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward,  Who kindles thee devoutly in his dwelling,to him be wealth secure and freely giving.

verses.sanskrit: यस तवा दोषा य उषसि परशंसात परियं वा तवा कर्णवते हविष्मान अश्वो न सवे दम आ हेम्यावान तम अंहसः पीपरो दाश्वांसम |||
verses.transliteration: yas tvā doṣā ya uṣasi praśaṃsāt priyaṃ vā tvā kṛṇavate haviṣmān aśvo na sve dama ā hemyāvān tam aṃhasaḥ pīparo dāśvāṃsam

translations.griffith: Whoso sings praise to thee at eve or morning, and, with oblation, doth the thing thou lovest,—  In his own home, even as a goId-girt courser, rescue him from distress, the bounteous giver.

verses.sanskrit: यस तुभ्यम अग्ने अम्र्ताय दाशद दुवस तवे कर्णवते यतस्रुक न स राया शशमानो वि योषन नैनम अंहः परि वरद अघायोः |||
verses.transliteration: yas tubhyam aghne amṛtāya dāśad duvas tve kṛṇavate yatasruk na sa rāyā śaśamāno vi yoṣan nainam aṃhaḥ pari varad aghāyoḥ

translations.griffith: Whoso brings gifts to thee Immortal, Agni, and doth thee service with uplifted ladle,—  Let him not, sorely toiling, lose his riches; let not the sinner's wickedness enclose him.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य तवम अग्ने अध्वरं जुजोषो देवो मर्तस्य सुधितं रराणः परीतेद असद धोत्रा सा यविष्ठासाम यस्य विधतो वर्धासः |||
verses.transliteration: yasya tvam aghne adhvaraṃ jujoṣo devo martasya sudhitaṃ rarāṇaḥ prīted asad dhotrā sā yaviṣṭhāsāma yasya vidhato vṛdhāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Whose well-wrought worship thou acceptest, Agni, thou God a mortal's gift, thou liberal Giver,—  Dear be his sacrifice to thee, Most Youthful! and may we strengthen him when he adores thee.

verses.sanskrit: चित्तिम अचित्तिं चिनवद वि विद्वान पर्ष्ठेव वीता वर्जिना च मर्तान राये च नः सवपत्याय देव दितिं च रास्वादितिम उरुष्य |||
verses.transliteration: cittim acittiṃ cinavad vi vidvān pṛṣṭheva vītā vṛjinā ca martān rāye ca naḥ svapatyāya deva ditiṃ ca rāsvāditim uruṣya

translations.griffith: May he who knows distinguish sense and folly of men, like straight and crooked backs of horses.  Lead us, O God, to wealth and noble offspring: keep penury afar and grant us plenty.

verses.sanskrit: कविं शशासुः कवयो ऽदब्धा निधारयन्तो दुर्यास्व आयोः अतस तवं दर्श्यां अग्न एतान पड्भिः पश्येर अद्भुतां अर्य एवैः |||
verses.transliteration: kaviṃ śaśāsuḥ kavayo 'dabdhā nidhārayanto duryāsv āyoḥ atas tvaṃ dṛśyāṃ aghna etān paḍbhiḥ paśyer adbhutāṃ arya evaiḥ

translations.griffith: This Sage the Sages, ne’er deceived, commanded, setting him down in dwellings of the living.  Hence mayst thou, friendly God, with rapid footsteps behold the Gods, wonderful, fair to look on.

verses.sanskrit: तवम अग्ने वाघते सुप्रणीतिः सुतसोमाय विधते यविष्ठ रत्नम भर शशमानाय घर्ष्वे पर्थु शचन्द्रम अवसे चर्षणिप्राः |||
verses.transliteration: tvam aghne vāghate supraṇītiḥ sutasomāya vidhate yaviṣṭha ratnam bhara śaśamānāya ghṛṣve pṛthu ścandram avase carṣaṇiprāḥ

translations.griffith: Good guidance hast thou for the priest, O Agni, who, Youngest God! with outpoured Soma serves thee.  Ruler of men, thou joyous God, bring treasure splendid and plentiful to aid the toiler.

verses.sanskrit: अधा ह यद वयम अग्ने तवाया पड्भिर हस्तेभिश चक्र्मा तनूभिः रथं न करन्तो अपसा भुरिजोर रतं येमुः सुध्य आशुषाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā ha yad vayam aghne tvāyā paḍbhir hastebhiś cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ rathaṃ na kranto apasā bhurijor ṛtaṃ yemuḥ sudhya āśuṣāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: Now all that we, thy faithful servants, Agni, have done with feet, with hands, and with our bodies,  The wise, with toil, the holy rite have guided, as those who frame a car with manual cunning.

verses.sanskrit: अधा मातुर उषसः सप्त विप्रा जायेमहि परथमा वेधसो नॄन दिवस पुत्रा अङगिरसो भवेमाद्रिं रुजेम धनिनं शुचन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā mātur uṣasaḥ sapta viprā jāyemahi prathamā vedhaso nṝn divas putrā aṅghiraso bhavemādriṃ rujema dhaninaṃ śucantaḥ

translations.griffith: May we, seven sages first in rank, engender, from Dawn the Mother, men to be ordainers.  May we, Aṅgirases, be sons of Heaven, and, radiant, burst the wealth-containing mountain.

verses.sanskrit: अधा यथा नः पितरः परासः परत्नासो अग्न रतम आशुषाणाः शुचीद अयन दीधितिम उक्थशासः कषामा भिन्दन्तो अरुणीर अप वरन |||
verses.transliteration: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāso aghna ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ śucīd ayan dīdhitim ukthaśāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindanto aruṇīr apa vran

translations.griffith: As in the days of old our ancient Fathers, speeding the work of holy worship, Agni,  Sought pure light and devotion, singing praises; they cleft the ground and made red Dawns apparent.

verses.sanskrit: सुकर्माणः सुरुचो देवयन्तो ऽयो न देवा जनिमा धमन्तः शुचन्तो अग्निं वव्र्धन्त इन्द्रम ऊर्वं गव्यम परिषदन्तो अग्मन |||
verses.transliteration: sukarmāṇaḥ suruco devayanto 'yo na devā janimā dhamantaḥ śucanto aghniṃ vavṛdhanta indram ūrvaṃ ghavyam pariṣadanto aghman

translations.griffith: Gods, doing holy acts, devout, resplendent, smelting like ore their human generations.  Enkindling Agni and exalting Indra, they came encompassing the stall of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: आ यूथेव कषुमति पश्वो अख्यद देवानां यज जनिमान्त्य उग्र मर्तानां चिद उर्वशीर अक्र्प्रन वर्धे चिद अर्य उपरस्यायोः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yūtheva kṣumati paśvo akhyad devānāṃ yaj janimānty ughra martānāṃ cid urvaśīr akṛpran vṛdhe cid arya uparasyāyoḥ

translations.griffith: Strong One! he marked them-and the Gods before them-like herds of cattle in a foodful pasture.  There they moaned forth their strong desire for mortals, to aid the True, the nearest One, the Living.

verses.sanskrit: अकर्म ते सवपसो अभूम रतम अवस्रन्न उषसो विभातीः अनूनम अग्निम पुरुधा सुश्चन्द्रं देवस्य मर्म्र्जतश चारु चक्षुः |||
verses.transliteration: akarma te svapaso abhūma ṛtam avasrann uṣaso vibhātīḥ anūnam aghnim purudhā suścandraṃ devasya marmṛjataś cāru cakṣuḥ

translations.griffith: We have worked for thee, we have laboured nobly-bright Dawns have shed their light upon our worship-  Adding a beauty to the perfect Agni, and the God's beauteous eye that shines for ever.

verses.sanskrit: एता ते अग्न उचथानि वेधो ऽवोचाम कवये ता जुषस्व उच छोचस्व कर्णुहि वस्यसो नो महो रायः पुरुवार पर यन्धि |||
verses.transliteration: etā te aghna ucathāni vedho 'vocāma kavaye tā juṣasva uc chocasva kṛṇuhi vasyaso no maho rāyaḥ puruvāra pra yandhi

translations.griffith: Agni, Disposer, we have sung these praises to thee the Wise: do thou accept them gladly.  Blaze up on high and ever make us richer. Give us great wealth, O thou whose boons are many.

verses.sanskrit: आ वो राजानम अध्वरस्य रुद्रं होतारं सत्ययजं रोदस्योः अग्निम पुरा तनयित्नोर अचित्ताद धिरण्यरूपम अवसे कर्णुध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vo rājānam adhvarasya rudraṃ hotāraṃ satyayajaṃ rodasyoḥ aghnim purā tanayitnor acittād dhiraṇyarūpam avase kṛṇudhvam

translations.griffith: WIN, to assist you, Rudra, Lord of worship, Priest of both worlds, effectual  Sacrificer,  Agni, invested with his golden colours, before the thunder strike and lay you senseless.

verses.sanskrit: अयं योनिश चक्र्मा यं वयं ते जायेव पत्य उशती सुवासाः अर्वाचीनः परिवीतो नि षीदेमा उ ते सवपाक परतीचीः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ yoniś cakṛmā yaṃ vayaṃ te jāyeva patya uśatī suvāsāḥ arvācīnaḥ parivīto ni ṣīdemā u te svapāka pratīcīḥ

translations.griffith: This shrine have we made ready for thy coming, as the fond dame attires her for her husband.  Performer of good work, sit down before us, invested while these flames incline to meet thee.

verses.sanskrit: आश्र्ण्वते अद्र्पिताय मन्म नर्चक्षसे सुम्र्ळीकाय वेधः देवाय शस्तिम अम्र्ताय शंस गरावेव सोता मधुषुद यम ईळे |||
verses.transliteration: āśṛṇvate adṛpitāya manma nṛcakṣase sumṛḷīkāya vedhaḥ devāya śastim amṛtāya śaṃsa ghrāveva sotā madhuṣud yam īḷe

translations.griffith: A hymn, O Priest, to him who hears, the gentle, to him who looks on men, exceeding gracious,  A song of praise sing to the God Immortal, whom the stone, presser of the sweet juice, worships.

verses.sanskrit: तवं चिन नः शम्या अग्ने अस्या रतस्य बोध्य रतचित सवाधीः कदा त उक्था सधमाद्यानि कदा भवन्ति सख्या गर्हे ते |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ cin naḥ śamyā aghne asyā ṛtasya bodhy ṛtacit svādhīḥ kadā ta ukthā sadhamādyāni kadā bhavanti sakhyā ghṛhe te

translations.griffith: Even as true knower of the Law, O Agni, to this our solemn rite he thou attentive.  When shall thy songs of festival be sung thee? When is thy friendship shown within our dwelling?

verses.sanskrit: कथा ह तद वरुणाय तवम अग्ने कथा दिवे गर्हसे कन न आगः कथा मित्राय मीळ्हुषे पर्थिव्यै बरवः कद अर्यम्णे कद भगाय |||
verses.transliteration: kathā ha tad varuṇāya tvam aghne kathā dive gharhase kan na āghaḥ kathā mitrāya mīḷhuṣe pṛthivyai bravaḥ kad aryamṇe kad bhaghāya

translations.griffith: Why this complaint to Varuṇa, O Agni? And why to Heaven? for what is our transgression?  How wilt thou speak to Earth and bounteous Mitra? What wilt thou say to Aryaman and Bhaga?

verses.sanskrit: कद धिष्ण्यासु वर्धसानो अग्ने कद वाताय परतवसे शुभंये परिज्मने नासत्याय कषे बरवः कद अग्ने रुद्राय नर्घ्ने |||
verses.transliteration: kad dhiṣṇyāsu vṛdhasāno aghne kad vātāya pratavase śubhaṃye parijmane nāsatyāya kṣe bravaḥ kad aghne rudrāya nṛghne

translations.griffith: What, when thou blazest on the lesser altars, what to the mighty Wind who comes to bless us,  True, circumambient? what to Earth, O Agni, what wilt thou say to man-destroying Rudra?

verses.sanskrit: कथा महे पुष्टिम्भराय पूष्णे कद रुद्राय सुमखाय हविर्दे कद विष्णव उरुगायाय रेतो बरवः कद अग्ने शरवे बर्हत्यै |||
verses.transliteration: kathā mahe puṣṭimbharāya pūṣṇe kad rudrāya sumakhāya havirde kad viṣṇava urughāyāya reto bravaḥ kad aghne śarave bṛhatyai

translations.griffith: How to great Pūṣan who promotes our welfare,—to honoured Rudra what, who gives oblations?  What sin of ours to the far-striding Viṣṇu, what, Agni, wilt thou tell the Lofty Arrow.

verses.sanskrit: कथा शर्धाय मरुताम रताय कथा सूरे बर्हते पर्छ्यमानः परति बरवो ऽदितये तुराय साधा दिवो जातवेदश चिकित्वान |||
verses.transliteration: kathā śardhāya marutām ṛtāya kathā sūre bṛhate pṛchyamānaḥ prati bravo 'ditaye turāya sādhā divo jātavedaś cikitvān

translations.griffith: What wilt thou tell the truthful band of Maruts, how answer the great Sun when thou art questioned?  Before the Free, before the Swift, defend us: fulfil heaven's work, all-knowing Jātavedas.

verses.sanskrit: रतेन रतं नियतम ईळ आ गोर आमा सचा मधुमत पक्वम अग्ने कर्ष्णा सती रुशता धासिनैषा जामर्येण पयसा पीपाय |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtena ṛtaṃ niyatam īḷa ā ghor āmā sacā madhumat pakvam aghne kṛṣṇā satī ruśatā dhāsinaiṣā jāmaryeṇa payasā pīpāya

translations.griffith: I crave the cow's true gift arranged by Order: though raw, she hath the sweet ripe juice, O Agni.  Though she is black of hue with milk she teemeth, nutritious, brightly shining, all-sustaining.

verses.sanskrit: रतेन हि षमा वर्षभश चिद अक्तः पुमां अग्निः पयसा पर्ष्ठ्य्न अस्पन्दमानो अचरद वयोधा वर्षा शुक्रं दुदुहे पर्श्निर ऊधः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtena hi ṣmā vṛṣabhaś cid aktaḥ pumāṃ aghniḥ payasā pṛṣṭhyna aspandamāno acarad vayodhā vṛṣā śukraṃ duduhe pṛśnir ūdhaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni the Bull, the manly, hath been sprinkled with oil upon his back, by Law eternal.  He who gives vital power goes on unswerving. Pṛśni the Bull hath milked the pure wiiite udder.

verses.sanskrit: रतेनाद्रिं वय असन भिदन्तः सम अङगिरसो नवन्त गोभिः शुनं नरः परि षदन्न उषासम आविः सवर अभवज जाते अग्नौ |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtenādriṃ vy asan bhidantaḥ sam aṅghiraso navanta ghobhiḥ śunaṃ naraḥ pari ṣadann uṣāsam āviḥ svar abhavaj jāte aghnau

translations.griffith: By Law the Aṅgirases cleft the rock asunder, and sang their hymns together with the cattle.  Bringing great bliss the men encompassed Morning: light was apparent at the birth of Agni.

verses.sanskrit: रतेन देवीर अम्र्ता अम्र्क्ता अर्णोभिर आपो मधुमद्भिर अग्ने वाजी न सर्गेषु परस्तुभानः पर सदम इत सरवितवे दधन्युः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtena devīr amṛtā amṛktā arṇobhir āpo madhumadbhir aghne vājī na sargheṣu prastubhānaḥ pra sadam it sravitave dadhanyuḥ

translations.griffith: By Law the Immortal Goddesses the Waters, with meath-rich waves, O Agni, and uninjured,  Like a strong courser lauded in his running, sped to flow onward swiftly and for ever.

verses.sanskrit: मा कस्य यक्षं सदम इद धुरो गा मा वेशस्य परमिनतो मापेः मा भरातुर अग्ने अन्र्जोर रणं वेर मा सख्युर दक्षं रिपोर भुजेम |||
verses.transliteration: mā kasya yakṣaṃ sadam id dhuro ghā mā veśasya praminato māpeḥ mā bhrātur aghne anṛjor ṛṇaṃ ver mā sakhyur dakṣaṃ ripor bhujema

translations.griffith: Go never to the feast of one who harms us, the treacherous neighbour or unworthy kinsman.  Punish us not for a false brother's trespass. Let us not feel the might of friend or foeman.

verses.sanskrit: रक्षा णो अग्ने तव रक्षणेभी रारक्षाणः सुमख परीणानः परति षफुर वि रुज वीड्व अंहो जहि रक्षो महि चिद वाव्र्धानम |||
verses.transliteration: rakṣā ṇo aghne tava rakṣaṇebhī rārakṣāṇaḥ sumakha prīṇānaḥ prati ṣphura vi ruja vīḍv aṃho jahi rakṣo mahi cid vāvṛdhānam

translations.griffith: O Agni, keep us safe with thy protection, loving us, honoured God! and ever guarding.  Beat thou away,  destroy  severe affliction slay e’en the demon when he waxes mighty.

verses.sanskrit: एभिर भव सुमना अग्ने अर्कैर इमान सप्र्श मन्मभिः शूर वाजान उत बरह्माण्य अङगिरो जुषस्व सं ते शस्तिर देववाता जरेत |||
verses.transliteration: ebhir bhava sumanā aghne arkair imān spṛśa manmabhiḥ śūra vājān uta brahmāṇy aṅghiro juṣasva saṃ te śastir devavātā jareta

translations.griffith: Through these our songs of praise be gracious, Agni; moved by our prayers, O Hero, touch our viands.  Accept, O Aṅgiras, these our devotions, and let the praise which Gods desire address thee.

verses.sanskrit: एता विश्वा विदुषे तुभ्यं वेधो नीथान्य अग्ने निण्या वचांसि निवचना कवये काव्यान्य अशंसिषम मतिभिर विप्र उक्थैः |||
verses.transliteration: etā viśvā viduṣe tubhyaṃ vedho nīthāny aghne niṇyā vacāṃsi nivacanā kavaye kāvyāny aśaṃsiṣam matibhir vipra ukthaiḥ

translations.griffith: To thee who knowest, Agni, thou Disposer, all these wise secret speeches have I uttered,  Sung to thee, Sage, the charming words of wisdom, to thee, O Singer, with. my thoughts and Praises.

verses.sanskrit: कर्णुष्व पाजः परसितिं न पर्थ्वीं याहि राजेवामवां इभेन तर्ष्वीम अनु परसितिं दरूणानो ऽसतासि विध्य रक्षसस तपिष्ठैः |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitiṃ na pṛthvīṃ yāhi rājevāmavāṃ ibhena tṛṣvīm anu prasitiṃ drūṇāno 'stāsi vidhya rakṣasas tapiṣṭhaiḥ

translations.griffith: PUT forth like a wide-spreading net thy vigour; go like a mighty King with his attendants.  Thou, following thy swift net, shootest arrows: transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.

verses.sanskrit: तव भरमास आशुया पतन्त्य अनु सप्र्श धर्षता शोशुचानः तपूंष्य अग्ने जुह्वा पतंगान असंदितो वि सर्ज विष्वग उल्काः |||
verses.transliteration: tava bhramāsa āśuyā patanty anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ tapūṃṣy aghne juhvā pataṃghān asaṃdito vi sṛja viṣvagh ulkāḥ

translations.griffith: Forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons: follow them closely, glowing in thy fury.  Spread with thy tongue the winged flames, O Agni; unfettered, cast thy firebrands all around thee.

verses.sanskrit: परति सपशो वि सर्ज तूर्णितमो भवा पायुर विशो अस्या अदब्धः यो नो दूरे अघशंसो यो अन्त्य अग्ने माकिष टे वयथिर आ दधर्षीत |||
verses.transliteration: prati spaśo vi sṛja tūrṇitamo bhavā pāyur viśo asyā adabdhaḥ yo no dūre aghaśaṃso yo anty aghne mākiṣ ṭe vyathir ā dadharṣīt

translations.griffith: Send thy spies forward, fleetest in thy motion; be, ne’er deceived, the guardian of this people  From him who, near or far, is bent on evil, and let no trouble sent from thee o’ercome us.

verses.sanskrit: उद अग्ने तिष्ठ परत्य आ तनुष्व नय अमित्रां ओषतात तिग्महेते यो नो अरातिं समिधान चक्रे नीचा तं धक्ष्य अतसं न शुष्कम |||
verses.transliteration: ud aghne tiṣṭha praty ā tanuṣva ny amitrāṃ oṣatāt tighmahete yo no arātiṃ samidhāna cakre nīcā taṃ dhakṣy atasaṃ na śuṣkam

translations.griffith: Rise up, O Agni, spread thee out before us: burn down our foes, thou who hast sharpened arrows.  Him, blazing Agni! who hath worked us mischief, consume thou utterly like dried-up stubble.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो भव परति विध्याध्य अस्मद आविष कर्णुष्व दैव्यान्य अग्ने अव सथिरा तनुहि यातुजूनां जामिम अजामिम पर मर्णीहि शत्रून |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvo bhava prati vidhyādhy asmad āviṣ kṛṇuṣva daivyāny aghne ava sthirā tanuhi yātujūnāṃ jāmim ajāmim pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn

translations.griffith: Rise, Agni, drive off those who fight against us: make manifest thine own celestial vigour.  Slacken the strong bows of the demon-driven: destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger.

verses.sanskrit: स ते जानाति सुमतिं यविष्ठ य ईवते बरह्मणे गातुम ऐरत विश्वान्य अस्मै सुदिनानि रायो दयुम्नान्य अर्यो वि दुरो अभि दयौत |||
verses.transliteration: sa te jānāti sumatiṃ yaviṣṭha ya īvate brahmaṇe ghātum airat viśvāny asmai sudināni rāyo dyumnāny aryo vi duro abhi dyaut

translations.griffith: Most Youthful God, he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion.  All fair days and magnificence of riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good man's portals.

verses.sanskrit: सेद अग्ने अस्तु सुभगः सुदानुर यस तवा नित्येन हविषा य उक्थैः पिप्रीषति सव आयुषि दुरोणे विश्वेद अस्मै सुदिना सासद इष्टिः |||
verses.transliteration: sed aghne astu subhaghaḥ sudānur yas tvā nityena haviṣā ya ukthaiḥ piprīṣati sva āyuṣi duroṇe viśved asmai sudinā sāsad iṣṭiḥ

translations.griffith: Blest, Agni, be the man, the liberal giver, who with his lauds and regular oblation  Is fain to please thee for his life and dwelling. May all his days be bright: be this his longing.

verses.sanskrit: अर्चामि ते सुमतिं घोष्य अर्वाक सं ते वावाता जरताम इयं गीः सवश्वास तवा सुरथा मर्जयेमास्मे कषत्राणि धारयेर अनु दयून |||
verses.transliteration: arcāmi te sumatiṃ ghoṣy arvāk saṃ te vāvātā jaratām iyaṃ ghīḥ svaśvās tvā surathā marjayemāsme kṣatrāṇi dhārayer anu dyūn

translations.griffith: I praise thy gracious favour: sing in answer. May this my song sing like a loved one with thee.  Lords of good steeds and cars may we adorn thee, and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion.

verses.sanskrit: इह तवा भूर्य आ चरेद उप तमन दोषावस्तर दीदिवांसम अनु दयून करीळन्तस तवा सुमनसः सपेमाभि दयुम्ना तस्थिवांसो जनानाम |||
verses.transliteration: iha tvā bhūry ā cared upa tman doṣāvastar dīdivāṃsam anu dyūn krīḷantas tvā sumanasaḥ sapemābhi dyumnā tasthivāṃso janānām

translations.griffith: Here of free choice let each one serve thee richly, resplendent day by day at eve and morning.  So may we honour thee, content and joyous, passing beyond the glories of the people.

verses.sanskrit: यस तवा सवश्वः सुहिरण्यो अग्न उपयाति वसुमता रथेन तस्य तराता भवसि तस्य सखा यस त आतिथ्यम आनुषग जुजोषत |||
verses.transliteration: yas tvā svaśvaḥ suhiraṇyo aghna upayāti vasumatā rathena tasya trātā bhavasi tasya sakhā yas ta ātithyam ānuṣagh jujoṣat

translations.griffith: Whoso with good steeds and fine gold, O Agni, comes nigh thee on a car laden with treasure,  His Friend art thou, yea, thou art his Protector whose joy it is to entertain thee duly.

verses.sanskrit: महो रुजामि बन्धुता वचोभिस तन मा पितुर गोतमाद अन्व इयाय तवं नो अस्य वचसश चिकिद्धि होतर यविष्ठ सुक्रतो दमूनाः |||
verses.transliteration: maho rujāmi bandhutā vacobhis tan mā pitur ghotamād anv iyāya tvaṃ no asya vacasaś cikiddhi hotar yaviṣṭha sukrato damūnāḥ

translations.griffith: Through words and kinship I destroy the mighty: this power I have from Gotama my father.  Mark thou this speech of ours, O thou Most Youthful, Friend of the House, exceeding wise, Invoker.

verses.sanskrit: अस्वप्नजस तरणयः सुशेवा अतन्द्रासो ऽवर्का अश्रमिष्ठाः ते पायवः सध्र्यञ्चो निषद्याग्ने तव नः पान्त्व अमूर |||
verses.transliteration: asvapnajas taraṇayaḥ suśevā atandrāso 'vṛkā aśramiṣṭhāḥ te pāyavaḥ sadhryañco niṣadyāghne tava naḥ pāntv amūra

translations.griffith: Knowing no slumber, speedy and propitious, alert and ever friendly, most unwearied,  May thy protecting powers, unerring Agni, taking their places here, combined, preserve us.

verses.sanskrit: ये पायवो मामतेयं ते अग्ने पश्यन्तो अन्धं दुरिताद अरक्षन ररक्ष तान सुक्र्तो विश्ववेदा दिप्सन्त इद रिपवो नाह देभुः |||
verses.transliteration: ye pāyavo māmateyaṃ te aghne paśyanto andhaṃ duritād arakṣan rarakṣa tān sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ

translations.griffith: Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Māmateya from affliction.  Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious: the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief

verses.sanskrit: तवया वयं सधन्यस तवोतास तव परणीत्य अश्याम वाजान उभा शंसा सूदय सत्यताते ऽनुष्ठुया कर्णुह्य अह्रयाण |||
verses.transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ sadhanyas tvotās tava praṇīty aśyāma vājān ubhā śaṃsā sūdaya satyatāte 'nuṣṭhuyā kṛṇuhy ahrayāṇa

translations.griffith: Aided by thee with thee may we be wealthy, may we gain strength with thee to guide us onward.  Fulfil the words of both, O Ever Truthful: straightway do this, thou God whom power emboldens.

verses.sanskrit: अया ते अग्ने समिधा विधेम परति सतोमं शस्यमानं गर्भाय दहाशसो रक्षसः पाह्य अस्मान दरुहो निदो मित्रमहो अवद्यात |||
verses.transliteration: ayā te aghne samidhā vidhema prati stomaṃ śasyamānaṃ ghṛbhāya dahāśaso rakṣasaḥ pāhy asmān druho nido mitramaho avadyāt

translations.griffith: O Agni, with this fuel will we serve thee; accept the laud we sing to thee with favour  Destroy the cursing Rākṣasas: preserve us, O rich in friends, from guile and scorn and slander.

verses.sanskrit: वैश्वानराय मीळ्हुषे सजोषाः कथा दाशेमाग्नये बर्हद भाः अनूनेन बर्हता वक्षथेनोप सतभायद उपमिन न रोधः |||
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarāya mīḷhuṣe sajoṣāḥ kathā dāśemāghnaye bṛhad bhāḥ anūnena bṛhatā vakṣathenopa stabhāyad upamin na rodhaḥ

translations.griffith: How shall we give with one accord oblation to Agni, to Vaiśvānara the Bounteous?  Great light, with full high growth hath he uplifted, and, as a pillar bears the roof, sustains it.

verses.sanskrit: मा निन्दत य इमाम मह्यं रातिं देवो ददौ मर्त्याय सवधावान पाकाय गर्त्सो अम्र्तो विचेता वैश्वानरो नर्तमो यह्वो अग्निः |||
verses.transliteration: mā nindata ya imām mahyaṃ rātiṃ devo dadau martyāya svadhāvān pākāya ghṛtso amṛto vicetā vaiśvānaro nṛtamo yahvo aghniḥ

translations.griffith: Reproach not him who, God and self-reliant, vouchsafed this bounty unto me a mortal,—  Deathless, discerner, wise, to me the simple, Vaiśvānara most manly, youthful Agni.

verses.sanskrit: साम दविबर्हा महि तिग्मभ्र्ष्टिः सहस्ररेता वर्षभस तुविष्मान पदं न गोर अपगूळ्हं विविद्वान अग्निर मह्यम परेद उ वोचन मनीषाम |||
verses.transliteration: sāma dvibarhā mahi tighmabhṛṣṭiḥ sahasraretā vṛṣabhas tuviṣmān padaṃ na ghor apaghūḷhaṃ vividvān aghnir mahyam pred u vocan manīṣām

translations.griffith: Sharp-pointed, powerful, strong, of boundless vigour, Agni who knows the lofty hymn, kept secret  As the lost milch-cow's track, the doubly Mighty,—he hath declared to me this hidden knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: पर तां अग्निर बभसत तिग्मजम्भस तपिष्ठेन शोचिषा यः सुराधाः पर ये मिनन्ति वरुणस्य धाम परिया मित्रस्य चेततो धरुवाणि |||
verses.transliteration: pra tāṃ aghnir babhasat tighmajambhas tapiṣṭhena śociṣā yaḥ surādhāḥ pra ye minanti varuṇasya dhāma priyā mitrasya cetato dhruvāṇi

translations.griffith: May he with sharpened teeth, the Bounteous Giver, Agni, consume with flame most fiercely glowing.  Those who regard not Varuṇa's commandments and the dear stedfast laws of sapient Mitra.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्रातरो न योषणो वयन्तः पतिरिपो न जनयो दुरेवाः पापासः सन्तो अन्र्ता असत्या इदम पदम अजनता गभीरम |||
verses.transliteration: abhrātaro na yoṣaṇo vyantaḥ patiripo na janayo durevāḥ pāpāsaḥ santo anṛtā asatyā idam padam ajanatā ghabhīram

translations.griffith: Like youthful women without brothers, straying, like dames who hate their lords, of evil conduct,  They who are full of sin, untrue, unfaithful, they have engendered this abysmal station.

verses.sanskrit: इदम मे अग्ने कियते पावकामिनते गुरुम भारं न मन्म बर्हद दधाथ धर्षता गभीरं यह्वम पर्ष्ठम परयसा सप्तधातु |||
verses.transliteration: idam me aghne kiyate pāvakāminate ghurum bhāraṃ na manma bṛhad dadhātha dhṛṣatā ghabhīraṃ yahvam pṛṣṭham prayasā saptadhātu

translations.griffith: To me, weak, innocent, thou, luminous Agni, hast boldly given as ’twere a heavy burthen,  This Pṛṣṭha hymn, profound and strong and mighty, of seven elements, and with offered dainties.

verses.sanskrit: तम इन नव एव समना समानम अभि करत्वा पुनती धीतिर अश्याः ससस्य चर्मन्न अधि चारु पर्श्नेर अग्रे रुप आरुपितं जबारु |||
verses.transliteration: tam in nv eva samanā samānam abhi kratvā punatī dhītir aśyāḥ sasasya carmann adhi cāru pṛśner aghre rupa ārupitaṃ jabāru

translations.griffith: So may our song that purifies, through wisdom reach in a moment him the Universal,  Established on the height, on earth's best station, above the beauteous grassy skin of Pṛśni.

verses.sanskrit: परवाच्यं वचसः किम मे अस्य गुहा हितम उप निणिग वदन्ति यद उस्रियाणाम अप वार इव वरन पाति परियं रुपो अग्रम पदं वेः |||
verses.transliteration: pravācyaṃ vacasaḥ kim me asya ghuhā hitam upa niṇigh vadanti yad usriyāṇām apa vār iva vran pāti priyaṃ rupo aghram padaṃ veḥ

translations.griffith: Of this my speech what shall I utter further? They indicate the milk stored up in secret  When they have thrown as ’twere the cows' stalls open. The Bird protects earths’ best and well-loved station.

verses.sanskrit: इदम उ तयन महि महाम अनीकं यद उस्रिया सचत पूर्व्यं गौः रतस्य पदे अधि दीद्यानं गुहा रघुष्यद रघुयद विवेद |||
verses.transliteration: idam u tyan mahi mahām anīkaṃ yad usriyā sacata pūrvyaṃ ghauḥ ṛtasya pade adhi dīdyānaṃ ghuhā raghuṣyad raghuyad viveda

translations.griffith: This is the Great Ones’ mighty apparition which from of old the radiant Cow hath followed.  This, shining brightly in the place of Order, swift, hasting on in secret, she discovered.

verses.sanskrit: अध दयुतानः पित्रोः सचासामनुत गुह्यं चारु पर्श्नेः मातुष पदे परमे अन्ति षद गोर वर्ष्णः शोचिषः परयतस्य जिह्वा |||
verses.transliteration: adha dyutānaḥ pitroḥ sacāsāmanuta ghuhyaṃ cāru pṛśneḥ mātuṣ pade parame anti ṣad ghor vṛṣṇaḥ śociṣaḥ prayatasya jihvā

translations.griffith: He then who shone together with his Parents remembered Pṛśni's fair and secret treasure,  Which, in the Mother Cow's most lofty station, the Bull's tongue, of the flame bent forward, tasted.

verses.sanskrit: रतं वोचे नमसा पर्छ्यमानस तवाशसा जातवेदो यदीदम तवम अस्य कषयसि यद ध विश्वं दिवि यद उ दरविणं यत पर्थिव्याम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtaṃ voce namasā pṛchyamānas tavāśasā jātavedo yadīdam tvam asya kṣayasi yad dha viśvaṃ divi yad u draviṇaṃ yat pṛthivyām

translations.griffith: With reverence I declare the Law, O Agni; what is, comes by thine order, Jātavedas.  Of this, whate’er it be, thou art the Sovran, yea, all the wealth that is in earth or  heaven.

verses.sanskrit: किं नो अस्य दरविणं कद ध रत्नं वि नो वोचो जातवेदश चिकित्वान गुहाध्वनः परमं यन नो अस्य रेकु पदं न निदाना अगन्म |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ no asya draviṇaṃ kad dha ratnaṃ vi no voco jātavedaś cikitvān ghuhādhvanaḥ paramaṃ yan no asya reku padaṃ na nidānā aghanma

translations.griffith: What is our wealth therefrom, and what our treasure? Tell us O Jātavedas, for thou  knowest,  What is our best course in this secret passage: we, unreproached, have reached a place far distant.

verses.sanskrit: का मर्यादा वयुना कद ध वामम अछा गमेम रघवो न वाजम कदा नो देवीर अम्र्तस्य पत्नीः सूरो वर्णेन ततनन्न उषासः |||
verses.transliteration: kā maryādā vayunā kad dha vāmam achā ghamema raghavo na vājam kadā no devīr amṛtasya patnīḥ sūro varṇena tatanann uṣāsaḥ

translations.griffith: What is the limit, what the rules, the guerdon? Like fleet-foot coursers speed we to the contest.  When will the Goddesses, the Immortal's Spouses, the Dawns, spread over us the Sun-God's splendour?

verses.sanskrit: अनिरेण वचसा फल्ग्वेन परतीत्येन कर्धुनात्र्पासः अधा ते अग्ने किम इहा वदन्त्य अनायुधास आसता सचन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: anireṇa vacasā phalghvena pratītyena kṛdhunātṛpāsaḥ adhā te aghne kim ihā vadanty anāyudhāsa āsatā sacantām

translations.griffith: Unsatisfied, with speech devoid of vigour, scanty and frivolous and inconclusive,  Wherefore do they address thee here, O Agni? Let these who have no weapons suffer sorrow.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य शरिये समिधानस्य वर्ष्णो वसोर अनीकं दम आ रुरोच रुशद वसानः सुद्र्शीकरूपः कषितिर न राया पुरुवारो अद्यौत |||
verses.transliteration: asya śriye samidhānasya vṛṣṇo vasor anīkaṃ dama ā ruroca ruśad vasānaḥ sudṛśīkarūpaḥ kṣitir na rāyā puruvāro adyaut

translations.griffith: The majesty of him the Good, the Mighty, aflame, hath shone for glory in the dwelling.  He, clothed in light, hath shone most fair to look on, wealthy in boons, as a home shines with riches.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्व ऊ षु णो अध्वरस्य होतर अग्ने तिष्ठ देवताता यजीयान तवं हि विश्वम अभ्य असि मन्म पर वेधसश चित तिरसि मनीषाम |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇo adhvarasya hotar aghne tiṣṭha devatātā yajīyān tvaṃ hi viśvam abhy asi manma pra vedhasaś cit tirasi manīṣām

translations.griffith: PRIEST of our rite, stand up erect, O Agni, in the Gods’ service best of sacrificers,  For over evei y thought thou art the Ruler: thou furtherest e’en the wisdom of the pious.

verses.sanskrit: अमूरो होता नय असादि विक्ष्व अग्निर मन्द्रो विदथेषु परचेताः ऊर्ध्वम भानुं सवितेवाश्रेन मेतेव धूमं सतभायद उप दयाम |||
verses.transliteration: amūro hotā ny asādi vikṣv aghnir mandro vidatheṣu pracetāḥ ūrdhvam bhānuṃ savitevāśren meteva dhūmaṃ stabhāyad upa dyām

translations.griffith: He was set down mid men as Priest unerring, Agni, wise, welcome in our holy synods.  Like Savitar he hath lifted up his splendour, and like a builder raised his smoke to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यता सुजूर्णी रातिनी घर्ताची परदक्षिणिद देवतातिम उराणः उद उ सवरुर नवजा नाक्रः पश्वो अनक्ति सुधितः सुमेकः |||
verses.transliteration: yatā sujūrṇī rātinī ghṛtācī pradakṣiṇid devatātim urāṇaḥ ud u svarur navajā nākraḥ paśvo anakti sudhitaḥ sumekaḥ

translations.griffith: The glowing ladle, filled with oil, is lifted; choosing Gods’ service to the right he circles.  Eager he rises like the new-wrought pillar which, firmly set and fixed, anoints the victims.

verses.sanskrit: सतीर्णे बर्हिषि समिधाने अग्ना ऊर्ध्वो अध्वर्युर जुजुषाणो अस्थात पर्य अग्निः पशुपा न होता तरिविष्ट्य एति परदिव उराणः |||
verses.transliteration: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne aghnā ūrdhvo adhvaryur jujuṣāṇo asthāt pary aghniḥ paśupā na hotā triviṣṭy eti pradiva urāṇaḥ

translations.griffith: When sacred grass is strewn and Agni kindled, the Adhvaryu rises to, his task rejoicing.  Agni the Priest, like one who tends the cattle, goes three times round, as from of old he wills it.

verses.sanskrit: परि तमना मितद्रुर एति होताग्निर मन्द्रो मधुवचा रतावा दरवन्त्य अस्य वाजिनो न शोका भयन्ते विश्वा भुवना यद अभ्राट |||
verses.transliteration: pari tmanā mitadrur eti hotāghnir mandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā dravanty asya vājino na śokā bhayante viśvā bhuvanā yad abhrāṭ

translations.griffith: Agni himself, the Priest, with measured motion, goes round, with sweet speech, cheerful, true to Order.  His fulgent flames run forth like vigorous horses; all creatures are affrighted when he blazes.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रा ते अग्ने सवनीक संद्र्ग घोरस्य सतो विषुणस्य चारुः न यत ते शोचिस तमसा वरन्त न धवस्मानस तन्व रेप आ धुः |||
verses.transliteration: bhadrā te aghne svanīka saṃdṛgh ghorasya sato viṣuṇasya cāruḥ na yat te śocis tamasā varanta na dhvasmānas tanv repa ā dhuḥ

translations.griffith: Beautiful and auspicious is thine aspect, O lovely Agni, terrible when spreading.  Thy splendours are not covered by the darkness: detraction leaves no stain upon thy body.

verses.sanskrit: न यस्य सातुर जनितोर अवारि न मातरापितरा नू चिद इष्टौ अधा मित्रो न सुधितः पावको ऽगनिर दीदाय मानुषीषु विक्षु |||
verses.transliteration: na yasya sātur janitor avāri na mātarāpitarā nū cid iṣṭau adhā mitro na sudhitaḥ pāvako 'ghnir dīdāya mānuṣīṣu vikṣu

translations.griffith: Naught hindered his production, Bounteous Giver: his Mother and his Sire were free to send him.  Then as Friend benevolent, refulgent, Agni shone forth in human habitations.

verses.sanskrit: दविर यम पञ्च जीजनन संवसानाः सवसारो अग्निम मानुषीषु विक्षु उषर्बुधम अथर्यो न दन्तं शुक्रं सवासम परशुं न तिग्मम |||
verses.transliteration: dvir yam pañca jījanan saṃvasānāḥ svasāro aghnim mānuṣīṣu vikṣu uṣarbudham atharyo na dantaṃ śukraṃ svāsam paraśuṃ na tighmam

translations.griffith: He, Agni, whom the twice-five sisters, dwelling together, in the homes of men engendered,  Bright like a spear's tooth, wakened in the morning, with powerful mouth and like an axe well-sharpened.

verses.sanskrit: तव तये अग्ने हरितो घर्तस्ना रोहितास रज्वञ्चः सवञ्चः अरुषासो वर्षण रजुमुष्का आ देवतातिम अह्वन्त दस्माः |||
verses.transliteration: tava tye aghne harito ghṛtasnā rohitāsa ṛjvañcaḥ svañcaḥ aruṣāso vṛṣaṇa ṛjumuṣkā ā devatātim ahvanta dasmāḥ

translations.griffith: These thy Bay Coursers, Agni, dropping fatness, ruddy vigorous, speeding straightly forward,  And red steeds, wonderful, of mighty muscle, are to this service of the Gods invited:

verses.sanskrit: ये ह तये ते सहमाना अयासस तवेषासो अग्ने अर्चयश चरन्ति शयेनासो न दुवसनासो अर्थं तुविष्वणसो मारुतं न शर्धः |||
verses.transliteration: ye ha tye te sahamānā ayāsas tveṣāso aghne arcayaś caranti śyenāso na duvasanāso arthaṃ tuviṣvaṇaso mārutaṃ na śardhaḥ

translations.griffith: These brightly-shining games of thine, O Agni, that move for ever restless, all-subduing,  Like falcons hasting eagerly to the quarry, roar loudly like the army of the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit: अकारि बरह्म समिधान तुभ्यं शंसात्य उक्थं यजते वय धाः होतारम अग्निम मनुषो नि षेदुर नमस्यन्त उशिजः शंसम आयोः |||
verses.transliteration: akāri brahma samidhāna tubhyaṃ śaṃsāty ukthaṃ yajate vy dhāḥ hotāram aghnim manuṣo ni ṣedur namasyanta uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ

translations.griffith: To thee, O flaming God, hath prayer been offered. Let the priest laud thee: give to him who worships.  Men have established Agni as Invoker, fain to adore the glory of the living.

verses.sanskrit: अयम इह परथमो धायि धात्र्भिर होता यजिष्ठो अध्वरेष्व ईड्यः यम अप्नवानो भर्गवो विरुरुचुर वनेषु चित्रं विभ्वं विशे-विशे |||
verses.transliteration: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ yam apnavāno bhṛghavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṃ vibhvaṃ viśe-viśe

translations.griffith: HERE by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best at worship, to be praised at rites:  Whom Apnavāna, and the Bhṛgus caused to shine bright-coloured in the wood, spreading from home to home.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने कदा त आनुषग भुवद देवस्य चेतनम अधा हि तवा जग्र्भ्रिरे मर्तासो विक्ष्व ईड्यम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne kadā ta ānuṣagh bhuvad devasya cetanam adhā hi tvā jaghṛbhrire martāso vikṣv īḍyam

translations.griffith: When shall thy glory as a God, Agni, be suddenly shown forth.  For mortal men have held thee fast, adorable in all their homes,

verses.sanskrit: रतावानं विचेतसम पश्यन्तो दयाम इव सत्र्भिः विश्वेषाम अध्वराणां हस्कर्तारं दमे-दमे |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtāvānaṃ vicetasam paśyanto dyām iva stṛbhiḥ viśveṣām adhvarāṇāṃ haskartāraṃ dame-dame

translations.griffith: Seeing thee faithful to the Law, most sapient, like the starry heaven,  Illumining with cheerful ray each solemn rite in every house.

verses.sanskrit: आशुं दूतं विवस्वतो विश्वा यश चर्षणीर अभि आ जभ्रुः केतुम आयवो भर्गवाणं विशे-विशे |||
verses.transliteration: āśuṃ dūtaṃ vivasvato viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhi ā jabhruḥ ketum āyavo bhṛghavāṇaṃ viśe-viśe

translations.griffith: Vivasvān's envoy living men have taken as their ensign, swift,  The ruler over all mankind, moving like Bhṛgu in each home.

verses.sanskrit: तम ईं होतारम आनुषक चिकित्वांसं नि षेदिरे रण्वम पावकशोचिषं यजिष्ठं सप्त धामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: tam īṃ hotāram ānuṣak cikitvāṃsaṃ ni ṣedire raṇvam pāvakaśociṣaṃ yajiṣṭhaṃ sapta dhāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Him the intelligent have they placed duly as Invoking Priest,  Welcome, with sanctifying flame, best worshipper, with sevenfold might;

verses.sanskrit: तं शश्वतीषु मात्र्षु वन आ वीतम अश्रितम चित्रं सन्तं गुहा हितं सुवेदं कूचिदर्थिनम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ śaśvatīṣu mātṛṣu vana ā vītam aśritam citraṃ santaṃ ghuhā hitaṃ suvedaṃ kūcidarthinam

translations.griffith: In his Eternal Mothers, in the wood, concealed and unapproached,  Kept secret though his flames are bright seeking on all sides, quickly found.

verses.sanskrit: ससस्य यद वियुता सस्मिन्न ऊधन्न रतस्य धामन रणयन्त देवाः महां अग्निर नमसा रातहव्यो वेर अध्वराय सदम इद रतावा |||
verses.transliteration: sasasya yad viyutā sasminn ūdhann ṛtasya dhāman raṇayanta devāḥ mahāṃ aghnir namasā rātahavyo ver adhvarāya sadam id ṛtāvā

translations.griffith: That as food spreads forth in this earthly udder, Gods may rejoice them in the home of Order,  Great Agni, served with reverence and oblation, flies ever to the sacrifice, the Faithful.

verses.sanskrit: वेर अध्वरस्य दूत्यानि विद्वान उभे अन्ता रोदसी संचिकित्वान दूत ईयसे परदिव उराणो विदुष्टरो दिव आरोधनानि |||
verses.transliteration: ver adhvarasya dūtyāni vidvān ubhe antā rodasī saṃcikitvān dūta īyase pradiva urāṇo viduṣṭaro diva ārodhanāni

translations.griffith: Bird of each rite, skilled in an envoy's duties, knowing both worlds and that which lies between them,  Thou goest from of old a willing Herald, knowing full well heaven's innermost recesses.

verses.sanskrit: कर्ष्णं त एम रुशतः पुरो भाश चरिष्ण्व अर्चिर वपुषाम इद एकम यद अप्रवीता दधते ह गर्भं सद्यश चिज जातो भवसीद उ दूतः |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṣṇaṃ ta ema ruśataḥ puro bhāś cariṣṇv arcir vapuṣām id ekam yad apravītā dadhate ha gharbhaṃ sadyaś cij jāto bhavasīd u dūtaḥ

translations.griffith: Bright God, thy path is black: light is before thee: thy moving splendour is the chief of wonders.  When she, yet unimpregnate, hath conceived thee, even when newly born thou art an envoy.

verses.sanskrit: सद्यो जातस्य दद्र्शानम ओजो यद अस्य वातो अनुवाति शोचिः वर्णक्ति तिग्माम अतसेषु जिह्वां सथिरा चिद अन्ना दयते वि जम्भैः |||
verses.transliteration: sadyo jātasya dadṛśānam ojo yad asya vāto anuvāti śociḥ vṛṇakti tighmām ataseṣu jihvāṃ sthirā cid annā dayate vi jambhaiḥ

translations.griffith: Yet newly born, his vigour is apparent when the wind blows upon his fiery splendour,  His sharpened tongue he layeth on the brushwood, and with his teeth e’en solid food consumeth.

verses.sanskrit: तर्षु यद अन्ना तर्षुणा ववक्ष तर्षुं दूतं कर्णुते यह्वो अग्निः वातस्य मेळिं सचते निजूर्वन्न आशुं न वाजयते हिन्वे अर्वा |||
verses.transliteration: tṛṣu yad annā tṛṣuṇā vavakṣa tṛṣuṃ dūtaṃ kṛṇute yahvo aghniḥ vātasya meḷiṃ sacate nijūrvann āśuṃ na vājayate hinve arvā

translations.griffith: When he hath borne off food with swift flame swiftly, strong Agni makes himself a speedy envoy,  Follows the rustling of the wind, consuming, and courser-like, speeds, drives the swift horse onward.

verses.sanskrit: दूतं वो विश्ववेदसं हव्यवाहम अमर्त्यम यजिष्ठम रञ्जसे गिरा |||
verses.transliteration: dūtaṃ vo viśvavedasaṃ havyavāham amartyam yajiṣṭham ṛñjase ghirā

translations.griffith: YOUR envoy who possesses all, Immortal, bearer of your gifts,  Best worshipper, I woo with song.

verses.sanskrit: स हि वेदा वसुधितिम महां आरोधनं दिवः स देवां एह वक्षति |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi vedā vasudhitim mahāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ sa devāṃ eha vakṣati

translations.griffith: He, Mighty, knows the gift of wealth, he knows the deep recess of heaven:  He shall bring hitherward the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: स वेद देव आनमं देवां रतायते दमे दाति परियाणि चिद वसु |||
verses.transliteration: sa veda deva ānamaṃ devāṃ ṛtāyate dame dāti priyāṇi cid vasu

translations.griffith: He knows, a God himself, to guide Gods to the righteous in his home:  He gives e’en treasures that we love.

verses.sanskrit: स होता सेद उ दूत्यं चिकित्वां अन्तर ईयते विद्वां आरोधनं दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hotā sed u dūtyaṃ cikitvāṃ antar īyate vidvāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ

translations.griffith: He is the Herald: well-informed, he doth his errand to and fro,  Knowing the deep recess of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: ते सयाम ये अग्नये ददाशुर हव्यदातिभिः य ईम पुष्यन्त इन्धते |||
verses.transliteration: te syāma ye aghnaye dadāśur havyadātibhiḥ ya īm puṣyanta indhate

translations.griffith: May we be they who gratify Agni with sacrificial gifts,  Who cherish and enkindle him.

verses.sanskrit: ते राया ते सुवीर्यैः ससवांसो वि शर्ण्विरे ये अग्ना दधिरे दुवः |||
verses.transliteration: te rāyā te suvīryaiḥ sasavāṃso vi śṛṇvire ye aghnā dadhire duvaḥ

translations.griffith: Illustrious for wealth are they, and hero deeds, victorious,  Who have served Agni reverently.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे रायो दिवे-दिवे सं चरन्तु पुरुस्प्र्हः अस्मे वाजास ईरताम |||
verses.transliteration: asme rāyo dive-dive saṃ carantu puruspṛhaḥ asme vājāsa īratām

translations.griffith: So unto us, day after day, may riches craved by many come,  And power and might spring up for us.

verses.sanskrit: स विप्रश चर्षणीनां शवसा मानुषाणाम अति कषिप्रेव विध्यति |||
verses.transliteration: sa vipraś carṣaṇīnāṃ śavasā mānuṣāṇām ati kṣipreva vidhyati

translations.griffith: That holy Singer in his strength shoots forth his arrows swifter than  The swift shafts of the tribes of men.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने मर्ळ महां असि य ईम आ देवयुं जनम इयेथ बर्हिर आसदम |||
verses.transliteration: aghne mṛḷa mahāṃ asi ya īm ā devayuṃ janam iyetha barhir āsadam

translations.griffith: AGNI, show favour: great art thou who to this pious man art come,  To seat thee on the sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit: स मानुषीषु दूळभो विक्षु परावीर अमर्त्यः दूतो विश्वेषाम भुवत |||
verses.transliteration: sa mānuṣīṣu dūḷabho vikṣu prāvīr amartyaḥ dūto viśveṣām bhuvat

translations.griffith: May he the Immortal, Helper, bard to be deceived among mankind,  Become the messenger of all.

verses.sanskrit: स सद्म परि णीयते होता मन्द्रो दिविष्टिषु उत पोता नि षीदति |||
verses.transliteration: sa sadma pari ṇīyate hotā mandro diviṣṭiṣu uta potā ni ṣīdati

translations.griffith: Around the altar is he led, welcome Chief Priest at solemn rites,  Or as the Potar sits him down.

verses.sanskrit: उत गना अग्निर अध्वर उतो गर्हपतिर दमे उत बरह्मा नि षीदति |||
verses.transliteration: uta ghnā aghnir adhvara uto ghṛhapatir dame uta brahmā ni ṣīdati

translations.griffith: Agni in fire at sacrifice, and in the house as Lord thereof,  And as a Brahman takes his seat.

verses.sanskrit: वेषि हय अध्वरीयताम उपवक्ता जनानाम हव्या च मानुषाणाम |||
verses.transliteration: veṣi hy adhvarīyatām upavaktā janānām havyā ca mānuṣāṇām

translations.griffith: Thou comest as the guide of folk who celebrate a sacrifice,  And to oblations brought by men.

verses.sanskrit: वेषीद व अस्य दूत्यं यस्य जुजोषो अध्वरम हव्यम मर्तस्य वोळ्हवे |||
verses.transliteration: veṣīd v asya dūtyaṃ yasya jujoṣo adhvaram havyam martasya voḷhave

translations.griffith: Thou servest as his messenger whose sacrifice thou lovest well,  To bear the mortal's gifts to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकं जोष्य अध्वरम अस्माकं यज्ञम अङगिरः अस्माकं शर्णुधी हवम |||
verses.transliteration: asmākaṃ joṣy adhvaram asmākaṃ yajñam aṅghiraḥ asmākaṃ śṛṇudhī havam

translations.griffith: Accept our solemn rite; be pleased, Aṅgiras, with our sacrifice:  Give ear and listen to our call.

verses.sanskrit: परि ते दूळभो रथो ऽसमां अश्नोतु विश्वतः येन रक्षसि दाशुषः |||
verses.transliteration: pari te dūḷabho ratho 'smāṃ aśnotu viśvataḥ yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ

translations.griffith: May thine inviolable car, wherewith thou guardest those who give,  Come near to us from every side.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तम अद्याश्वं न सतोमैः करतुं न भद्रं हर्दिस्प्र्शम रध्यामा त ओहैः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne tam adyāśvaṃ na stomaiḥ kratuṃ na bhadraṃ hṛdispṛśam ṛdhyāmā ta ohaiḥ

translations.griffith: This day with praises, Agni, we bring thee that which thou lovest.  Right judgment, like a horse, with our devotions.

verses.sanskrit: अधा हय अग्ने करतोर भद्रस्य दक्षस्य साधोः रथीर रतस्य बर्हतो बभूथ |||
verses.transliteration: adhā hy aghne krator bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ rathīr ṛtasya bṛhato babhūtha

translations.griffith: For thou hast ever been the Car-driver, Agni, of noble  Strength, lofty sacrifice, and rightful judgment.

verses.sanskrit: एभिर नो अर्कैर भवा नो अर्वाङ सवर ण जयोतिः अग्ने विश्वेभिः सुमना अनीकैः |||
verses.transliteration: ebhir no arkair bhavā no arvāṅ svar ṇa jyotiḥ aghne viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ

translations.griffith: Through these our praises come thou to meet us, bright as the sunlight,  O Agni, well disposed, with all thine aspects.

verses.sanskrit: आभिष टे अद्य गीर्भिर गर्णन्तो ऽगने दाशेम पर ते दिवो न सतनयन्ति शुष्माः |||
verses.transliteration: ābhiṣ ṭe adya ghīrbhir ghṛṇanto 'ghne dāśema pra te divo na stanayanti śuṣmāḥ

translations.griffith: Now may we serve thee singing these lauds this day to thee, Agni.  Loud as the voice of Heaven thy blasts are roaring.

verses.sanskrit: तव सवादिष्ठाग्ने संद्र्ष्टिर इदा चिद अह्न इदा चिद अक्तोः शरिये रुक्मो न रोचत उपाके |||
verses.transliteration: tava svādiṣṭhāghne saṃdṛṣṭir idā cid ahna idā cid aktoḥ śriye rukmo na rocata upāke

translations.griffith: Just at this time of the day and the night thy look is the sweetest:  It shineth near us even as gold for glory.

verses.sanskrit: घर्तं न पूतं तनूर अरेपाः शुचि हिरण्यम तत ते रुक्मो न रोचत सवधावः |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛtaṃ na pūtaṃ tanūr arepāḥ śuci hiraṇyam tat te rukmo na rocata svadhāvaḥ

translations.griffith: Spotless thy body, brilliant as gold, like clarified butter:  This gleams like gold on thee, O Self. dependent.

verses.sanskrit: कर्तं चिद धि षमा सनेमि दवेषो ऽगन इनोषि मर्तात इत्था यजमानाद रतावः |||
verses.transliteration: kṛtaṃ cid dhi ṣmā sanemi dveṣo 'ghna inoṣi martāt itthā yajamānād ṛtāvaḥ

translations.griffith: All hate and mischief, yea, if committed, Agni, thou turnest,  Holy One, from the man who rightly worships.

verses.sanskrit: शिवा नः सख्या सन्तु भरात्राग्ने देवेषु युष्मे सा नो नाभिः सदने सस्मिन्न ऊधन |||
verses.transliteration: śivā naḥ sakhyā santu bhrātrāghne deveṣu yuṣme sā no nābhiḥ sadane sasminn ūdhan

translations.griffith: Agni, with you Gods, prosperous be our friendships and kinships.  Be this our bond here by this place, thine altar.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रं ते अग्ने सहसिन्न अनीकम उपाक आ रोचते सूर्यस्य रुशद दर्शे दद्र्शे नक्तया चिद अरूक्षितं दर्श आ रूपे अन्नम |||
verses.transliteration: bhadraṃ te aghne sahasinn anīkam upāka ā rocate sūryasya ruśad dṛśe dadṛśe naktayā cid arūkṣitaṃ dṛśa ā rūpe annam

translations.griffith: THY blessed majesty, victorious Agni, shines brightly in the neighbourhood of Sūrya.  Splendid to see, it shows even at nighttime, and food is fair to look on in thy beauty.

verses.sanskrit: वि षाह्य अग्ने गर्णते मनीषां खं वेपसा तुविजात सतवानः विश्वेभिर यद वावनः शुक्र देवैस तन नो रास्व सुमहो भूरि मन्म |||
verses.transliteration: vi ṣāhy aghne ghṛṇate manīṣāṃ khaṃ vepasā tuvijāta stavānaḥ viśvebhir yad vāvanaḥ śukra devais tan no rāsva sumaho bhūri manma

translations.griffith: Agni, disclose his thought for him who singeth, the well, Strong God! while thou art praised with fervour.  Vouchsafe to us that powerful hymn, O Mighty, which, Radiant One! with all the Gods thou lovest.

verses.sanskrit: तवद अग्ने काव्या तवन मनीषास तवद उक्था जायन्ते राध्यानि तवद एति दरविणं वीरपेशा इत्थाधिये दाशुषे मर्त्याय |||
verses.transliteration: tvad aghne kāvyā tvan manīṣās tvad ukthā jāyante rādhyāni tvad eti draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā itthādhiye dāśuṣe martyāya

translations.griffith: From thee, O Agni, springs poetic wisdom, from thee come thoughts and hymns of praise that prosper;  From thee flows wealth, with heroes to adorn it, to the true-hearted man who gives oblation.

verses.sanskrit: तवद वाजी वाजम्भरो विहाया अभिष्टिक्र्ज जायते सत्यशुष्मः तवद रयिर देवजूतो मयोभुस तवद आशुर जूजुवां अग्ने अर्वा |||
verses.transliteration: tvad vājī vājambharo vihāyā abhiṣṭikṛj jāyate satyaśuṣmaḥ tvad rayir devajūto mayobhus tvad āśur jūjuvāṃ aghne arvā

translations.griffith: From thee the hero springs who wins the booty, bringer of help, mighty, of real courage.  From thee comes wealth, sent by the Gods, bliss-giving; Agni, from thee the fleet impetuous charger.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने परथमं देवयन्तो देवम मर्ता अम्र्त मन्द्रजिह्वम दवेषोयुतम आ विवासन्ति धीभिर दमूनसं गर्हपतिम अमूरम |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne prathamaṃ devayanto devam martā amṛta mandrajihvam dveṣoyutam ā vivāsanti dhībhir damūnasaṃ ghṛhapatim amūram

translations.griffith: Immortal Agni, thee whose voice is pleasant, as first in rank, as God, religious mortals  Invite with hymns; thee who removest hatred, Friend of the Home, the household's Lord, unerring.

verses.sanskrit: आरे अस्मद अमतिम आरे अंह आरे विश्वां दुर्मतिं यन निपासि दोषा शिवः सहसः सूनो अग्ने यं देव आ चित सचसे सवस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: āre asmad amatim āre aṃha āre viśvāṃ durmatiṃ yan nipāsi doṣā śivaḥ sahasaḥ sūno aghne yaṃ deva ā cit sacase svasti

translations.griffith: Far from us thou removest want and sorrow, far from us all ill-will when thou protectest.  Son of Strength, Agni, blest is he at evening, whom thou as God attendest for his welfare.

verses.sanskrit: यस तवाम अग्न इनधते यतस्रुक तरिस ते अन्नं कर्णवत सस्मिन्न अहन स सु दयुम्नैर अभ्य अस्तु परसक्षत तव करत्वा जातवेदश चिकित्वान |||
verses.transliteration: yas tvām aghna inadhate yatasruk tris te annaṃ kṛṇavat sasminn ahan sa su dyumnair abhy astu prasakṣat tava kratvā jātavedaś cikitvān

translations.griffith: WHOSO enkindles thee, with lifted ladle, and thrice this day offers thee food, O Agni,  May he excel, triumphant through thy splendours, wise through thy mental power, O Jātavedas.

verses.sanskrit: इध्मं यस ते जभरच छश्रमाणो महो अग्ने अनीकम आ सपर्यन स इधानः परति दोषाम उषासम पुष्यन रयिं सचते घनन्न अमित्रान |||
verses.transliteration: idhmaṃ yas te jabharac chaśramāṇo maho aghne anīkam ā saparyan sa idhānaḥ prati doṣām uṣāsam puṣyan rayiṃ sacate ghnann amitrān

translations.griffith: Whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel, serving the majesty of mighty Agni,  He, kindling thee at evening and at morning, prospers, and comes to wealth, and slays his foemen.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर ईशे बर्हतः कषत्रियस्याग्निर वाजस्य परमस्य रायः दधाति रत्नं विधते यविष्ठो वय आनुषङ मर्त्याय सवधावान |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir īśe bṛhataḥ kṣatriyasyāghnir vājasya paramasya rāyaḥ dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate yaviṣṭho vy ānuṣaṅ martyāya svadhāvān

translations.griffith: Agni is Master of sublime dominion, Agni is Lord of strength and lofty riches.  Straightway the self-reliant God, Most Youthful, gives treasures to the mortal who adores him.

verses.sanskrit: यच चिद धि ते पुरुषत्रा यविष्ठाचित्तिभिश चक्र्मा कच चिद आगः कर्धी षव अस्मां अदितेर अनागान वय एनांसि शिश्रथो विष्वग अग्ने |||
verses.transliteration: yac cid dhi te puruṣatrā yaviṣṭhācittibhiś cakṛmā kac cid āghaḥ kṛdhī ṣv asmāṃ aditer anāghān vy enāṃsi śiśratho viṣvagh aghne

translations.griffith: Most Youthful God, whatever sin, through folly, we here, as human beings, have committed,  In sight of Aditi make thou us sinless remit, entirely, Agni, our offences.

verses.sanskrit: महश चिद अग्न एनसो अभीक ऊर्वाद देवानाम उत मर्त्यानाम मा ते सखायः सदम इद रिषाम यछा तोकाय तनयाय शं योः |||
verses.transliteration: mahaś cid aghna enaso abhīka ūrvād devānām uta martyānām mā te sakhāyaḥ sadam id riṣāma yachā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ

translations.griffith: Even in the presence of great sin, O Agni, free us from prison of the Gods or mortals.  Never may we who are thy friends be injured: grant health and strength unto our seed and offspring.

verses.sanskrit: यथा ह तयद वसवो गौर्यं चित पदि षिताम अमुञ्चता यजत्राः एवो षव अस्मन मुञ्चता वय अंहः पर तार्य अग्ने परतरं न आयुः |||
verses.transliteration: yathā ha tyad vasavo ghauryaṃ cit padi ṣitām amuñcatā yajatrāḥ evo ṣv asman muñcatā vy aṃhaḥ pra tāry aghne prataraṃ na āyuḥ

translations.griffith: Even as ye here, Gods Excellent and Holy, have loosed the cow that by the foot was tethered,  So also set us free from this affliction long let our life, O Agni, be extended.

verses.sanskrit: परत्य अग्निर उषसाम अग्रम अख्यद विभातीनां सुमना रत्नधेयम यातम अश्विना सुक्र्तो दुरोणम उत सूर्यो जयोतिषा देव एति |||
verses.transliteration: praty aghnir uṣasām aghram akhyad vibhātīnāṃ sumanā ratnadheyam yātam aśvinā sukṛto duroṇam ut sūryo jyotiṣā deva eti

translations.griffith: AGNI hath looked, benevolently-minded, on the wealth-giving spring of radiant Mornings.  Come, Aśvins, to the dwelling of the pious: Sūrya the God is rising with his splendour.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वम भानुं सविता देवो अश्रेद दरप्सं दविध्वद गविषो न सत्वा अनु वरतं वरुणो यन्ति मित्रो यत सूर्यं दिव्य आरोहयन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvam bhānuṃ savitā devo aśred drapsaṃ davidhvad ghaviṣo na satvā anu vrataṃ varuṇo yanti mitro yat sūryaṃ divy ārohayanti

translations.griffith: Savitar, God, hath spread on high his lustre, waving his flag like a spoil-seeking hero.  Their stablished way go Varuṇa and Mitra, what time they make the Sun ascend the heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यं सीम अक्र्ण्वन तमसे विप्र्चे धरुवक्षेमा अनवस्यन्तो अर्थम तं सूर्यं हरितः सप्त यह्वी सपशं विश्वस्य जगतो वहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ sīm akṛṇvan tamase vipṛce dhruvakṣemā anavasyanto artham taṃ sūryaṃ haritaḥ sapta yahvī spaśaṃ viśvasya jaghato vahanti

translations.griffith: Him whom they made to drive away the darkness, Lords of sure mansions, constant to their object,  Him who beholds the universe, the Sun-God, seven strong and youthful Coursers carry onward.

verses.sanskrit: वहिष्ठेभिर विहरन यासि तन्तुम अवव्ययन्न असितं देव वस्म दविध्वतो रश्मयः सूर्यस्य चर्मेवावाधुस तमो अप्स्व अन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: vahiṣṭhebhir viharan yāsi tantum avavyayann asitaṃ deva vasma davidhvato raśmayaḥ sūryasya carmevāvādhus tamo apsv antaḥ

translations.griffith: Spreading thy web with mightiest Steeds thou comest, rending apart, thou God, the black-hued mantle.  The rays of Sūrya tremulously shining sink, like a hide, the darkness in the waters.

verses.sanskrit: अनायतो अनिबद्धः कथायं नयङङ उत्तानो ऽव पद्यते न कया याति स्वधया को ददर्श दिवः स्कम्भः समृतः पाति नाकम् |||
verses.transliteration: anāyato anibaddhaḥ kathāyaṃ nyaṅṅ uttāno 'va padyate na kayā yāti svadhayā ko dadarśa divaḥ skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam

translations.griffith: How is it that, unbound and not supported, he falleth not although directed downward?  By what self power moves he? Who hath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar.

verses.sanskrit: परत्य अग्निर उषसो जातवेदा अख्यद देवो रोचमाना महोभिः आ नासत्योरुगाया रथेनेमं यज्ञम उप नो यातम अछ |||
verses.transliteration: praty aghnir uṣaso jātavedā akhyad devo rocamānā mahobhiḥ ā nāsatyorughāyā rathenemaṃ yajñam upa no yātam acha

translations.griffith: THE God hath looked, even Agni Jātavedas, to meet the Dawns refulgent in their glories.  Come on your chariot, ye who travel widely, come to this sacrifice of ours, Nāsatyas.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वं केतुं सविता देवो अश्रेज जयोतिर विश्वस्मै भुवनाय कर्ण्वन आप्रा दयावाप्र्थिवी अन्तरिक्षं वि सूर्यो रश्मिभिश चेकितानः |||
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvaṃ ketuṃ savitā devo aśrej jyotir viśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvan āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ vi sūryo raśmibhiś cekitānaḥ

translations.griffith: Producing light for all the world of creatures, God Savitar hath raised aloft his banner.  Making his presence known by sunbeams, Sūrya hath filled the firmament and earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: आवहन्त्य अरुणीर जयोतिषागान मही चित्रा रश्मिभिश चेकिताना परबोधयन्ती सुविताय देव्य उषा ईयते सुयुजा रथेन |||
verses.transliteration: āvahanty aruṇīr jyotiṣāghān mahī citrā raśmibhiś cekitānā prabodhayantī suvitāya devy uṣā īyate suyujā rathena

translations.griffith: Red Dawn is come, riding with brightness onward, distinguished by her beams, gay-hued and mighty.  Dawn on her nobly-harnessed car, the Goddess, awaking men to happiness, approacheth.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां वहिष्ठा इह ते वहन्तु रथा अश्वास उषसो वयुष्टौ इमे हि वाम मधुपेयाय सोमा अस्मिन यज्ञे वर्षणा मादयेथाम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ vahiṣṭhā iha te vahantu rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭau ime hi vām madhupeyāya somā asmin yajñe vṛṣaṇā mādayethām

translations.griffith: May those most powerful steeds and chariot bring you, O Aśvins, hither at the break of morning.  Here for your draught of meath are Soma juices: at this our sacrifice rejoice, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit: अनायतो अनिबद्धः कथायं नयङङ उत्तानो ऽव पद्यते न कया याति स्वधया को ददर्श दिवः स्कम्भः समृतः पाति नाकम् |||
verses.transliteration: anāyato anibaddhaḥ kathāyaṃ nyaṅṅ uttāno 'va padyate na kayā yāti svadhayā ko dadarśa divaḥ skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam

translations.griffith: How is it that, unbound and unsupported, he falleth not although directed downward?  By what self-power moves he? Who hath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar?

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर होता नो अध्वरे वाजी सन परि णीयते देवो देवेषु यज्ञियः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir hotā no adhvare vājī san pari ṇīyate devo deveṣu yajñiyaḥ

translations.griffith: AGNI the Herald, like a horse, is led forth at our solemn rite,  God among Gods adorable.

verses.sanskrit: परि तरिविष्ट्य अध्वरं यात्य अग्नी रथीर इव आ देवेषु परयो दधत |||
verses.transliteration: pari triviṣṭy adhvaraṃ yāty aghnī rathīr iva ā deveṣu prayo dadhat

translations.griffith: Three times unto our solemn rite comes Agni like a charioteer,  Bearing the viands to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: परि वाजपतिः कविर अग्निर हव्यान्य अक्रमीत दधद रत्नानि दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: pari vājapatiḥ kavir aghnir havyāny akramīt dadhad ratnāni dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Round the oblations hath he paced, Agni the Wise, the Lord of Strength,  Giving the offerer precious boons.

verses.sanskrit: अयं यः सर्ञ्जये पुरो दैववाते समिध्यते दयुमां अमित्रदम्भनः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ yaḥ sṛñjaye puro daivavāte samidhyate dyumāṃ amitradambhanaḥ

translations.griffith: He who is kindled eastward for Sṛñjaya, Devāvata's son,  Resplendent, tamer of the foe.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य घा वीर ईवतो ऽगनेर ईशीत मर्त्यः तिग्मजम्भस्य मीळ्हुषः |||
verses.transliteration: asya ghā vīra īvato 'ghner īśīta martyaḥ tighmajambhasya mīḷhuṣaḥ

translations.griffith: So mighty be the Agni whom the mortal hero shall command,  With sharpened teeth and bountiful.

verses.sanskrit: तम अर्वन्तं न सानसिम अरुषं न दिवः शिशुम मर्म्र्ज्यन्ते दिवे-दिवे |||
verses.transliteration: tam arvantaṃ na sānasim aruṣaṃ na divaḥ śiśum marmṛjyante dive-dive

translations.griffith: Day after day they dress him, as they clean a horse who wins the prize.  Dress the red Scion of the Sky.

verses.sanskrit: बोधद यन मा हरिभ्यां कुमारः साहदेव्यः अछा न हूत उद अरम |||
verses.transliteration: bodhad yan mā haribhyāṃ kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ achā na hūta ud aram

translations.griffith: When Sahadeva's princely son with two bay horses thought of me,  Summoned by him I drew not back.

verses.sanskrit: उत तया यजता हरी कुमारात साहदेव्यात परयता सद्य आ ददे |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyā yajatā harī kumārāt sāhadevyāt prayatā sadya ā dade

translations.griffith: And truly those two noble bays I straightway took when offered me,  From Sahadeva's princely son.

verses.sanskrit: एष वां देवाव अश्विना कुमारः साहदेव्यः दीर्घायुर अस्तु सोमकः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa vāṃ devāv aśvinā kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ dīrghāyur astu somakaḥ

translations.griffith: Long, O ye Aśvins, may he live, your care, ye Gods, the princely son.  Of Sahadeva, Somaka.

verses.sanskrit: तं युवं देवाव अश्विना कुमारं साहदेव्यम दीर्घायुषं कर्णोतन |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ yuvaṃ devāv aśvinā kumāraṃ sāhadevyam dīrghāyuṣaṃ kṛṇotana

translations.griffith: Cause him the youthful prince, the son of Sahadeva, to enjoy  Long life, O Aśvins, O ye Gods.

verses.sanskrit: आ सत्यो यातु मघवां रजीषी दरवन्त्व अस्य हरय उप नः तस्मा इद अन्धः सुषुमा सुदक्षम इहाभिपित्वं करते गर्णानः |||
verses.transliteration: ā satyo yātu maghavāṃ ṛjīṣī dravantv asya haraya upa naḥ tasmā id andhaḥ suṣumā sudakṣam ihābhipitvaṃ karate ghṛṇānaḥ

translations.griffith: IMPETUOUS, true, let Maghavan come hither, and let his Tawny Coursers speed to reach us.  For him have we pressed juice exceeding potent: here, praised with song, let him effect his visit.

verses.sanskrit: अव सय शूराध्वनो नान्ते ऽसमिन नो अद्य सवने मन्दध्यै शंसात्य उक्थम उशनेव वेधाश चिकितुषे असुर्याय मन्म |||
verses.transliteration: ava sya śūrādhvano nānte 'smin no adya savane mandadhyai śaṃsāty uktham uśaneva vedhāś cikituṣe asuryāya manma

translations.griffith: Unyoke, as at thy journey's end, O Hero, to gladden thee today at this libation.  Like Uśanā, the priest a laud shall utter, a hymn to thee, the Lord Divine, who markest.

verses.sanskrit: कविर न निण्यं विदथानि साधन वर्षा यत सेकं विपिपानो अर्चात दिव इत्था जीजनत सप्त कारून अह्ना चिच चक्रुर वयुना गर्णन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: kavir na niṇyaṃ vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekaṃ vipipāno arcāt diva itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cic cakrur vayunā ghṛṇantaḥ

translations.griffith: When the Bull, quaffing, praises our libation, as a sage paying holy rites in secret,  Seven singers here from heaven hath he begotten, who e’en by day have wrought their works while singing.

verses.sanskrit: सवर यद वेदि सुद्र्शीकम अर्कैर महि जयोती रुरुचुर यद ध वस्तोः अन्धा तमांसि दुधिता विचक्षे नर्भ्यश चकार नर्तमो अभिष्टौ |||
verses.transliteration: svar yad vedi sudṛśīkam arkair mahi jyotī rurucur yad dha vastoḥ andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaś cakāra nṛtamo abhiṣṭau

translations.griffith: When heaven's fair light by hymns was made apparent (they made great splendour shine at break of morning),  He with his succour, best of Heroes, scattered the blinding darkness so that men saw clearly.

verses.sanskrit: ववक्ष इन्द्रो अमितम रजीष्य उभे आ पप्रौ रोदसी महित्वा अतश चिद अस्य महिमा वि रेच्य अभि यो विश्वा भुवना बभूव |||
verses.transliteration: vavakṣa indro amitam ṛjīṣy ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā ataś cid asya mahimā vi recy abhi yo viśvā bhuvanā babhūva

translations.griffith: Indra, Impetuous One, hath waxed immensely: he with his vastness hath filled earth and heaven.  E’en beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वानि शक्रो नर्याणि विद्वान अपो रिरेच सखिभिर निकामैः अश्मानं चिद ये बिभिदुर वचोभिर वरजं गोमन्तम उशिजो वि वव्रुः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāni śakro naryāṇi vidvān apo rireca sakhibhir nikāmaiḥ aśmānaṃ cid ye bibhidur vacobhir vrajaṃ ghomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ

translations.griffith: Śakra who knoweth well all human actions hath with his eager Friends let loose the waters.  They with their songs cleft e’en the mountain open and willingly disclosed the stall of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: अपो वर्त्रं वव्रिवांसम पराहन परावत ते वज्रम पर्थिवी सचेताः परार्णांसि समुद्रियाण्य ऐनोः पतिर भवञ छवसा शूर धर्ष्णो |||
verses.transliteration: apo vṛtraṃ vavrivāṃsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ prārṇāṃsi samudriyāṇy ainoḥ patir bhavañ chavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo

translations.griffith: He smote away the floods' obstructer, Vṛtra; Earth, conscious, lent her aid to speed thy thunder.  Thou sentest forth the waters of the ocean, as Lord through power and might, O daring Hero.

verses.sanskrit: अपो यद अद्रिम पुरुहूत दर्दर आविर भुवत सरमा पूर्व्यं ते स नो नेता वाजम आ दर्षि भूरिं गोत्रा रुजन्न अङगिरोभिर गर्णानः |||
verses.transliteration: apo yad adrim puruhūta dardar āvir bhuvat saramā pūrvyaṃ te sa no netā vājam ā darṣi bhūriṃ ghotrā rujann aṅghirobhir ghṛṇānaḥ

translations.griffith: When, Much-invoked! the water's rock thou cleftest, Saramā showed herself and went before thee.  Hymned by Aṅgirases, bursting the cow-stalls, much strength thou foundest for us as our leader.

verses.sanskrit: अछा कविं नर्मणो गा अभिष्टौ सवर्षाता मघवन नाधमानम ऊतिभिस तम इषणो दयुम्नहूतौ नि मायावान अब्रह्मा दस्युर अर्त |||
verses.transliteration: achā kaviṃ nṛmaṇo ghā abhiṣṭau svarṣātā maghavan nādhamānam ūtibhis tam iṣaṇo dyumnahūtau ni māyāvān abrahmā dasyur arta

translations.griffith: Come, Maghavan, Friend of Man, to aid the singer imploring thee in battle for the sunlight.  Speed him with help in his inspired invokings: down sink the sorcerer, the prayerless Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit: आ दस्युघ्ना मनसा याह्य अस्तम भुवत ते कुत्सः सख्ये निकामः सवे योनौ नि षदतं सरूपा वि वां चिकित्सद रतचिद ध नारी |||
verses.transliteration: ā dasyughnā manasā yāhy astam bhuvat te kutsaḥ sakhye nikāmaḥ sve yonau ni ṣadataṃ sarūpā vi vāṃ cikitsad ṛtacid dha nārī

translations.griffith: Come to our home resolved to slay the Dasyu: Kutsa longed eagerly to win thy friendship.  Alike in form ye both sate in his dwelling the faithful Lady was in doubt between you.

verses.sanskrit: यासि कुत्सेन सरथम अवस्युस तोदो वातस्य हर्योर ईशानः रज्रा वाजं न गध्यं युयूषन कविर यद अहन पार्याय भूषात |||
verses.transliteration: yāsi kutsena saratham avasyus todo vātasya haryor īśānaḥ ṛjrā vājaṃ na ghadhyaṃ yuyūṣan kavir yad ahan pāryāya bhūṣāt

translations.griffith: Thou comest, fain to succour him, with Kutsa,—a goad that masters both the Wind-God's horses,  That, holding the brown steeds like spoil for capture, the sage may on the final day be present.

verses.sanskrit: कुत्साय शुष्णम अशुषं नि बर्हीः परपित्वे अह्नः कुयवं सहस्रा सद्यो दस्यून पर मर्ण कुत्स्येन पर सूरश चक्रं वर्हताद अभीके |||
verses.transliteration: kutsāya śuṣṇam aśuṣaṃ ni barhīḥ prapitve ahnaḥ kuyavaṃ sahasrā sadyo dasyūn pra mṛṇa kutsyena pra sūraś cakraṃ vṛhatād abhīke

translations.griffith: For Kutsa, with thy thousand, thou at day-break didst hurl down greedy Śuṣṇa, foe of harvest.  Quickly with Kutsa's friend destroy the Dasyus, and roll the chariot-wheel of Sūrya near us.

verses.sanskrit: तवम पिप्रुम मर्गयं शूशुवांसम रजिश्वने वैदथिनाय रन्धीः पञ्चाशत कर्ष्णा नि वपः सहस्रात्कं न पुरो जरिमा वि दर्दः |||
verses.transliteration: tvam piprum mṛghayaṃ śūśuvāṃsam ṛjiśvane vaidathināya randhīḥ pañcāśat kṛṣṇā ni vapaḥ sahasrātkaṃ na puro jarimā vi dardaḥ

translations.griffith: Thou to the son of Vidathin, Ṛjiśvan, gavest up mighty Mṛgaya and Pipru.  Thou smotest down the swarthy fifty thousand, and rentest forts as age consumes a garment.

verses.sanskrit: सूर उपाके तन्वं दधानो वि यत ते चेत्य अम्र्तस्य वर्पः मर्गो न हस्ती तविषीम उषाणः सिंहो न भीम आयुधानि बिभ्रत |||
verses.transliteration: sūra upāke tanvaṃ dadhāno vi yat te cety amṛtasya varpaḥ mṛgho na hastī taviṣīm uṣāṇaḥ siṃho na bhīma āyudhāni bibhrat

translations.griffith: What time thou settest near the Sun thy body, thy form, Immortal One, is seen expanding:  Thou a wild elephant with might invested. like a dread lion as thou wieldest weapons.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रं कामा वसूयन्तो अग्मन सवर्मीळ्हे न सवने चकानाः शरवस्यवः शशमानास उक्थैर ओको न रण्वा सुद्र्शीव पुष्टिः |||
verses.transliteration: indraṃ kāmā vasūyanto aghman svarmīḷhe na savane cakānāḥ śravasyavaḥ śaśamānāsa ukthair oko na raṇvā sudṛśīva puṣṭiḥ

translations.griffith: Wishes for wealth have gone to Indra, longing for him in war for light and at libation,  Eager for glory, labouring with praisesongs: he is like home, like sweet and fair nutrition.
