verses.sanskrit: तम इद व इन्द्रं सुहवं हुवेम यस ता चकार नर्या पुरूणि यो मावते जरित्रे गध्यं चिन मक्षू वाजम भरति सपार्हराधाः |||
verses.transliteration: tam id va indraṃ suhavaṃ huvema yas tā cakāra naryā purūṇi yo māvate jaritre ghadhyaṃ cin makṣū vājam bharati spārharādhāḥ

translations.griffith: Call we for you that Indra, prompt to listen, him who hath done so much for men's advantage;  Who, Lord of envied bounty, to a singer like me brings quickly booty worth the capture.

verses.sanskrit: तिग्मा यद अन्तर अशनिः पताति कस्मिञ चिच छूर मुहुके जनानाम घोरा यद अर्य सम्र्तिर भवात्य अध समा नस तन्वो बोधि गोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: tighmā yad antar aśaniḥ patāti kasmiñ cic chūra muhuke janānām ghorā yad arya samṛtir bhavāty adha smā nas tanvo bodhi ghopāḥ

translations.griffith: When the sharp-pointed arrow, O thou Hero, flieth mid any conflict of the people,  When, Faithful One, the dread encounter cometh, then be thou the Protector of our body.

verses.sanskrit: भुवो ऽविता वामदेवस्य धीनाम भुवः सखाव्र्को वाजसातौ तवाम अनु परमतिम आ जगन्मोरुशंसो जरित्रे विश्वध सयाः |||
verses.transliteration: bhuvo 'vitā vāmadevasya dhīnām bhuvaḥ sakhāvṛko vājasātau tvām anu pramatim ā jaghanmoruśaṃso jaritre viśvadha syāḥ

translations.griffith: Further the holy thoughts of Vamadeva be thou a guileless Friend in fight for booty.  We come to thee whose providence protects us: wide be thy sway for ever for thy singer.

verses.sanskrit: एभिर नर्भिर इन्द्र तवायुभिष टवा मघवद्भिर मघवन विश्व आजौ दयावो न दयुम्नैर अभि सन्तो अर्यः कषपो मदेम शरदश च पूर्वीः |||
verses.transliteration: ebhir nṛbhir indra tvāyubhiṣ ṭvā maghavadbhir maghavan viśva ājau dyāvo na dyumnair abhi santo aryaḥ kṣapo madema śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra, with these men who love thee truly, free givers, Maghavan, in every battle,  May we rejoice through many autumns, quelling our foes, as days subdue the nights with splendour.

verses.sanskrit: एवेद इन्द्राय वर्षभाय वर्ष्णे बरह्माकर्म भर्गवो न रथम नू चिद यथा नः सख्या वियोषद असन न उग्रो ऽविता तनूपाः |||
verses.transliteration: eved indrāya vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe brahmākarma bhṛghavo na ratham nū cid yathā naḥ sakhyā viyoṣad asan na ughro 'vitā tanūpāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, as the Bhṛgus wrought a car, for Indra the Strong, the Mighty, we our prayer have fashioned,  That he may, ne’er withdraw from us his friendship, but be our bodies' guard and strong defender.

verses.sanskrit: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell. high like rivers for the singer.  For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit: तवम महां इन्द्र तुभ्यं ह कषा अनु कषत्रम मंहना मन्यत दयौः तवं वर्त्रं शवसा जघन्वान सर्जः सिन्धूंर अहिना जग्रसानान |||
verses.transliteration: tvam mahāṃ indra tubhyaṃ ha kṣā anu kṣatram maṃhanā manyata dyauḥ tvaṃ vṛtraṃ śavasā jaghanvān sṛjaḥ sindhūṃr ahinā jaghrasānān

translations.griffith: GREAT art thou, Indra; yea, the earth, with gladness, and heaven confess to thee thine high dominion.  Thou in thy vigour having slaughtered Vṛtra didst free the floods arrested by the Dragon.

verses.sanskrit: तव तविषो जनिमन रेजत दयौ रेजद भूमिर भियसा सवस्य मन्योः रघायन्त सुभ्वः पर्वतास आर्दन धन्वानि सरयन्त आपः |||
verses.transliteration: tava tviṣo janiman rejata dyau rejad bhūmir bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ ṛghāyanta subhvaḥ parvatāsa ārdan dhanvāni sarayanta āpaḥ

translations.griffith: Heaven trembled at the birth of thine effulgence; Earth trembled at the fear of thy displeasure.  The stedfast mountains shook in agitation . the waters flowed, and desert spots were flooded.

verses.sanskrit: भिनद गिरिं शवसा वज्रम इष्णन्न आविष्क्र्ण्वानः सहसान ओजः वधीद वर्त्रं वज्रेण मन्दसानः सरन्न आपो जवसा हतव्र्ष्णीः |||
verses.transliteration: bhinad ghiriṃ śavasā vajram iṣṇann āviṣkṛṇvānaḥ sahasāna ojaḥ vadhīd vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ sarann āpo javasā hatavṛṣṇīḥ

translations.griffith: Hurling his bolt with might he cleft the mountain, while, putting forth his strength, he showed his vigour.  He slaughtered Vṛtra with his bolt, exulting, and, their lord slain, forth flowed the waters swiftly.

verses.sanskrit: सुवीरस ते जनिता मन्यत दयौर इन्द्रस्य कर्ता सवपस्तमो भूत य ईं जजान सवर्यं सुवज्रम अनपच्युतं सदसो न भूम |||
verses.transliteration: suvīras te janitā manyata dyaur indrasya kartā svapastamo bhūt ya īṃ jajāna svaryaṃ suvajram anapacyutaṃ sadaso na bhūma

translations.griffith: Thy Father Dyaus esteemed himself a hero: most noble was the work of Indra's Maker,  His who begat the strong bolt's Lord who roareth, immovable like earth from her foundation.

verses.sanskrit: य एक इच चयावयति पर भूमा राजा कर्ष्टीनाम पुरुहूत इन्द्रः सत्यम एनम अनु विश्वे मदन्ति रातिं देवस्य गर्णतो मघोनः |||
verses.transliteration: ya eka ic cyāvayati pra bhūmā rājā kṛṣṭīnām puruhūta indraḥ satyam enam anu viśve madanti rātiṃ devasya ghṛṇato maghonaḥ

translations.griffith: He who alone o’erthrows the world of creatures, Indra the peoples' King, invoked of many-  Verily all rejoice in him, extolling the boons which Maghavan the God hath sent them.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रा सोमा अभवन्न अस्य विश्वे सत्रा मदासो बर्हतो मदिष्ठाः सत्राभवो वसुपतिर वसूनां दत्रे विश्वा अधिथा इन्द्र कर्ष्टीः |||
verses.transliteration: satrā somā abhavann asya viśve satrā madāso bṛhato madiṣṭhāḥ satrābhavo vasupatir vasūnāṃ datre viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ

translations.griffith: All Soma juices are his own for ever, most gladdening draughts are ever his, the Mighty,  Thou ever wast the Treasure-Lord of treasures: Indra, thou lettest all folk share thy bounty.

verses.sanskrit: तवम अध परथमं जायमानो ऽमे विश्वा अधिथा इन्द्र कर्ष्टीः तवम परति परवत आशयानम अहिं वज्रेण मघवन वि वर्श्चः |||
verses.transliteration: tvam adha prathamaṃ jāyamāno 'me viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ tvam prati pravata āśayānam ahiṃ vajreṇa maghavan vi vṛścaḥ

translations.griffith: Moreover, when thou first wast born, O Indra, thou struckest terror into all the people.  Thou, Maghavan, rentest with thy bolt the Dragon who lay against the waterfloods of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सत्राहणं दाध्र्षिं तुम्रम इन्द्रम महाम अपारं वर्षभं सुवज्रम हन्ता यो वर्त्रं सनितोत वाजं दाता मघानि मघवा सुराधाः |||
verses.transliteration: satrāhaṇaṃ dādhṛṣiṃ tumram indram mahām apāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ suvajram hantā yo vṛtraṃ sanitota vājaṃ dātā maghāni maghavā surādhāḥ

translations.griffith: The ever-slaying, bold and furious Indra, the bright bolt's Lord, infinite, strong and mighty,  Who slayeth Vṛtra and acquireth booty, giver of blessings, Maghavan the bounteous:

verses.sanskrit: अयं वर्तश चातयते समीचीर य आजिषु मघवा शर्ण्व एकः अयं वाजम भरति यं सनोत्य अस्य परियासः सख्ये सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vṛtaś cātayate samīcīr ya ājiṣu maghavā śṛṇva ekaḥ ayaṃ vājam bharati yaṃ sanoty asya priyāsaḥ sakhye syāma

translations.griffith: Alone renowned as Maghavan in battles, he frighteneth away assembled armies.  He bringeth us the booty that he winneth may we, well-loved, continue in his friendship.

verses.sanskrit: अयं शर्ण्वे अध जयन्न उत घनन्न अयम उत पर कर्णुते युधा गाः यदा सत्यं कर्णुते मन्युम इन्द्रो विश्वं दर्ळ्हम भयत एजद अस्मात |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ śṛṇve adha jayann uta ghnann ayam uta pra kṛṇute yudhā ghāḥ yadā satyaṃ kṛṇute manyum indro viśvaṃ dṛḷham bhayata ejad asmāt

translations.griffith: Renowned is he when conquering and when slaying: 'fis he who winneth cattle in the combat.  When Indra hardeneth his indignation all that is fixed and all that moveth fear him.

verses.sanskrit: सम इन्द्रो गा अजयत सं हिरण्या सम अश्विया मघवा यो ह पूर्वीः एभिर नर्भिर नर्तमो अस्य शाकै रायो विभक्ता सम्भरश च वस्वः |||
verses.transliteration: sam indro ghā ajayat saṃ hiraṇyā sam aśviyā maghavā yo ha pūrvīḥ ebhir nṛbhir nṛtamo asya śākai rāyo vibhaktā sambharaś ca vasvaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra hath won all kine, all gold, all horses,—Maghavan, he who breaketh forts in pieces;  Most manly with these men of his who help him, dealing out wealth and gathering the treasure.

verses.sanskrit: कियत सविद इन्द्रो अध्य एति मातुः कियत पितुर जनितुर यो जजान यो अस्य शुष्मम मुहुकैर इयर्ति वातो न जूत सतनयद्भिर अभ्रैः |||
verses.transliteration: kiyat svid indro adhy eti mātuḥ kiyat pitur janitur yo jajāna yo asya śuṣmam muhukair iyarti vāto na jūta stanayadbhir abhraiḥ

translations.griffith: What is the care of Indra for his Mother, what cares he for the Father who begat him?  His care is that which speeds his might in conflicts, like wind borne onward by the clouds that thunder.

verses.sanskrit: कषियन्तं तवम अक्षियन्तं कर्णोतीयर्ति रेणुम मघवा समोहम विभञ्जनुर अशनिमां इव दयौर उत सतोतारम मघवा वसौ धात |||
verses.transliteration: kṣiyantaṃ tvam akṣiyantaṃ kṛṇotīyarti reṇum maghavā samoham vibhañjanur aśanimāṃ iva dyaur uta stotāram maghavā vasau dhāt

translations.griffith: Maghavan makes the settled man unsettled: he scatters dust that he hath swept together,  Breaking in pieces like Heaven armed with lightning: Maghavan shall enrich the man who lauds h;m.

verses.sanskrit: अयं चक्रम इषणत सूर्यस्य नय एतशं रीरमत सस्र्माणम आ कर्ष्ण ईं जुहुराणो जिघर्ति तवचो बुध्ने रजसो अस्य योनौ |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ cakram iṣaṇat sūryasya ny etaśaṃ rīramat sasṛmāṇam ā kṛṣṇa īṃ juhurāṇo jigharti tvaco budhne rajaso asya yonau

translations.griffith: He urged the chariot-wheel of Sūrya forward: Etaśa, speeding on his way, he rested.  Him the black undulating cloud bedeweth, in this mid-air's depth, at the base of darkness,

verses.sanskrit: असिक्न्यां यजमानो न होता ||
verses.transliteration: asiknyāṃ yajamāno na hotā

translations.griffith: As in the night the sacrificing priest.

verses.sanskrit: गव्यन्त इन्द्रं सख्याय विप्रा अश्वायन्तो वर्षणं वाजयन्तः जनीयन्तो जनिदाम अक्षितोतिम आ चयावयामो ऽवते न कोशम |||
verses.transliteration: ghavyanta indraṃ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyanto vṛṣaṇaṃ vājayantaḥ janīyanto janidām akṣitotim ā cyāvayāmo 'vate na kośam

translations.griffith: Eager for booty, craving strength and horses, we-singers stir Indra, the strong, for friendship,  Who gives the wives we seek, whose succour fails not, to hasten, like a pitcher to the fountain.

verses.sanskrit: तराता नो बोधि दद्र्शान आपिर अभिख्याता मर्डिता सोम्यानाम सखा पिता पित्र्तमः पित्णां कर्तेम उलोकम उशते वयोधाः |||
verses.transliteration: trātā no bodhi dadṛśāna āpir abhikhyātā marḍitā somyānām sakhā pitā pitṛtamaḥ pitṇāṃ kartem ulokam uśate vayodhāḥ

translations.griffith: Be thou our guardian, show thyself our kinsman, watching and blessing those who pour the Soma;  As Friend, as Sire, most fatherly of fathers giving the suppliant vital strength and freedom.

verses.sanskrit: सखीयताम अविता बोधि सखा गर्णान इन्द्र सतुवते वयो धाः वयं हय आ ते चक्र्मा सबाध आभिः शमीभिर महयन्त इन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: sakhīyatām avitā bodhi sakhā ghṛṇāna indra stuvate vayo dhāḥ vayaṃ hy ā te cakṛmā sabādha ābhiḥ śamībhir mahayanta indra

translations.griffith: Be helping Friend of those who seek thy friendship . give life, when lauded, Indra, to the singer.  For, Indra, we the priests have paid thee worship, exalting thee with these our sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: सतुत इन्द्रो मघवा यद ध वर्त्रा भूरीण्य एको अप्रतीनि हन्ति अस्य परियो जरिता यस्य शर्मन नकिर देवा वारयन्ते न मर्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: stuta indro maghavā yad dha vṛtrā bhūrīṇy eko apratīni hanti asya priyo jaritā yasya śarman nakir devā vārayante na martāḥ

translations.griffith: Alone, when Indra Maghavan is lauded, he slayeth many ne’er-resisted Vṛtras.  Him in whose keeping is the well-loved singer never do Gods or mortals stay or hinder.

verses.sanskrit: एवा न इन्द्रो मघवा विरप्शी करत सत्या चर्षणीध्र्द अनर्वा तवं राजा जनुषां धेह्य अस्मे अधि शरवो माहिनं यज जरित्रे |||
verses.transliteration: evā na indro maghavā virapśī karat satyā carṣaṇīdhṛd anarvā tvaṃ rājā januṣāṃ dhehy asme adhi śravo māhinaṃ yaj jaritre

translations.griffith: E’en so let Maghavan, the loud-voiced Indra, give us true blessings, foeless, men's upholder.  King of all creatures, give us glory amply, exalted glory due to him who lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers for the singer.  For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit: अयम पन्था अनुवित्तः पुराणो यतो देवा उदजायन्त विश्वे अतश चिद आ जनिषीष्ट परव्र्द्धो मा मातरम अमुया पत्तवे कः |||
verses.transliteration: ayam panthā anuvittaḥ purāṇo yato devā udajāyanta viśve ataś cid ā janiṣīṣṭa pravṛddho mā mātaram amuyā pattave kaḥ

translations.griffith: THIS is the ancient and accepted pathway by which all Gods have come into existence.  Hereby could one be born though waxen mighty. Let him not, otherwise, destroy his Mother.

verses.sanskrit: नाहम अतो निर अया दुर्गहैतत तिरश्चता पार्श्वान निर गमाणि बहूनि मे अक्र्ता कर्त्वानि युध्यै तवेन सं तवेन पर्छै |||
verses.transliteration: nāham ato nir ayā durghahaitat tiraścatā pārśvān nir ghamāṇi bahūni me akṛtā kartvāni yudhyai tvena saṃ tvena pṛchai

translations.griffith: Not this way go I forth: hard is the passage. Forth from the side obliquely will I issue.  Much that is yet undone must I accomplish; one must I combat and the other question.

verses.sanskrit: परायतीम मातरम अन्व अचष्ट न नानु गान्य अनु नू गमानि तवष्टुर गर्हे अपिबत सोमम इन्द्रः शतधन्यं चम्वोः सुतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: parāyatīm mātaram anv acaṣṭa na nānu ghāny anu nū ghamāni tvaṣṭur ghṛhe apibat somam indraḥ śatadhanyaṃ camvoḥ sutasya

translations.griffith: He bent his eye upon the dying Mother: My word I now withdraw. That way I follow.  In Tvaṣṭar's dwelling India drank the Soma, a hundredworth of juice pressed from the mortar.

verses.sanskrit: किं स रधक कर्णवद यं सहस्रम मासो जभार शरदश च पूर्वीः नही नव अस्य परतिमानम अस्त्य अन्तर जातेषूत ये जनित्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: kiṃ sa ṛdhak kṛṇavad yaṃ sahasram māso jabhāra śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ nahī nv asya pratimānam asty antar jāteṣūta ye janitvāḥ

translations.griffith: What strange act shall he do, he whom his Mother bore for a thousand months and many autumns?  No peer hath he among those born already, nor among those who shall be born hereafter.

verses.sanskrit: अवद्यम इव मन्यमाना गुहाकर इन्द्रम माता वीर्येणा नयॄष्टम अथोद अस्थात सवयम अत्कं वसान आ रोदसी अप्र्णाज जायमानः |||
verses.transliteration: avadyam iva manyamānā ghuhākar indram mātā vīryeṇā nyṝṣṭam athod asthāt svayam atkaṃ vasāna ā rodasī apṛṇāj jāyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: Deeming him a reproach, his mother hid him, Indra, endowed with all heroic valour.  Then up he sprang himself, assumed his vesture, and filled, as soon as born, the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: एता अर्षन्त्य अललाभवन्तीर रतावरीर इव संक्रोशमानाः एता वि पर्छ किम इदम भनन्ति कम आपो अद्रिम परिधिं रुजन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: etā arṣanty alalābhavantīr ṛtāvarīr iva saṃkrośamānāḥ etā vi pṛcha kim idam bhananti kam āpo adrim paridhiṃ rujanti

translations.griffith: With lively motion onward flow these waters, the Holy Ones, shouting, as ’twere, together.  Ask them to. tell thee what the floods are saying, what girdling rock the waters burst asunder.

verses.sanskrit: किम उ षविद अस्मै निविदो भनन्तेन्द्रस्यावद्यं दिधिषन्त आपः ममैतान पुत्रो महता वधेन वर्त्रं जघन्वां अस्र्जद वि सिन्धून |||
verses.transliteration: kim u ṣvid asmai nivido bhanantendrasyāvadyaṃ didhiṣanta āpaḥ mamaitān putro mahatā vadhena vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn

translations.griffith: Are they addressing him with words of welcome? Will the floods take on them the shame of Indra?  With his great thunderbolt my Son hath slaughtered Vṛtra, and set these rivers free to wander.

verses.sanskrit: ममच चन तवा युवतिः परास ममच चन तवा कुषवा जगार ममच चिद आपः शिशवे मम्र्ड्युर ममच चिद इन्द्रः सहसोद अतिष्ठत |||
verses.transliteration: mamac cana tvā yuvatiḥ parāsa mamac cana tvā kuṣavā jaghāra mamac cid āpaḥ śiśave mamṛḍyur mamac cid indraḥ sahasod atiṣṭhat

translations.griffith: I cast thee from me, mine,—thy youthful mother: thee, mine own offspring, Kusava hath swallowed.  To him, mine infant, were the waters gracious. Indra, my Son, rose up in conquering vigour.

verses.sanskrit: ममच चन ते मघवन वयंसो निविविध्वां अप हनू जघान अधा निविद्ध उत्तरो बभूवाञ छिरो दासस्य सम पिणक वधेन |||
verses.transliteration: mamac cana te maghavan vyaṃso nivividhvāṃ apa hanū jaghāna adhā nividdha uttaro babhūvāñ chiro dāsasya sam piṇak vadhena

translations.griffith: Thou art mine own, O Maghavan, whom Vyaṁsa struck to the ground and smote thy jaws in pieces.  But, smitten through, the mastery thou wonnest, and with thy bolt the Dāsa's head thou crushedst.

verses.sanskrit: गर्ष्टिः ससूव सथविरं तवागाम अनाध्र्ष्यं वर्षभं तुम्रम इन्द्रम अरीळ्हं वत्सं चरथाय माता सवयं गातुं तन्व इछमानम |||
verses.transliteration: ghṛṣṭiḥ sasūva sthaviraṃ tavāghām anādhṛṣyaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tumram indram arīḷhaṃ vatsaṃ carathāya mātā svayaṃ ghātuṃ tanva ichamānam

translations.griffith: The Heifer hath brought forth the Strong, the Mighty, the unconquerable Bull, the furious Indra.  The Mother left her unlicked Calf to wander, seeking himself, the path that he would follow.

verses.sanskrit: उत माता महिषम अन्व अवेनद अमी तवा जहति पुत्र देवाः अथाब्रवीद वर्त्रम इन्द्रो हनिष्यन सखे विष्णो वितरं वि करमस्व |||
verses.transliteration: uta mātā mahiṣam anv avenad amī tvā jahati putra devāḥ athābravīd vṛtram indro haniṣyan sakhe viṣṇo vitaraṃ vi kramasva

translations.griffith: Then to her mighty Child the Mother turned her, saying, My son, these Deities forsake thee.  Then Indra said, about to slaughter Vṛtra, O my friend Vṛtra, stride full boldly forward.

verses.sanskrit: कस ते मातरं विधवाम अचक्रच छयुं कस तवाम अजिघांसच चरन्तम कस ते देवो अधि मार्डीक आसीद यत पराक्षिणाः पितरम पादग्र्ह्य |||
verses.transliteration: kas te mātaraṃ vidhavām acakrac chayuṃ kas tvām ajighāṃsac carantam kas te devo adhi mārḍīka āsīd yat prākṣiṇāḥ pitaram pādaghṛhya

translations.griffith: Who was he then who made thy Mother widow? Who sought to stay thee lying still or moving?  What God, when by the foot thy Sire thou tookest and slewest, was at hand to give thee comfort?

verses.sanskrit: अवर्त्या शुन आन्त्राणि पेचे न देवेषु विविदे मर्डितारम अपश्यं जायाम अमहीयमानाम अधा मे शयेनो मध्व आ जभार |||
verses.transliteration: avartyā śuna āntrāṇi pece na deveṣu vivide marḍitāram apaśyaṃ jāyām amahīyamānām adhā me śyeno madhv ā jabhāra

translations.griffith: In deep distress I cooked a dog's intestines. Among the Gods I found not one to comfort.  My consort I beheld in degradation. The Falcon then brought me the pleasant Soma.

verses.sanskrit: एवा तवाम इन्द्र वज्रिन्न अत्र विश्वे देवासः सुहवास ऊमाः महाम उभे रोदसी वर्द्धम रष्वं निर एकम इद वर्णते वर्त्रहत्ये |||
verses.transliteration: evā tvām indra vajrinn atra viśve devāsaḥ suhavāsa ūmāḥ mahām ubhe rodasī vṛddham ṛṣvaṃ nir ekam id vṛṇate vṛtrahatye

translations.griffith: THEE, verily, O Thunder-wielding Indra, all the Gods here, the Helpers swift to listen,  And both the worlds elected, thee the Mighty, High, waxen strong, alone to slaughter Vṛtra.

verses.sanskrit: अवास्र्जन्त जिव्रयो न देवा भुवः सम्राळ इन्द्र सत्ययोनिः अहन्न अहिम परिशयानम अर्णः पर वर्तनीर अरदो विश्वधेनाः |||
verses.transliteration: avāsṛjanta jivrayo na devā bhuvaḥ samrāḷ indra satyayoniḥ ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ pra vartanīr arado viśvadhenāḥ

translations.griffith: The Gods, as worn witheld, relaxed their efforts: thou, Indra, born of truth, wast Sovran Ruler.  Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and duggest out their all-supporting channels.

verses.sanskrit: अत्र्प्णुवन्तं वियतम अबुध्यम अबुध्यमानं सुषुपाणम इन्द्र सप्त परति परवत आशयानम अहिं वज्रेण वि रिणा अपर्वन |||
verses.transliteration: atṛpṇuvantaṃ viyatam abudhyam abudhyamānaṃ suṣupāṇam indra sapta prati pravata āśayānam ahiṃ vajreṇa vi riṇā aparvan

translations.griffith: The insatiate one, extended, hard to waken, who slumbered in perpetual sleep, O Indra,—  The Dragon stretched against the seven prone rivers, where no joint was, thou rentest with thy thunder.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षोदयच छवसा कषाम बुध्नं वार ण वातस तविषीभिर इन्द्रः दर्ळ्हान्य औभ्नाद उशमान ओजो ऽवाभिनत ककुभः पर्वतानाम |||
verses.transliteration: akṣodayac chavasā kṣāma budhnaṃ vār ṇa vātas taviṣībhir indraḥ dṛḷhāny aubhnād uśamāna ojo 'vābhinat kakubhaḥ parvatānām

translations.griffith: Indra with might shook earth and her foundation as the wind stirs the water with its fury.  Striving, with strength he burst the firm asunder, and tore away the summits of the mountains.

verses.sanskrit: अभि पर दद्रुर जनयो न गर्भं रथा इव पर ययुः साकम अद्रयः अतर्पयो विस्र्त उब्ज ऊर्मीन तवं वर्तां अरिणा इन्द्र सिन्धून |||
verses.transliteration: abhi pra dadrur janayo na gharbhaṃ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sākam adrayaḥ atarpayo visṛta ubja ūrmīn tvaṃ vṛtāṃ ariṇā indra sindhūn

translations.griffith: They ran to thee as mothers to their offspring: the clouds, like chariots, hastened forth together.  Thou didst refresh the streams and force the billows: thou, Indra, settest free obstructed rivers.

verses.sanskrit: तवम महीम अवनिं विश्वधेनां तुर्वीतये वय्याय कषरन्तीम अरमयो नमसैजद अर्णः सुतरणां अक्र्णोर इन्द्र सिन्धून |||
verses.transliteration: tvam mahīm avaniṃ viśvadhenāṃ turvītaye vayyāya kṣarantīm aramayo namasaijad arṇaḥ sutaraṇāṃ akṛṇor indra sindhūn

translations.griffith: Thou for the sake of Vayya and Turvīti didst stay the great stream, flowing, all-sustaining:  Yea, at their prayer didst check the rushing river and make the floods easy to cross, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: पराग्रुवो नभन्वो न वक्वा धवस्रा अपिन्वद युवतीर रतज्ञाः धन्वान्य अज्रां अप्र्णक तर्षाणां अधोग इन्द्र सतर्यो दंसुपत्नीः |||
verses.transliteration: prāghruvo nabhanvo na vakvā dhvasrā apinvad yuvatīr ṛtajñāḥ dhanvāny ajrāṃ apṛṇak tṛṣāṇāṃ adhogh indra staryo daṃsupatnīḥ

translations.griffith: He let the young Maids skilled in Law, unwedded, like fountains, bubbling, flow forth streaming onward.  He inundated thirsty plains and deserts, and milked the dry Cows of the mighty master.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वीर उषसः शरदश च गूर्ता वर्त्रं जघन्वां अस्र्जद वि सिन्धून परिष्ठिता अत्र्णद बद्बधानाः सीरा इन्द्रः सरवितवे पर्थिव्या |||
verses.transliteration: pūrvīr uṣasaḥ śaradaś ca ghūrtā vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn pariṣṭhitā atṛṇad badbadhānāḥ sīrā indraḥ sravitave pṛthivyā

translations.griffith: Through many a morn and many a lovely autumn, having slain Vṛtra, he set free the rivers.  Indra hath set at liberty to wander on earth the streams encompassed pressed together.

verses.sanskrit: वम्रीभिः पुत्रम अग्रुवो अदानं निवेशनाद धरिव आ जभर्थ वय अन्धो अख्यद अहिम आददानो निर भूद उखछित सम अरन्त पर्व |||
verses.transliteration: vamrībhiḥ putram aghruvo adānaṃ niveśanād dhariva ā jabhartha vy andho akhyad ahim ādadāno nir bhūd ukhachit sam aranta parva

translations.griffith: Lord of Bay Steeds, thou broughtest from the ant-hill the unwedded damsel's son whom ants were eating.  The blind saw clearly, as he grasped the serpent, rose, brake the jar: his joints again united.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते पूर्वाणि करणानि विप्राविद्वां आह विदुषे करांसि यथा-यथा वर्ष्ण्यानि सवगूर्तापांसि राजन नर्याविवेषीः |||
verses.transliteration: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni viprāvidvāṃ āha viduṣe karāṃsi yathā-yathā vṛṣṇyāni svaghūrtāpāṃsi rājan naryāviveṣīḥ

translations.griffith: To the wise man, O Sage and Sovran Ruler, the man who knoweth all thine ancient exploits.  Hath told these deeds of might as thou hast wrought them, great acts, spontaneous, and to man's advantage.

verses.sanskrit: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let powers swell high, like rivers, for the singer.  For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit: आ न इन्द्रो दूराद आ न आसाद अभिष्टिक्र्द अवसे यासद उग्रः ओजिष्ठेभिर नर्पतिर वज्रबाहुः संगे समत्सु तुर्वणिः पर्तन्यून |||
verses.transliteration: ā na indro dūrād ā na āsād abhiṣṭikṛd avase yāsad ughraḥ ojiṣṭhebhir nṛpatir vajrabāhuḥ saṃghe samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn

translations.griffith: FROM near or far away may mighty Indra giver of succour, come for our protection  Lord of men, armed with thunder, with the Strongest, slaying his foes in conflict, in the battles.

verses.sanskrit: आ न इन्द्रो हरिभिर यात्व अछार्वाचीनो ऽवसे राधसे च तिष्ठाति वज्री मघवा विरप्शीमं यज्ञम अनु नो वाजसातौ |||
verses.transliteration: ā na indro haribhir yātv achārvācīno 'vase rādhase ca tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśīmaṃ yajñam anu no vājasātau

translations.griffith: May Indra come to us with Tawny Coursers, inclined to us, to favour and enrich us.  May Maghavan, loud-voiced and wielding thunder, stand by us at this sacrifice, in combat.

verses.sanskrit: इमं यज्ञं तवम अस्माकम इन्द्र पुरो दधत सनिष्यसि करतुं नः शवघ्नीव वज्रिन सनये धनानां तवया वयम अर्य आजिं जयेम |||
verses.transliteration: imaṃ yajñaṃ tvam asmākam indra puro dadhat saniṣyasi kratuṃ naḥ śvaghnīva vajrin sanaye dhanānāṃ tvayā vayam arya ājiṃ jayema

translations.griffith: Thou, honouring this our sacrifice, O Indra, shalt give us strength and fill us full of courage.  To win the booty, Thunder-armed! like hunters may we with thee subdue in fight our foemen.

verses.sanskrit: उशन्न उ षु णः सुमना उपाके सोमस्य नु सुषुतस्य सवधावः पा इन्द्र परतिभ्र्तस्य मध्वः सम अन्धसा ममदः पर्ष्ठ्येन |||
verses.transliteration: uśann u ṣu ṇaḥ sumanā upāke somasya nu suṣutasya svadhāvaḥ pā indra pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ sam andhasā mamadaḥ pṛṣṭhyena

translations.griffith: Loving us well, benevolent, close beside us, drink, Godlike Indra, of the well-pressed Soma.  Drink of the meath we offer, and delight thee with food that cometh from the mountain ridges.

verses.sanskrit: वि यो ररप्श रषिभिर नवेभिर वर्क्षो न पक्वः सर्ण्यो न जेता मर्यो न योषाम अभि मन्यमानो ऽछा विवक्मि पुरुहूतम इन्द्रम |||
verses.transliteration: vi yo rarapśa ṛṣibhir navebhir vṛkṣo na pakvaḥ sṛṇyo na jetā maryo na yoṣām abhi manyamāno 'chā vivakmi puruhūtam indram

translations.griffith: Him who is sung aloud by recent sages, like a ripe-fruited tree, a scythe-armed victor,—  I, like a bridegroom thinking of his consort, call hither Indra, him invoked of many;

verses.sanskrit: गिरिर न यः सवतवां रष्व इन्द्रः सनाद एव सहसे जात उग्रः आदर्ता वज्रं सथविरं न भीम उद्नेव कोशं वसुना नयॄष्टम |||
verses.transliteration: ghirir na yaḥ svatavāṃ ṛṣva indraḥ sanād eva sahase jāta ughraḥ ādartā vajraṃ sthaviraṃ na bhīma udneva kośaṃ vasunā nyṝṣṭam

translations.griffith: Him who in native strength is like a mountain, the lofty Indra born or old for conquest,  Terrific wielder of the ancient thunder. filled full with splendour as a jar with water.

verses.sanskrit: न यस्य वर्ता जनुषा नव अस्ति न राधस आमरीता मघस्य उद्वाव्र्षाणस तविषीव उग्रास्मभ्यं दद्धि पुरुहूत रायः |||
verses.transliteration: na yasya vartā januṣā nv asti na rādhasa āmarītā maghasya udvāvṛṣāṇas taviṣīva ughrāsmabhyaṃ daddhi puruhūta rāyaḥ

translations.griffith: Whom from of old there is not one to hinder, none to curtail the riches of his bounty.  Pouring forth freely, O thou Strong and Mighty, vouchsafe us riches, God invoked of many!

verses.sanskrit: ईक्षे रायः कषयस्य चर्षणीनाम उत वरजम अपवर्तासि गोनाम शिक्षानरः समिथेषु परहावान वस्वो राशिम अभिनेतासि भूरिम |||
verses.transliteration: īkṣe rāyaḥ kṣayasya carṣaṇīnām uta vrajam apavartāsi ghonām śikṣānaraḥ samitheṣu prahāvān vasvo rāśim abhinetāsi bhūrim

translations.griffith: Of wealth and homes of men thou art the ruler, and opener of the stable of the cattle.  Helper of men, winner of spoil in combats, thou leadest to an ample heap of riches.

verses.sanskrit: कया तच छर्ण्वे शच्या शचिष्ठो यया कर्णोति मुहु का चिद रष्वः पुरु दाशुषे विचयिष्ठो अंहो ऽथा दधाति दरविणं जरित्रे |||
verses.transliteration: kayā tac chṛṇve śacyā śaciṣṭho yayā kṛṇoti muhu kā cid ṛṣvaḥ puru dāśuṣe vicayiṣṭho aṃho 'thā dadhāti draviṇaṃ jaritre

translations.griffith: By what great might is he renowned as strongest, wherewith the Lofty One stirs up wild battles?  Best soother of the worshipper's great sorrow, he gives possessions to the man who lauds him.

verses.sanskrit: मा नो मर्धीर आ भरा दद्धि तन नः पर दाशुषे दातवे भूरि यत ते नव्ये देष्णे शस्ते अस्मिन त उक्थे पर बरवाम वयम इन्द्र सतुवन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: mā no mardhīr ā bharā daddhi tan naḥ pra dāśuṣe dātave bhūri yat te navye deṣṇe śaste asmin ta ukthe pra bravāma vayam indra stuvantaḥ

translations.griffith: Slay us not; bring, bestow onus the ample gift which thou hast to give to him who offers.  At this new gift, with this laud sung before thee, extolling thee, we, Indra, will declare it.

verses.sanskrit: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for the singer.  A new hymn, Lord of Bays! for thee is fashioned. May we, car-born, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit: आ यात्व इन्द्रो ऽवस उप न इह सतुतः सधमाद अस्तु शूरः वाव्र्धानस तविषीर यस्य पूर्वीर दयौर न कषत्रम अभिभूति पुष्यात |||
verses.transliteration: ā yātv indro 'vasa upa na iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ vāvṛdhānas taviṣīr yasya pūrvīr dyaur na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt

translations.griffith: MAY Indra come to us for our protection; here be the Hero, praised, our feast-companion.  May he whose powers are many, waxen mighty, cherish, like Dyaus, his own supreme dominion.

verses.sanskrit: तस्येद इह सतवथ वर्ष्ण्यानि तुविद्युम्नस्य तुविराधसो नॄन यस्य करतुर विदथ्यो न सम्राट साह्वान तरुत्रो अभ्य अस्ति कर्ष्टीः |||
verses.transliteration: tasyed iha stavatha vṛṣṇyāni tuvidyumnasya tuvirādhaso nṝn yasya kratur vidathyo na samrāṭ sāhvān tarutro abhy asti kṛṣṭīḥ

translations.griffith: Here magnify his great heroic exploits, most glorious One, enriching men with bounties,  Whose will is like a Sovran in assembly, who rules the people, Conqueror, all-surpassing.

verses.sanskrit: आ यात्व इन्द्रो दिव आ पर्थिव्या मक्षू समुद्राद उत वा पुरीषात सवर्णराद अवसे नो मरुत्वान परावतो वा सदनाद रतस्य |||
verses.transliteration: ā yātv indro diva ā pṛthivyā makṣū samudrād uta vā purīṣāt svarṇarād avase no marutvān parāvato vā sadanād ṛtasya

translations.griffith: Hither let Indra come from earth or heaven, hither with speech from firmament or ocean;  With Maruts, from the realm of light to aid us, or from a distance, from the seat of Order.

verses.sanskrit: सथूरस्य रायो बर्हतो य ईशे तम उ षटवाम विदथेष्व इन्द्रम यो वायुना जयति गोमतीषु पर धर्ष्णुया नयति वस्यो अछ |||
verses.transliteration: sthūrasya rāyo bṛhato ya īśe tam u ṣṭavāma vidatheṣv indram yo vāyunā jayati ghomatīṣu pra dhṛṣṇuyā nayati vasyo acha

translations.griffith: That Indra will we laud in our assemblies, him who is Lord of great and lasting riches,  Victor with Vāyu where the herds are gathered, who leads with boldness on to higher fortune.

verses.sanskrit: उप यो नमो नमसि सतभायन्न इयर्ति वाचं जनयन यजध्यै रञ्जसानः पुरुवार उक्थैर एन्द्रं कर्ण्वीत सदनेषु होता |||
verses.transliteration: upa yo namo namasi stabhāyann iyarti vācaṃ janayan yajadhyai ṛñjasānaḥ puruvāra ukthair endraṃ kṛṇvīta sadaneṣu hotā

translations.griffith: May the Priest, Lord of many blessings, striving,—who fixing reverence on reverence, giving  Vent to his voice, inciteth men to worship—with lauds bring Indra hither to our dwellings.

verses.sanskrit: धिषा यदि धिषण्यन्तः सरण्यान सदन्तो अद्रिम औशिजस्य गोहे आ दुरोषाः पास्त्यस्य होता यो नो महान संवरणेषु वह्निः |||
verses.transliteration: dhiṣā yadi dhiṣaṇyantaḥ saraṇyān sadanto adrim auśijasya ghohe ā duroṣāḥ pāstyasya hotā yo no mahān saṃvaraṇeṣu vahniḥ

translations.griffith: When sitting pondering in deep devotion in Auśija's abode they ply the press-stone,  May he whose wrath is fierce, the mighty bearer, come as the house-lord's priest within our chambers.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रा यद ईम भार्वरस्य वर्ष्णः सिषक्ति शुष्म सतुवते भराय गुहा यद ईम औशिजस्य गोहे पर यद धिये परायसे मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: satrā yad īm bhārvarasya vṛṣṇaḥ siṣakti śuṣma stuvate bharāya ghuhā yad īm auśijasya ghohe pra yad dhiye prāyase madāya

translations.griffith: Surely the power of Bhārvara the mighty for ever helpeth to support the singer;  That which in Auśija's abode lies hidden, to come forth for delight and for devotion.

verses.sanskrit: वि यद वरांसि पर्वतस्य वर्ण्वे पयोभिर जिन्वे अपां जवांसि विदद गौरस्य गवयस्य गोहे यदी वाजाय सुध्यो वहन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: vi yad varāṃsi parvatasya vṛṇve payobhir jinve apāṃ javāṃsi vidad ghaurasya ghavayasya ghohe yadī vājāya sudhyo vahanti

translations.griffith: When he unbars the spaces of the mountains, and quickens with his floods the water-torrents,  He finds in lair the buffalo and wild-ox when the wise lead him on to vigorous exploit.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रा ते हस्ता सुक्र्तोत पाणी परयन्तारा सतुवते राध इन्द्र का ते निषत्तिः किम उ नो ममत्सि किं नोद-उद उ हर्षसे दातवा उ |||
verses.transliteration: bhadrā te hastā sukṛtota pāṇī prayantārā stuvate rādha indra kā te niṣattiḥ kim u no mamatsi kiṃ nod-ud u harṣase dātavā u

translations.griffith: Auspicious are thy hands, thine arms well-fashioned which proffer bounty, Indra, to thy praiser.  What sloth is this? Why dost thou not rejoice thee? Why dost thou not delight thyself with giving?

verses.sanskrit: एवा वस्व इन्द्रः सत्यः सम्राड ढन्ता वर्त्रं वरिवः पूरवे कः पुरुष्टुत करत्वा नः शग्धि रायो भक्षीय ते ऽवसो दैव्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: evā vasva indraḥ satyaḥ samrāḍ ḍhantā vṛtraṃ varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ puruṣṭuta kratvā naḥ śaghdhi rāyo bhakṣīya te 'vaso daivyasya

translations.griffith: So Indra is the truthful Lord of treasure. Freedom he gave to man by slaying Vṛtra.  Much-lauded! help us with thy power to riches: may I be sharer of thy Godlike favour.

verses.sanskrit: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for the singer.  For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, care-borne, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit: यन न इन्द्रो जुजुषे यच च वष्टि तन नो महान करति शुष्म्य आ चित बरह्म सतोमम मघवा सोमम उक्था यो अश्मानं शवसा बिभ्रद एति |||
verses.transliteration: yan na indro jujuṣe yac ca vaṣṭi tan no mahān karati śuṣmy ā cit brahma stomam maghavā somam ukthā yo aśmānaṃ śavasā bibhrad eti

translations.griffith: THAT gift of ours which Indra loves and welcomes, even that he makes for us, the Great and Strong One.  He who comes wielding in his might the thunder, Maghavan, gives prayer, praise, and laud, and Soma.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा वर्षन्धिं चतुरश्रिम अस्यन्न उग्रो बाहुभ्यां नर्तमः शचीवान शरिये परुष्णीम उषमाण ऊर्णां यस्याः पर्वाणि सख्याय विव्ये |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā vṛṣandhiṃ caturaśrim asyann ughro bāhubhyāṃ nṛtamaḥ śacīvān śriye paruṣṇīm uṣamāṇa ūrṇāṃ yasyāḥ parvāṇi sakhyāya vivye

translations.griffith: Bull, hurler of the four-edged rain-producer with both his arms, strong, mighty, most heroic;  Wearing as wool Paruṣṇī for adornment, whose joints for sake of friendship he hath covered.

verses.sanskrit: यो देवो देवतमो जायमानो महो वाजेभिर महद्भिश च शुष्मैः दधानो वज्रम बाह्वोर उशन्तं दयाम अमेन रेजयत पर भूम |||
verses.transliteration: yo devo devatamo jāyamāno maho vājebhir mahadbhiś ca śuṣmaiḥ dadhāno vajram bāhvor uśantaṃ dyām amena rejayat pra bhūma

translations.griffith: God who of all the Gods was born divinest, endowed with ample strength and mighty powers,  And bearing in his arms the yearning thunder, with violent rush caused heaven and earth to tremble.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा रोधांसि परवतश च पूर्वीर दयौर रष्वाज जनिमन रेजत कषाः आ मातरा भरति शुष्म्य आ गोर नर्वत परिज्मन नोनुवन्त वाताः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā rodhāṃsi pravataś ca pūrvīr dyaur ṛṣvāj janiman rejata kṣāḥ ā mātarā bharati śuṣmy ā ghor nṛvat parijman nonuvanta vātāḥ

translations.griffith: Before the High God, at his birth, heaven trembled, earth, many floods and all the precipices.  The Strong One bringeth nigh the Bull's two Parents: loud sing the winds, like men, in air's mid-region.

verses.sanskrit: ता तू त इन्द्र महतो महानि विश्वेष्व इत सवनेषु परवाच्या यच छूर धर्ष्णो धर्षता दध्र्ष्वान अहिं वज्रेण शवसाविवेषीः |||
verses.transliteration: tā tū ta indra mahato mahāni viśveṣv it savaneṣu pravācyā yac chūra dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā dadhṛṣvān ahiṃ vajreṇa śavasāviveṣīḥ

translations.griffith: These are thy great deeds, Indra, thine, the Mighty, deeds to be told aloud at all libations,  That thou, O Hero, bold and boldly daring, didst with thy bolt, by strength, destroy the Dragon.

verses.sanskrit: ता तू ते सत्या तुविन्र्म्ण विश्वा पर धेनवः सिस्रते वर्ष्ण ऊध्नः अधा ह तवद वर्षमणो भियानाः पर सिन्धवो जवसा चक्रमन्त |||
verses.transliteration: tā tū te satyā tuvinṛmṇa viśvā pra dhenavaḥ sisrate vṛṣṇa ūdhnaḥ adhā ha tvad vṛṣamaṇo bhiyānāḥ pra sindhavo javasā cakramanta

translations.griffith: True are all these thy deeds, O Most Heroic. The Milch-kine issued from the streaming udder.  In fear of thee, O thou of manly spirit, the rivers swiftly set themselves in motion.

verses.sanskrit: अत्राह ते हरिवस ता उ देवीर अवोभिर इन्द्र सतवन्त सवसारः यत सीम अनु पर मुचो बद्बधाना दीर्घाम अनु परसितिं सयन्दयध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: atrāha te harivas tā u devīr avobhir indra stavanta svasāraḥ yat sīm anu pra muco badbadhānā dīrghām anu prasitiṃ syandayadhyai

translations.griffith: With joy, O Indra, Lord of Tawny Coursers, the Sisters then, these Goddesses, extolled thee,  When thou didst give the prisoned ones their freedom to wander at their will in long succession.

verses.sanskrit: पिपीळे अंशुर मद्यो न सिन्धुर आ तवा शमी शशमानस्य शक्तिः अस्मद्र्यक छुशुचानस्य यम्या आशुर न रश्मिं तुव्योजसं गोः |||
verses.transliteration: pipīḷe aṃśur madyo na sindhur ā tvā śamī śaśamānasya śaktiḥ asmadryak chuśucānasya yamyā āśur na raśmiṃ tuvyojasaṃ ghoḥ

translations.griffith: Pressed is the gladdening stalk as ’twere a river: so let the rite, the toiler's power, attract thee  To us-ward, of the Bright One, as the courser strains his. exceedingly strong leather bridle.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे वर्षिष्ठा कर्णुहि जयेष्ठा नर्म्णानि सत्रा सहुरे सहांसि अस्मभ्यं वर्त्रा सुहनानि रन्धि जहि वधर वनुषो मर्त्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: asme varṣiṣṭhā kṛṇuhi jyeṣṭhā nṛmṇāni satrā sahure sahāṃsi asmabhyaṃ vṛtrā suhanāni randhi jahi vadhar vanuṣo martyasya

translations.griffith: Ever by us perform thy most heroic, thine highest, best victorious deeds, O Victor.  For us make Vṛtras easy to be conquered: destroy the weapon of our mortal foeman.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकम इत सु शर्णुहि तवम इन्द्रास्मभ्यं चित्रां उप माहि वाजान अस्मभ्यं विश्वा इषणः पुरंधीर अस्माकं सु मघवन बोधि गोदाः |||
verses.transliteration: asmākam it su śṛṇuhi tvam indrāsmabhyaṃ citrāṃ upa māhi vājān asmabhyaṃ viśvā iṣaṇaḥ puraṃdhīr asmākaṃ su maghavan bodhi ghodāḥ

translations.griffith: Graciously listen to our prayer, O Indra, and strength of varied sort bestow thou on us.  Send to us all intelligence arid wisdom O Maghavan, be he who gives us cattle.

verses.sanskrit: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell high like rivers to the singer.  For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit: कथा महाम अव्र्धत कस्य होतुर यज्ञं जुषाणो अभि सोमम ऊधः पिबन्न उशानो जुषमाणो अन्धो ववक्ष रष्वः शुचते धनाय |||
verses.transliteration: kathā mahām avṛdhat kasya hotur yajñaṃ juṣāṇo abhi somam ūdhaḥ pibann uśāno juṣamāṇo andho vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ śucate dhanāya

translations.griffith: How, what priest's sacrifice hath he made mighty, rejoicing in the Soma and its fountain?  Delighting in juice, eagerly drinking, the Lofty One hath waxed for splendid riches.

verses.sanskrit: को अस्य वीरः सधमादम आप सम आनंश सुमतिभिः को अस्य कद अस्य चित्रं चिकिते कद ऊती वर्धे भुवच छशमानस्य यज्योः |||
verses.transliteration: ko asya vīraḥ sadhamādam āpa sam ānaṃśa sumatibhiḥ ko asya kad asya citraṃ cikite kad ūtī vṛdhe bhuvac chaśamānasya yajyoḥ

translations.griffith: What hero hath been made his feast-companion? Who hath been partner in his loving-kindness?  What know we of his wondrous acts? How often comes he to aid and speed the pious toiler?

verses.sanskrit: कथा शर्णोति हूयमानम इन्द्रः कथा शर्ण्वन्न अवसाम अस्य वेद का अस्य पूर्वीर उपमातयो ह कथैनम आहुः पपुरिं जरित्रे |||
verses.transliteration: kathā śṛṇoti hūyamānam indraḥ kathā śṛṇvann avasām asya veda kā asya pūrvīr upamātayo ha kathainam āhuḥ papuriṃ jaritre

translations.griffith: How heareth Indra offered invocation? How, hearing, marketh he the invoker's wishes?  What are his ancient acts of bounty? Wherefore call they him One who filleth full the singer?

verses.sanskrit: कथा सबाधः शशमानो अस्य नशद अभि दरविणं दीध्यानः देवो भुवन नवेदा म रतानां नमो जग्र्भ्वां अभि यज जुजोषत |||
verses.transliteration: kathā sabādhaḥ śaśamāno asya naśad abhi draviṇaṃ dīdhyānaḥ devo bhuvan navedā ma ṛtānāṃ namo jaghṛbhvāṃ abhi yaj jujoṣat

translations.griffith: How doth the priest who laboureth, ever longing, win for himself the wealth which he possesseth?  May he, the God, mark well my truthful praises, having received the homage which he loveth.

verses.sanskrit: कथा कद अस्या उषसो वयुष्टौ देवो मर्तस्य सख्यं जुजोष कथा कद अस्य सख्यं सखिभ्यो ये अस्मिन कामं सुयुजं ततस्रे |||
verses.transliteration: kathā kad asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau devo martasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa kathā kad asya sakhyaṃ sakhibhyo ye asmin kāmaṃ suyujaṃ tatasre

translations.griffith: How, and what bond of friendship with a mortal hath the God chosen as this morn is breaking?  How, and what love hath he for those who love him, who have entwined in him their firm affection?

verses.sanskrit: किम आद अमत्रं सख्यं सखिभ्यः कदा नु ते भरात्रम पर बरवाम शरिये सुद्र्शो वपुर अस्य सर्गाः सवर ण चित्रतमम इष आ गोः |||
verses.transliteration: kim ād amatraṃ sakhyaṃ sakhibhyaḥ kadā nu te bhrātram pra bravāma śriye sudṛśo vapur asya sarghāḥ svar ṇa citratamam iṣa ā ghoḥ

translations.griffith: Is then thy friendship with thy friends most mighty? Thy brotherhood with us,—when may we tell it?  The streams of milk move, as most wondrous sunlight, the beauty of the Lovely One for glory.

verses.sanskrit: दरुहं जिघांसन धवरसम अनिन्द्रां तेतिक्ते तिग्मा तुजसे अनीका रणा चिद यत्र रणया न उग्रो दूरे अज्ञाता उषसो बबाधे |||
verses.transliteration: druhaṃ jighāṃsan dhvarasam anindrāṃ tetikte tighmā tujase anīkā ṛṇā cid yatra ṛṇayā na ughro dūre ajñātā uṣaso babādhe

translations.griffith: About to stay the Indra-less destructive spirit he sharpens his keen arms to strike her.  Whereby the Strong, although our debts’ exactor, drives in the distant mornings that we know not.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य हि शुरुधः सन्ति पूर्वीर रतस्य धीतिर वर्जिनानि हन्ति रतस्य शलोको बधिरा ततर्द कर्णा बुधानः शुचमान आयोः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya hi śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīr ṛtasya dhītir vṛjināni hanti ṛtasya śloko badhirā tatarda karṇā budhānaḥ śucamāna āyoḥ

translations.griffith: Eternal Law hath varied food that strengthens; thought of eternal Law, removes transgressions.  The praise-hymn of eternal Law, arousing, glowing, hath oped the deaf ears of the living.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य दर्ळ्हा धरुणानि सन्ति पुरूणि चन्द्रा वपुषे वपूंषि रतेन दीर्घम इषणन्त पर्क्ष रतेन गाव रतम आ विवेशुः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya dṛḷhā dharuṇāni santi purūṇi candrā vapuṣe vapūṃṣi ṛtena dīrgham iṣaṇanta pṛkṣa ṛtena ghāva ṛtam ā viveśuḥ

translations.griffith: Firm-seated are eternal Law's foundations in its fair form are many splendid beauties.  By holy Law long lasting food they bring us; by holy Law have cows come to our worship.

verses.sanskrit: रतं येमान रतम इद वनोत्य रतस्य शुष्मस तुरया उ गव्युः रताय पर्थ्वी बहुले गभीरे रताय धेनू परमे दुहाते |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtaṃ yemāna ṛtam id vanoty ṛtasya śuṣmas turayā u ghavyuḥ ṛtāya pṛthvī bahule ghabhīre ṛtāya dhenū parame duhāte

translations.griffith: Fixing eternal Law he, too, upholds it swift moves the might of Law and wins the booty.  To Law belong the vast deep Earth and Heaven: Milch-kine supreme, to Law their milk they render.

verses.sanskrit: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded,—glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers to the singer.  For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit: का सुष्टुतिः शवसः सूनुम इन्द्रम अर्वाचीनं राधस आ ववर्तत ददिर हि वीरो गर्णते वसूनि स गोपतिर निष्षिधां नो जनासः |||
verses.transliteration: kā suṣṭutiḥ śavasaḥ sūnum indram arvācīnaṃ rādhasa ā vavartat dadir hi vīro ghṛṇate vasūni sa ghopatir niṣṣidhāṃ no janāsaḥ

translations.griffith: WHAT worthy praise will bring before us Indra, the Son of Strength, that he may grant us riches;  For he the Hero, gives the singer treasures: he is the Lord who sends us gifts, ye people.

verses.sanskrit: स वर्त्रहत्ये हव्यः स ईड्यः स सुष्टुत इन्द्रः सत्यराधाः स यामन्न आ मघवा मर्त्याय बरह्मण्यते सुष्वये वरिवो धात |||
verses.transliteration: sa vṛtrahatye havyaḥ sa īḍyaḥ sa suṣṭuta indraḥ satyarādhāḥ sa yāmann ā maghavā martyāya brahmaṇyate suṣvaye varivo dhāt

translations.griffith: To be invoked and hymned in fight with Vṛtra, that well-praised Indra gives us real bounties.  That Maghavan brings comfort in the foray to the religious man who pours libations.

verses.sanskrit: तम इन नरो वि हवयन्ते समीके रिरिक्वांसस तन्वः कर्ण्वत तराम मिथो यत तयागम उभयासो अग्मन नरस तोकस्य तनयस्य सातौ |||
verses.transliteration: tam in naro vi hvayante samīke ririkvāṃsas tanvaḥ kṛṇvata trām mitho yat tyāgham ubhayāso aghman naras tokasya tanayasya sātau

translations.griffith: Him, verily, the men invoke in combat; risking their lives they make him their protector,  When heroes, foe to foe, give up their bodies, fighting, each side, for children and their offspring.

verses.sanskrit: करतूयन्ति कषितयो योग उग्राशुषाणासो मिथो अर्णसातौ सं यद विशो ऽवव्र्त्रन्त युध्मा आद इन नेम इन्द्रयन्ते अभीके |||
verses.transliteration: kratūyanti kṣitayo yogha ughrāśuṣāṇāso mitho arṇasātau saṃ yad viśo 'vavṛtranta yudhmā ād in nema indrayante abhīke

translations.griffith: Strong God! the folk at need put forth their vigour, striving together in the whirl of battle.  When warrior bands encounter one another some in the grapple quit themselves like Indra.

verses.sanskrit: आद इद ध नेम इन्द्रियं यजन्त आद इत पक्तिः पुरोळाशं रिरिच्यात आद इत सोमो वि पप्र्च्याद असुष्वीन आद इज जुजोष वर्षभं यजध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: ād id dha nema indriyaṃ yajanta ād it paktiḥ puroḷāśaṃ riricyāt ād it somo vi papṛcyād asuṣvīn ād ij jujoṣa vṛṣabhaṃ yajadhyai

translations.griffith: Hence many a one worships the might of Indra: hence let the brew succeed the meal-oblation.  Hence let the Soma banish those who pour not: even hence I joy to pay the Strong One worship.

verses.sanskrit: कर्णोत्य अस्मै वरिवो य इत्थेन्द्राय सोमम उशते सुनोति सध्रीचीनेन मनसाविवेनन तम इत सखायं कर्णुते समत्सु |||
verses.transliteration: kṛṇoty asmai varivo ya itthendrāya somam uśate sunoti sadhrīcīnena manasāvivenan tam it sakhāyaṃ kṛṇute samatsu

translations.griffith: Indra gives comfort to the man who truly presses, for him who longs  for  it, the Soma,  Not disaffected, with devoted spirit this man he takes to be his friend in battles.

verses.sanskrit: य इन्द्राय सुनवत सोमम अद्य पचात पक्तीर उत भर्ज्जाति धानाः परति मनायोर उचथानि हर्यन तस्मिन दधद वर्षणं शुष्मम इन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: ya indrāya sunavat somam adya pacāt paktīr uta bhṛjjāti dhānāḥ prati manāyor ucathāni haryan tasmin dadhad vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmam indraḥ

translations.griffith: He who this day for Indra presses Soma, prepares the brew and fries the grains of barley—  Loving the hymns of that devoted servant, to him may Indra give heroic vigour.

verses.sanskrit: यदा समर्यं वय अचेद रघावा दीर्घं यद आजिम अभ्य अख्यद अर्यः अचिक्रदद वर्षणम पत्न्य अछा दुरोण आ निशितं सोमसुद्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: yadā samaryaṃ vy aced ṛghāvā dīrghaṃ yad ājim abhy akhyad aryaḥ acikradad vṛṣaṇam patny achā duroṇa ā niśitaṃ somasudbhiḥ

translations.griffith: When the impetuous chief hath sought the  conflict  , and the lord looked upon the long-drawn battle,  The matron calls to the Strong God whom pressers of Soma have encouraged in the dwelling.

verses.sanskrit: भूयसा वस्नम अचरत कनीयो ऽविक्रीतो अकानिषम पुनर यन स भूयसा कनीयो नारिरेचीद दीना दक्षा वि दुहन्ति पर वाणम |||
verses.transliteration: bhūyasā vasnam acarat kanīyo 'vikrīto akāniṣam punar yan sa bhūyasā kanīyo nārirecīd dīnā dakṣā vi duhanti pra vāṇam

translations.griffith: He bid a small price for a thing of value: I was content, returning, still unpurchased.  He heightened not his insufficient offer. Simple and clever, both milk out the udder.

verses.sanskrit: क इमं दशभिर ममेन्द्रं करीणाति धेनुभिः यदा वर्त्राणि जङघनद अथैनम मे पुनर ददत |||
verses.transliteration: ka imaṃ daśabhir mamendraṃ krīṇāti dhenubhiḥ yadā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad athainam me punar dadat

translations.griffith: Who for ten milch-kine purchaseth from me this Indra who is mine?  When he hath slain the Vṛtras let the buyer give him back to me.

verses.sanskrit: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ

translations.griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell high like rivers for the singer.  For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit: को अद्य नर्यो देवकाम उशन्न इन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुजोष को वा महे ऽवसे पार्याय समिद्धे अग्नौ सुतसोम ईट्टे |||
verses.transliteration: ko adya naryo devakāma uśann indrasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa ko vā mahe 'vase pāryāya samiddhe aghnau sutasoma īṭṭe

translations.griffith: WHAT friend of man, God-loving, hath delighted, yearning therefor, this day in Indra's friendship?  Who with enkindled flame and flowing Soma laudeth him for his great protecting favour?

verses.sanskrit: को नानाम वचसा सोम्याय मनायुर वा भवति वस्त उस्राः क इन्द्रस्य युज्यं कः सखित्वं को भरात्रं वष्टि कवये क ऊती |||
verses.transliteration: ko nānāma vacasā somyāya manāyur vā bhavati vasta usrāḥ ka indrasya yujyaṃ kaḥ sakhitvaṃ ko bhrātraṃ vaṣṭi kavaye ka ūtī

translations.griffith: Who hath with prayer bowed to the Soma-lover? What pious man endues the beams of morning?  Who seeks bond, friendship, brotherhood with Indra? Who hath recourse unto the Sage for succour?

verses.sanskrit: को देवानाम अवो अद्या वर्णीते क आदित्यां अदितिं जयोतिर ईट्टे कस्याश्विनाव इन्द्रो अग्निः सुतस्यांशोः पिबन्ति मनसाविवेनम |||
verses.transliteration: ko devānām avo adyā vṛṇīte ka ādityāṃ aditiṃ jyotir īṭṭe kasyāśvināv indro aghniḥ sutasyāṃśoḥ pibanti manasāvivenam

translations.griffith: Who claims to-day the Deities' protection, asks Aditi for light, or the Ādityas?  Of whose pressed stalk of Soma drink the Aśvins, Indra, and Agni, well-inclined in spirit?

verses.sanskrit: तस्मा अग्निर भारतः शर्म यंसज जयोक पश्यात सूर्यम उच्चरन्तम य इन्द्राय सुनवामेत्य आह नरे नर्याय नर्तमाय नर्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: tasmā aghnir bhārataḥ śarma yaṃsaj jyok paśyāt sūryam uccarantam ya indrāya sunavāmety āha nare naryāya nṛtamāya nṛṇām

translations.griffith: To him shall Agni Bhārata give shelter: long shall he look upon the Sun up-rising,  Who sayeth, Let us press the juice for Indra, man's Friend, the Hero manliest of heroes.

verses.sanskrit: न तं जिनन्ति बहवो न दभ्रा उर्व अस्मा अदितिः शर्म यंसत परियः सुक्र्त परिय इन्द्रे मनायुः परियः सुप्रावीः परियो अस्य सोमी |||
verses.transliteration: na taṃ jinanti bahavo na dabhrā urv asmā aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat priyaḥ sukṛt priya indre manāyuḥ priyaḥ suprāvīḥ priyo asya somī

translations.griffith: Him neither few men overcome, nor many to him shall Aditi give spacious shelter.  Dear is the pious, the devout, to Indra dear is the zealous, dear the Soma-bringer.

verses.sanskrit: सुप्राव्यः पराशुषाळ एष वीरः सुष्वेः पक्तिं कर्णुते केवलेन्द्रः नासुष्वेर आपिर न सखा न जामिर दुष्प्राव्यो ऽवहन्तेद अवाचः |||
verses.transliteration: suprāvyaḥ prāśuṣāḷ eṣa vīraḥ suṣveḥ paktiṃ kṛṇute kevalendraḥ nāsuṣver āpir na sakhā na jāmir duṣprāvyo 'vahanted avācaḥ

translations.griffith: This Hero curbs the mighty for the zealous: the presser's brew Indra possesses solely:  No brother, kin, or friend to him who pours not, destroyer of the dumb who would resist him.

verses.sanskrit: न रेवता पणिना सख्यम इन्द्रो ऽसुन्वता सुतपाः सं गर्णीते आस्य वेदः खिदति हन्ति नग्नं वि सुष्वये पक्तये केवलो भूत |||
verses.transliteration: na revatā paṇinā sakhyam indro 'sunvatā sutapāḥ saṃ ghṛṇīte āsya vedaḥ khidati hanti naghnaṃ vi suṣvaye paktaye kevalo bhūt

translations.griffith: Not with the wealthy churl who pours no Soma doth Indra, Soma-drinker, bind alliance.  He draws away his wealth and slays him naked, own Friend to him who offers, for oblation.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रम परे ऽवरे मध्यमास इन्द्रं यान्तो ऽवसितास इन्द्रम इन्द्रं कषियन्त उत युध्यमाना इन्द्रं नरो वाजयन्तो हवन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: indram pare 'vare madhyamāsa indraṃ yānto 'vasitāsa indram indraṃ kṣiyanta uta yudhyamānā indraṃ naro vājayanto havante

translations.griffith: Highest and lowest, men who stand between diem, going, returning, dwelling in contentment,  Those who show forth their strength when urged to battle-these are the men who call for aid on Indra.

verses.sanskrit: अहम मनुर अभवं सूर्यश चाहं कक्षीवां रषिर अस्मि विप्रः अहं कुत्सम आर्जुनेयं नय ॠञ्जे ऽहं कविर उशना पश्यता मा |||
verses.transliteration: aham manur abhavaṃ sūryaś cāhaṃ kakṣīvāṃ ṛṣir asmi vipraḥ ahaṃ kutsam ārjuneyaṃ ny ṝñje 'haṃ kavir uśanā paśyatā mā

translations.griffith: I WAS aforetime Manu, I was Sūrya: I am the sage Kakṣīvān, holy singer.  Kutsa the son of Ārjuni I master. I am the sapient Uśanā behold me.

verses.sanskrit: अहम भूमिम अददाम आर्यायाहं वर्ष्टिं दाशुषे मर्त्याय अहम अपो अनयं वावशाना मम देवासो अनु केतम आयन |||
verses.transliteration: aham bhūmim adadām āryāyāhaṃ vṛṣṭiṃ dāśuṣe martyāya aham apo anayaṃ vāvaśānā mama devāso anu ketam āyan

translations.griffith: I have bestowed the earth upon the Ārya, and rain upon the man who brings oblation.  I guided forth the loudly-roaring waters, and the Gods moved according to my pleasure.

verses.sanskrit: अहम पुरो मन्दसानो वय ऐरं नव साकं नवतीः शम्बरस्य शततमं वेश्यं सर्वताता दिवोदासम अतिथिग्वं यद आवम |||
verses.transliteration: aham puro mandasāno vy airaṃ nava sākaṃ navatīḥ śambarasya śatatamaṃ veśyaṃ sarvatātā divodāsam atithighvaṃ yad āvam

translations.griffith: In the wild joy of Soma I demolished Śambara's forts, ninety-and-nine, together;  And, utterly, the hundredth habitation, when helping Divodāsa Atithigva.

verses.sanskrit: पर सु ष विभ्यो मरुतो विर अस्तु पर शयेनः शयेनेभ्य आशुपत्वा अचक्रया यत सवधया सुपर्णो हव्यम भरन मनवे देवजुष्टम |||
verses.transliteration: pra su ṣa vibhyo maruto vir astu pra śyenaḥ śyenebhya āśupatvā acakrayā yat svadhayā suparṇo havyam bharan manave devajuṣṭam

translations.griffith: Before all birds be ranked this Bird, O Maruts; supreme of falcons be this fleet-winged Falcon,  Because, strong- pinioned, with no car to bear him, he brought to Manu the Godloved oblation.

verses.sanskrit: भरद यदि विर अतो वेविजानः पथोरुणा मनोजवा असर्जि तूयं ययौ मधुना सोम्येनोत शरवो विविदे शयेनो अत्र |||
verses.transliteration: bharad yadi vir ato vevijānaḥ pathoruṇā manojavā asarji tūyaṃ yayau madhunā somyenota śravo vivide śyeno atra

translations.griffith: When the Bird brought it, hence in rapid motion sent on the wide path fleet as thought he hurried.  Swift he returned with sweetness of the Soma, and hence the Falcon hath acquired his glory.

verses.sanskrit: रजीपी शयेनो ददमानो अंशुम परावतः शकुनो मन्द्रम मदम सोमम भरद दाद्र्हाणो देवावान दिवो अमुष्माद उत्तराद आदाय |||
verses.transliteration: ṛjīpī śyeno dadamāno aṃśum parāvataḥ śakuno mandram madam somam bharad dādṛhāṇo devāvān divo amuṣmād uttarād ādāya

translations.griffith: Bearing the stalk, the Falcon speeding onward, Bird bringing from afar the draught that gladdens,  Friend of the Gods, brought, grasping fast, the Soma which be bad taken from yon loftiest heaven.

verses.sanskrit: आदाय शयेनो अभरत सोमं सहस्रं सवां अयुतं च साकम अत्रा पुरंधिर अजहाद अरातीर मदे सोमस्य मूरा अमूरः |||
verses.transliteration: ādāya śyeno abharat somaṃ sahasraṃ savāṃ ayutaṃ ca sākam atrā puraṃdhir ajahād arātīr made somasya mūrā amūraḥ

translations.griffith: The Falcon took and brought the Soma, bearing thousand libations with him, yea, ten thousand.  The Bold One left Malignities behind him, wise, in wild joy of Soma, left the foolish.

verses.sanskrit: गर्भे नु सन्न अन्व एषाम अवेदम अहं देवानां जनिमानि विश्वा शतम मा पुर आयसीर अरक्षन्न अध शयेनो जवसा निर अदीयम |||
verses.transliteration: gharbhe nu sann anv eṣām avedam ahaṃ devānāṃ janimāni viśvā śatam mā pura āyasīr arakṣann adha śyeno javasā nir adīyam

translations.griffith: I, As I lay within the womb, considered all generations of these Gods in order.  A hundred iron fortresses confined me but forth I flew with rapid speed a Falcon.

verses.sanskrit: न घा स माम अप जोषं जभाराभीम आस तवक्षसा वीर्येण ईर्मा पुरंधिर अजहाद अरातीर उत वातां अतरच छूशुवानः |||
verses.transliteration: na ghā sa mām apa joṣaṃ jabhārābhīm āsa tvakṣasā vīryeṇa īrmā puraṃdhir ajahād arātīr uta vātāṃ atarac chūśuvānaḥ

translations.griffith: Not at his own free pleasure did he bear me: he conquered with his strength and manly courage.  Straightway the Bold One left the fiends behind him and passed the winds as he grew yet more mighty.

verses.sanskrit: अव यच छयेनो अस्वनीद अध दयोर वि यद यदि वात ऊहुः पुरंधिम सर्जद यद अस्मा अव ह कषिपज जयां कर्शानुर अस्ता मनसा भुरण्यन |||
verses.transliteration: ava yac chyeno asvanīd adha dyor vi yad yadi vāta ūhuḥ puraṃdhim sṛjad yad asmā ava ha kṣipaj jyāṃ kṛśānur astā manasā bhuraṇyan

translations.griffith: When with loud cry from heaven down sped the Falcon, thence hasting like the wind he bore the Bold One.  Then, wildly raging in his mind, the archer Kṛśānu aimed and loosed the string to strike him.

verses.sanskrit: रजिप्य ईम इन्द्रावतो न भुज्युं शयेनो जभार बर्हतो अधि षणोः अन्तः पतत पतत्र्य अस्य पर्णम अध यामनि परसितस्य तद वेः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛjipya īm indrāvato na bhujyuṃ śyeno jabhāra bṛhato adhi ṣṇoḥ antaḥ patat patatry asya parṇam adha yāmani prasitasya tad veḥ

translations.griffith: The Falcon bore him from heaven's lofty summit as the swift car of Indra's Friend bore Bhujyu.  Then downward hither fell a flying feather of the Bird hasting forward in his journey.

verses.sanskrit: अध शवेतं कलशं गोभिर अक्तम आपिप्यानम मघवा शुक्रम अन्धः अध्वर्युभिः परयतम मध्वो अग्रम इन्द्रो मदाय परति धत पिबध्यै शूरो मदाय परति धत पिबध्यै |||
verses.transliteration: adha śvetaṃ kalaśaṃ ghobhir aktam āpipyānam maghavā śukram andhaḥ adhvaryubhiḥ prayatam madhvo aghram indro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai śūro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai

translations.griffith: And now let Maghavan accept the beaker, white, filled with milk, filled with the shining liquid;  The best of sweet meath which the priests have offered: that Indra to his joy may drink, the Hero, that he may take and drink it to his rapture.

verses.sanskrit: तवा युजा तव तत सोम सख्य इन्द्रो अपो मनवे सस्रुतस कः अहन्न अहिम अरिणात सप्त सिन्धून अपाव्र्णोद अपिहितेव खानि |||
verses.transliteration: tvā yujā tava tat soma sakhya indro apo manave sasrutas kaḥ ahann ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn apāvṛṇod apihiteva khāni

translations.griffith: ALLIED with thee, in this thy friendship, Soma, Indra for man made waters flow together,  Slew Ahi, and sent forth the Seven Rivers, and opened as it were obstructed fountains.

verses.sanskrit: तवा युजा नि खिदत सूर्यस्येन्द्रश चक्रं सहसा सद्य इन्दो अधि षणुना बर्हता वर्तमानम महो दरुहो अप विश्वायु धायि |||
verses.transliteration: tvā yujā ni khidat sūryasyendraś cakraṃ sahasā sadya indo adhi ṣṇunā bṛhatā vartamānam maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi

translations.griffith: Indu, with thee for his confederate, Indra swiftly with might pressed down the wheel of Sūrya.  What rolled, all life's support, on heaven's high summit was separated from the great oppressor.

verses.sanskrit: अहन्न इन्द्रो अदहद अग्निर इन्दो पुरा दस्यून मध्यंदिनाद अभीके दुर्गे दुरोणे करत्वा न याताम पुरू सहस्रा शर्वा नि बर्हीत |||
verses.transliteration: ahann indro adahad aghnir indo purā dasyūn madhyaṃdinād abhīke durghe duroṇe kratvā na yātām purū sahasrā śarvā ni barhīt

translations.griffith: Indra smote down, Agni consumed, O Indu, the Dasyus ere the noontide in the conflict.  Of those who gladly sought a hard-won dwelling he cast down many a thousand with his arrow.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्मात सीम अधमां इन्द्र दस्यून विशो दासीर अक्र्णोर अप्रशस्ताः अबाधेथाम अम्र्णतं नि शत्रून अविन्देथाम अपचितिं वधत्रैः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasmāt sīm adhamāṃ indra dasyūn viśo dāsīr akṛṇor apraśastāḥ abādhethām amṛṇataṃ ni śatrūn avindethām apacitiṃ vadhatraiḥ

translations.griffith: Lower than all besides hast thou, O Indra, cast down the Dasyus, abject tribes of Dāsas.  Ye drave away, ye put to death the foemen, and took great vengeance with your murdering weapons.

verses.sanskrit: एवा सत्यम मघवाना युवं तद इन्द्रश च सोमोर्वम अश्व्यं गोः आदर्द्र्तम अपिहितान्य अश्ना रिरिचथुः कषाश चित तत्र्दाना |||
verses.transliteration: evā satyam maghavānā yuvaṃ tad indraś ca somorvam aśvyaṃ ghoḥ ādardṛtam apihitāny aśnā riricathuḥ kṣāś cit tatṛdānā

translations.griffith: So, of a truth, Indra and Soma, Heroes, ye burst the stable of the kine and horses,  The stable which the bar or stone obstructed; and piercing through set free the habitations.

verses.sanskrit: आ न सतुत उप वाजेभिर ऊती इन्द्र याहि हरिभिर मन्दसानः तिरश चिद अर्यः सवना पुरूण्य आङगूषेभिर गर्णानः सत्यराधाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā na stuta upa vājebhir ūtī indra yāhi haribhir mandasānaḥ tiraś cid aryaḥ savanā purūṇy āṅghūṣebhir ghṛṇānaḥ satyarādhāḥ

translations.griffith: COME, lauded, unto us with powers and succours, O Indra, with thy Tawny Steeds; exulting,  Past even the foeman's manifold libations, glorified with our hymns, true Wealth-bestower.

verses.sanskrit: आ हि षमा याति नर्यश चिकित्वान हूयमानः सोत्र्भिर उप यज्ञम सवश्वो यो अभीरुर मन्यमानः सुष्वाणेभिर मदति सं ह वीरैः |||
verses.transliteration: ā hi ṣmā yāti naryaś cikitvān hūyamānaḥ sotṛbhir upa yajñam svaśvo yo abhīrur manyamānaḥ suṣvāṇebhir madati saṃ ha vīraiḥ

translations.griffith: Man's Friend, to this our sacrifice he cometh marking how he is called by Soma-pressers.  Fearless, and conscious that his Steeds are noble, he joyeth with the Soma-pouring heroes.

verses.sanskrit: शरावयेद अस्य कर्णा वाजयध्यै जुष्टाम अनु पर दिशम मन्दयध्यै उद्वाव्र्षाणो राधसे तुविष्मान करन न इन्द्रः सुतीर्थाभयं च |||
verses.transliteration: śrāvayed asya karṇā vājayadhyai juṣṭām anu pra diśam mandayadhyai udvāvṛṣāṇo rādhase tuviṣmān karan na indraḥ sutīrthābhayaṃ ca

translations.griffith: Make his cars hear, that he may show his vigour and may be joyful in the way he loveth.  May mighty Indra pouring forth in bounty bestow on us good roads and perfect safety;

verses.sanskrit: अछा यो गन्ता नाधमानम ऊती इत्था विप्रं हवमानं गर्णन्तम उप तमनि दधानो धुर्य आशून सहस्राणि शतानि वज्रबाहुः |||
verses.transliteration: achā yo ghantā nādhamānam ūtī itthā vipraṃ havamānaṃ ghṛṇantam upa tmani dadhāno dhury āśūn sahasrāṇi śatāni vajrabāhuḥ

translations.griffith: He who with succour comes to his implorer, the singer here who with his song invites him;  He who himself sets to the pole swift Coursers, he who hath hundreds, thousands, Thunder-wielder.

verses.sanskrit: तवोतासो मघवन्न इन्द्र विप्रा वयं ते सयाम सूरयो गर्णन्तः भेजानासो बर्हद्दिवस्य राय आकाय्यस्य दावने पुरुक्षोः |||
verses.transliteration: tvotāso maghavann indra viprā vayaṃ te syāma sūrayo ghṛṇantaḥ bhejānāso bṛhaddivasya rāya ākāyyasya dāvane purukṣoḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra Maghavan, by thee protected may we be thine, princes and priests and singers,  Sharing the riches sent from lofty heaven which yields much food, and all desire its bounty.

verses.sanskrit: नकिर इन्द्र तवद उत्तरो न जयायां अस्ति वर्त्रहन नकिर एवा यथा तवम |||
verses.transliteration: nakir indra tvad uttaro na jyāyāṃ asti vṛtrahan nakir evā yathā tvam

translations.griffith: O INDRA, Vṛtra-slayer, none is better, mightier than thou:  Verily there is none like thee.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रा ते अनु कर्ष्टयो विश्वा चक्रेव वाव्र्तुः सत्रा महां असि शरुतः |||
verses.transliteration: satrā te anu kṛṣṭayo viśvā cakreva vāvṛtuḥ satrā mahāṃ asi śrutaḥ

translations.griffith: Like chariot-wheels these people all together follow after thee:  Thou ever art renowned as Great.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे चनेद अना तवा देवास इन्द्र युयुधुः यद अहा नक्तम आतिरः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve caned anā tvā devāsa indra yuyudhuḥ yad ahā naktam ātiraḥ

translations.griffith: Not even all the gathered Gods conquered thee, Indra, in the war,  When thou didst lengthen days by night.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रोत बाधितेभ्यश चक्रं कुत्साय युध्यते मुषाय इन्द्र सूर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: yatrota bādhitebhyaś cakraṃ kutsāya yudhyate muṣāya indra sūryam

translations.griffith: When for the sake of those oppressed, and Kutsa as he battled,  Thou stolest away the Sun's car-wheel.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र देवां रघायतो विश्वां अयुध्य एक इत तवम इन्द्र वनूंर अहन |||
verses.transliteration: yatra devāṃ ṛghāyato viśvāṃ ayudhya eka it tvam indra vanūṃr ahan

translations.griffith: When, fighting singly, Indra. thou o’ercamest all the furious Gods, thou slewest those who strove with thee.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रोत मर्त्याय कम अरिणा इन्द्र सूर्यम परावः शचीभिर एतशम |||
verses.transliteration: yatrota martyāya kam ariṇā indra sūryam prāvaḥ śacībhir etaśam

translations.griffith: When also for a mortal man, Indra, thou speddest forth the Sun,  And holpest Etaśa with might.

verses.sanskrit: किम आद उतासि वर्त्रहन मघवन मन्युमत्तमः अत्राह दानुम आतिरः |||
verses.transliteration: kim ād utāsi vṛtrahan maghavan manyumattamaḥ atrāha dānum ātiraḥ

translations.griffith: What? Vṛtra-slayer, art not thou, Maghavan, fiercest in thy wrath?  So hast thou quelled the demon too.

verses.sanskrit: एतद घेद उत वीर्यम इन्द्र चकर्थ पौंस्यम सत्रियं यद दुर्हणायुवं वधीर दुहितरं दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: etad ghed uta vīryam indra cakartha pauṃsyam striyaṃ yad durhaṇāyuvaṃ vadhīr duhitaraṃ divaḥ

translations.griffith: And this heroic deed of might thou, Indra, also hast achieved,  That thou didst smite to death the Dame, Heaven's Daughter, meditating ill.

verses.sanskrit: दिवश चिद घा दुहितरम महान महीयमानाम उषासम इन्द्र सम पिणक |||
verses.transliteration: divaś cid ghā duhitaram mahān mahīyamānām uṣāsam indra sam piṇak

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, Mighty One, didst crush Uṣas, though Daughter of the Sky.  When lifting up herself in pride.

verses.sanskrit: अपोषा अनसः सरत सम्पिष्टाद अह बिभ्युषी नि यत सीं शिश्नथद वर्षा |||
verses.transliteration: apoṣā anasaḥ sarat sampiṣṭād aha bibhyuṣī ni yat sīṃ śiśnathad vṛṣā

translations.griffith: Then from her chariot Uṣas fled, affrighted, from her ruined car.  When the strong God had shattered it.

verses.sanskrit: एतद अस्या अनः शये सुसम्पिष्टं विपाश्य आ ससार सीम परावतः |||
verses.transliteration: etad asyā anaḥ śaye susampiṣṭaṃ vipāśy ā sasāra sīm parāvataḥ

translations.griffith: So there this car of Uṣas lay, broken to pieces, in Vipāś,  And she herself fled far away.

verses.sanskrit: उत सिन्धुं विबाल्यं वितस्थानाम अधि कषमि परि षठा इन्द्र मायया |||
verses.transliteration: uta sindhuṃ vibālyaṃ vitasthānām adhi kṣami pari ṣṭhā indra māyayā

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, didst. with magic power resist the overflowing stream  Who spread her waters o’er the land.

verses.sanskrit: उत शुष्णस्य धर्ष्णुया पर मर्क्षो अभि वेदनम पुरो यद अस्य सम्पिणक |||
verses.transliteration: uta śuṣṇasya dhṛṣṇuyā pra mṛkṣo abhi vedanam puro yad asya sampiṇak

translations.griffith: Valiantly didst thou seize and take the store which Śuṣṇa had amassed,  When thou didst crush his fortresses.

verses.sanskrit: उत दासं कौलितरम बर्हतः पर्वताद अधि अवाहन्न इन्द्र शम्बरम |||
verses.transliteration: uta dāsaṃ kaulitaram bṛhataḥ parvatād adhi avāhann indra śambaram

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, also smotest down Kulitara's son Śambara,  The Dāsa, from the lofty hill.

verses.sanskrit: उत दासस्य वर्चिनः सहस्राणि शतावधीः अधि पञ्च परधींर इव |||
verses.transliteration: uta dāsasya varcinaḥ sahasrāṇi śatāvadhīḥ adhi pañca pradhīṃr iva

translations.griffith: Of Dāsa Varcin's thou didst slay the hundred thousand and the five,  Crushed like the fellies, of a car.

verses.sanskrit: उत तयम पुत्रम अग्रुवः पराव्र्क्तं शतक्रतुः उक्थेष्व इन्द्र आभजत |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyam putram aghruvaḥ parāvṛktaṃ śatakratuḥ uktheṣv indra ābhajat

translations.griffith: So Indra, Lord of Heroes, Powers, caused the unwedded damsel's son,  The castaway, to share the lauds.

verses.sanskrit: उत तया तुर्वशायदू अस्नातारा शचीपतिः इन्द्रो विद्वां अपारयत |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyā turvaśāyadū asnātārā śacīpatiḥ indro vidvāṃ apārayat

translations.griffith: So sapient Indra, Lord of Might, brought Turvaśa and Yadu, those  Who feared the flood, in safety o’er.

verses.sanskrit: उत तया सद्य आर्या सरयोर इन्द्र पारतः अर्णाचित्ररथावधीः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyā sadya āryā sarayor indra pārataḥ arṇācitrarathāvadhīḥ

translations.griffith: Arṇa and Citraratha, both Āryas, thou, Indra, slewest swift,  On yonder side of Sarayu,

verses.sanskrit: अनु दवा जहिता नयो ऽनधं शरोणं च वर्त्रहन न तत ते सुम्नम अष्टवे |||
verses.transliteration: anu dvā jahitā nayo 'ndhaṃ śroṇaṃ ca vṛtrahan na tat te sumnam aṣṭave

translations.griffith: Thou, Vṛtra-slayer, didst conduct those two forlorn, the blind, the lame.  None may attain this bliss of thine.

verses.sanskrit: शतम अश्मन्मयीनाम पुराम इन्द्रो वय आस्यत दिवोदासाय दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: śatam aśmanmayīnām purām indro vy āsyat divodāsāya dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: For Divodāsa, him who brought oblations, Indra overthrew  A hundred fortresses of stone.

verses.sanskrit: अस्वापयद दभीतये सहस्रा तरिंशतं हथैः दासानाम इन्द्रो मायया |||
verses.transliteration: asvāpayad dabhītaye sahasrā triṃśataṃ hathaiḥ dāsānām indro māyayā

translations.griffith: The thirty thousand Dāsas he with magic power and weapons sent  To slumber, for Dabhīti's sake.

verses.sanskrit: स घेद उतासि वर्त्रहन समान इन्द्र गोपतिः यस ता विश्वानि चिच्युषे |||
verses.transliteration: sa ghed utāsi vṛtrahan samāna indra ghopatiḥ yas tā viśvāni cicyuṣe

translations.griffith: As such, O Vṛtra-slayer, thou art general Lord of kine for all,  Thou Shaker of all things that be.

verses.sanskrit: उत नूनं यद इन्द्रियं करिष्या इन्द्र पौंस्यम अद्या नकिष टद आ मिनत |||
verses.transliteration: uta nūnaṃ yad indriyaṃ kariṣyā indra pauṃsyam adyā nakiṣ ṭad ā minat

translations.griffith: Indra, whatever deed of might thou hast this day to execute,  None be there now to hinder it.

verses.sanskrit: वामं-वामं त आदुरे देवो ददात्व अर्यमा वामम पूषा वामम भगो वामं देवः करूळती |||
verses.transliteration: vāmaṃ-vāmaṃ ta ādure devo dadātv aryamā vāmam pūṣā vāmam bhagho vāmaṃ devaḥ karūḷatī

translations.griffith: O Watchful One, may Aryaman the God give thee all goodly things.  May Pūṣan, Bhaga, and the God Karūḷatī give all things fair.

verses.sanskrit: कया नश चित्र आ भुवद ऊती सदाव्र्धः सखा कया शचिष्ठया वर्ता |||
verses.transliteration: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā

translations.griffith: WITH what help will he come to us, wonderful, ever-waxing Friend;  With what most mighty company?

verses.sanskrit: कस तवा सत्यो मदानाम मंहिष्ठो मत्सद अन्धसः दर्ळ्हा चिद आरुजे वसु |||
verses.transliteration: kas tvā satyo madānām maṃhiṣṭho matsad andhasaḥ dṛḷhā cid āruje vasu

translations.griffith: What genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with juice to burst  Open e’en strongly-guarded wealth?

verses.sanskrit: अभी षु णः सखीनाम अविता जरित्णाम शतम भवास्य ऊतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: abhī ṣu ṇaḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṇām śatam bhavāsy ūtibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Do thou who art Protector of us thy friends who praise thee  With hundred aids approach us.

verses.sanskrit: अभी न आ वव्र्त्स्व चक्रं न वर्त्तम अर्वतः नियुद्भिश चर्षणीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: abhī na ā vavṛtsva cakraṃ na vṛttam arvataḥ niyudbhiś carṣaṇīnām

translations.griffith: Like as a courser's circling wheel, so turn thee hitherward to us,  Attracted by the hymns of men.

verses.sanskrit: परवता हि करतूनाम आ हा पदेव गछसि अभक्षि सूर्ये सचा |||
verses.transliteration: pravatā hi kratūnām ā hā padeva ghachasi abhakṣi sūrye sacā

translations.griffith: Thou seekest as it were thine own stations with swift descent of powers:  I share thee even with the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: सं यत त इन्द्र मन्यवः सं चक्राणि दधन्विरे अध तवे अध सूर्ये |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yat ta indra manyavaḥ saṃ cakrāṇi dadhanvire adha tve adha sūrye

translations.griffith: What time thy courage and his wheels together, Indra, run their course  With thee and with the Sun alike,

verses.sanskrit: उत समा हि तवाम आहुर इन मघवानं शचीपते दातारम अविदीधयुम |||
verses.transliteration: uta smā hi tvām āhur in maghavānaṃ śacīpate dātāram avidīdhayum

translations.griffith: So even, Lord of Power and Might, the people call thee Maghavan,  Giver, who pauses not to think.

verses.sanskrit: उत समा सद्य इत परि शशमानाय सुन्वते पुरू चिन मंहसे वसु |||
verses.transliteration: uta smā sadya it pari śaśamānāya sunvate purū cin maṃhase vasu

translations.griffith: And verily to him who toils and presses Soma juice for thee  Thou quickly givest ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit: नहि षमा ते शतं चन राधो वरन्त आमुरः न चयौत्नानि करिष्यतः |||
verses.transliteration: nahi ṣmā te śataṃ cana rādho varanta āmuraḥ na cyautnāni kariṣyataḥ

translations.griffith: No, not a hundred hinderers can check thy gracious bounty's flow,  Nor thy great deeds when thou wilt act.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मां अवन्तु ते शतम अस्मान सहस्रम ऊतयः अस्मान विश्वा अभिष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: asmāṃ avantu te śatam asmān sahasram ūtayaḥ asmān viśvā abhiṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: May thine assistance keep us safe, thy hundred and thy thousand aids:  May all thy favours strengthen us.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मां इहा वर्णीष्व सख्याय सवस्तये महो राये दिवित्मते |||
verses.transliteration: asmāṃ ihā vṛṇīṣva sakhyāya svastaye maho rāye divitmate

translations.griffith: Do thou elect us this place for friendship and prosperity,  And great celestial opulence.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मां अविड्ढि विश्वहेन्द्र राया परीणसा अस्मान विश्वाभिर ऊतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: asmāṃ aviḍḍhi viśvahendra rāyā parīṇasā asmān viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Favour us, Indra, evermore with overflowing store of wealth:  With all thy succours aid thou us.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं तां अपा वर्धि वरजां अस्तेव गोमतः नवाभिर इन्द्रोतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tāṃ apā vṛdhi vrajāṃ asteva ghomataḥ navābhir indrotibhiḥ

translations.griffith: With new protections, Indra, like an archer, open thou for us  The stables that are filled with kine.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकं धर्ष्णुया रथो दयुमां इन्द्रानपच्युतः गव्युर अश्वयुर ईयते |||
verses.transliteration: asmākaṃ dhṛṣṇuyā ratho dyumāṃ indrānapacyutaḥ ghavyur aśvayur īyate

translations.griffith: Our chariot, Indra, boldly moves endued with splendour, ne’er repulsed,  Winning for us both kine and steeds.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकम उत्तमं कर्धि शरवो देवेषु सूर्य वर्षिष्ठं दयाम इवोपरि |||
verses.transliteration: asmākam uttamaṃ kṛdhi śravo deveṣu sūrya varṣiṣṭhaṃ dyām ivopari

translations.griffith: O Sūrya, make our fame to be most excellent among the Gods,  Most lofty as the heaven on high.

verses.sanskrit: आ तू न इन्द्र वर्त्रहन्न अस्माकम अर्धम आ गहि महान महीभिर ऊतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ā tū na indra vṛtrahann asmākam ardham ā ghahi mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ

translations.griffith: O THOU who slewest Vṛtra, come, O Indra, hither to our side,  Mighty One with thy mighty aids.

verses.sanskrit: भर्मिश चिद घासि तूतुजिर आ चित्र चित्रिणीष्व आ चित्रं कर्णोष्य ऊतये |||
verses.transliteration: bhṛmiś cid ghāsi tūtujir ā citra citriṇīṣv ā citraṃ kṛṇoṣy ūtaye

translations.griffith: Swift and impetuous art thou, wondrous amid the well-dressed folk:  Thou doest marvels for our help.

verses.sanskrit: दभ्रेभिश चिच छशीयांसं हंसि वराधन्तम ओजसा सखिभिर ये तवे सचा |||
verses.transliteration: dabhrebhiś cic chaśīyāṃsaṃ haṃsi vrādhantam ojasā sakhibhir ye tve sacā

translations.griffith: Even with the weak thou smitest down him  who is stronger, with thy strength  The mighty, with the Friends thou hast.

verses.sanskrit: वयम इन्द्र तवे सचा वयं तवाभि नोनुमः अस्मां-अस्मां इद उद अव |||
verses.transliteration: vayam indra tve sacā vayaṃ tvābhi nonumaḥ asmāṃ-asmāṃ id ud ava

translations.griffith: O Indra, we are close to thee; to thee we sing aloud our songs:  Help and defend us, even us.

verses.sanskrit: स नश चित्राभिर अद्रिवो ऽनवद्याभिर ऊतिभिः अनाध्र्ष्टाभिर आ गहि |||
verses.transliteration: sa naś citrābhir adrivo 'navadyābhir ūtibhiḥ anādhṛṣṭābhir ā ghahi

translations.griffith: As such, O Caster of the Stone, come with thy succours wonderful,  Blameless, and irresistible.

verses.sanskrit: भूयामो षु तवावतः सखाय इन्द्र गोमतः युजो वाजाय घर्ष्वये |||
verses.transliteration: bhūyāmo ṣu tvāvataḥ sakhāya indra ghomataḥ yujo vājāya ghṛṣvaye

translations.griffith: May we be friends of one like thee, O Indra, with the wealth of kine,  Comrades for lively energy.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हय एक ईशिष इन्द्र वाजस्य गोमतः स नो यन्धि महीम इषम |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hy eka īśiṣa indra vājasya ghomataḥ sa no yandhi mahīm iṣam

translations.griffith: For thou, O Indra, art alone the Lord of strength that comes from kine  So grant thou us abundant food.

verses.sanskrit: न तवा वरन्ते अन्यथा यद दित्ससि सतुतो मघम सतोत्र्भ्य इन्द्र गिर्वणः |||
verses.transliteration: na tvā varante anyathā yad ditsasi stuto magham stotṛbhya indra ghirvaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: They turn thee not another way, when, lauded, Lover of the Song,  Thou wilt give wealth to those who praise.

verses.sanskrit: अभि तवा गोतमा गिरानूषत पर दावने इन्द्र वाजाय घर्ष्वये |||
verses.transliteration: abhi tvā ghotamā ghirānūṣata pra dāvane indra vājāya ghṛṣvaye

translations.griffith: The Gotamas have sung their song of praise to thee that thou mayst give,  Indra, for lively energy.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते वोचाम वीर्या या मन्दसान आरुजः पुरो दासीर अभीत्य |||
verses.transliteration: pra te vocāma vīryā yā mandasāna ārujaḥ puro dāsīr abhītya

translations.griffith: We will declare thy hero deeds, what Dāsa forts thou brakest down,  Attacking them in rapturous joy.
