verses.sanskrit: ता ते गर्णन्ति वेधसो यानि चकर्थ पौंस्या सुतेष्व इन्द्र गिर्वणः |||
verses.transliteration: tā te ghṛṇanti vedhaso yāni cakartha pauṃsyā suteṣv indra ghirvaṇaḥ

translations.griffith: The sages sing those manly deeds which, Indra, Lover of the Song,  Thou wroughtest when the Soma flowed.

verses.sanskrit: अवीव्र्धन्त गोतमा इन्द्र तवे सतोमवाहसः ऐषु धा वीरवद यशः |||
verses.transliteration: avīvṛdhanta ghotamā indra tve stomavāhasaḥ aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra, the Gotamas who bring thee praises have grown strong by thee.  Give them renown with hero sons.

verses.sanskrit: यच चिद धि शश्वताम असीन्द्र साधारणस तवम तं तवा वयं हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yac cid dhi śaśvatām asīndra sādhāraṇas tvam taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe

translations.griffith: For, Indra, verily thou art the general treasure even of all .  Thee, therefore, do we invocate.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाचीनो वसो भवास्मे सु मत्स्वान्धसः सोमानाम इन्द्र सोमपाः |||
verses.transliteration: arvācīno vaso bhavāsme su matsvāndhasaḥ somānām indra somapāḥ

translations.griffith: Excellent Indra, turn to us: glad thee among us with the juice  Of Somas, Soma-drinker thou.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकं तवा मतीनाम आ सतोम इन्द्र यछतु अर्वाग आ वर्तया हरी |||
verses.transliteration: asmākaṃ tvā matīnām ā stoma indra yachatu arvāgh ā vartayā harī

translations.griffith: May praise from us who think Qn thee, O Indra, bring thee near to us.  Turn thy two Bay Steeds hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोळाशं च नो घसो जोषयासे गिरश च नः वधूयुर इव योषणाम |||
verses.transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ ca no ghaso joṣayāse ghiraś ca naḥ vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām

translations.griffith: Eat of our sacrificial cake: rejoice thee in the songs we sing.  Even as a lover in his bride.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रं वयतीनां युक्तानाम इन्द्रम ईमहे शतं सोमस्य खार्यः |||
verses.transliteration: sahasraṃ vyatīnāṃ yuktānām indram īmahe śataṃ somasya khāryaḥ

translations.griffith: To India for a thousand steeds well-trained and fleet of foot we pray,  And hundred jars of Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रा ते शता वयं गवाम आ चयावयामसि अस्मत्रा राध एतु ते |||
verses.transliteration: sahasrā te śatā vayaṃ ghavām ā cyāvayāmasi asmatrā rādha etu te

translations.griffith: We make a hundred of thy kine, yea, and a thousand, hasten nigh:  So let thy bounty come to us.

verses.sanskrit: दश ते कलशानां हिरण्यानाम अधीमहि भूरिदा असि वर्त्रहन |||
verses.transliteration: daśa te kalaśānāṃ hiraṇyānām adhīmahi bhūridā asi vṛtrahan

translations.griffith: We have obtained, a gift from thee, ten water-ewers wrought of gold:  Thou, Vṛtra-slayer, givest much.

verses.sanskrit: भूरिदा भूरि देहि नो मा दभ्रम भूर्य आ भर भूरि घेद इन्द्र दित्ससि |||
verses.transliteration: bhūridā bhūri dehi no mā dabhram bhūry ā bhara bhūri ghed indra ditsasi

translations.griffith: A bounteous Giver, give us much, bring much and not a trifling gift:  Much, Indra, wilt thou fain bestow.

verses.sanskrit: भूरिदा हय असि शरुतः पुरुत्रा शूर वर्त्रहन आ नो भजस्व राधसि |||
verses.transliteration: bhūridā hy asi śrutaḥ purutrā śūra vṛtrahan ā no bhajasva rādhasi

translations.griffith: O Vṛtra-slayer, thou art famed in many a place as bountiful  Hero, thy bounty let us share.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते बभ्रू विचक्षण शंसामि गोषणो नपात माभ्यां गा अनु शिश्रथः |||
verses.transliteration: pra te babhrū vicakṣaṇa śaṃsāmi ghoṣaṇo napāt mābhyāṃ ghā anu śiśrathaḥ

translations.griffith: I praise thy pair of Tawny Steeds, wise Son of him who giveth kine  Terrify not the cows with these.

verses.sanskrit: कनीनकेव विद्रधे नवे दरुपदे अर्भके बभ्रू यामेषु शोभेते |||
verses.transliteration: kanīnakeva vidradhe nave drupade arbhake babhrū yāmeṣu śobhete

translations.griffith: Like two slight images of girls, unrobed, upon a new-wrought post,  So shine the Bay Steeds in their course.

verses.sanskrit: अरम म उस्रयाम्णे ऽरम अनुस्रयाम्णे बभ्रू यामेष्व अस्रिधा |||
verses.transliteration: aram ma usrayāmṇe 'ram anusrayāmṇe babhrū yāmeṣv asridhā

translations.griffith: For me the Bays are ready when I start, or start not, with the dawn, Innocuous in the ways they take.

verses.sanskrit: पर रभुभ्यो दूतम इव वाचम इष्य उपस्तिरे शवैतरीं धेनुम ईळे ये वातजूतास तरणिभिर एवैः परि दयां सद्यो अपसो बभूवुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra ṛbhubhyo dūtam iva vācam iṣya upastire śvaitarīṃ dhenum īḷe ye vātajūtās taraṇibhir evaiḥ pari dyāṃ sadyo apaso babhūvuḥ

translations.griffith: I SEND my voice as herald to the Ṛbhus; I crave the white cow for the overspreading.  Wind-sped, the Skillful Ones in rapid motion have in an instant compassed round the heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यदारम अक्रन्न रभवः पित्र्भ्याम परिविष्टी वेषणा दंसनाभिः आद इद देवानाम उप सख्यम आयन धीरासः पुष्टिम अवहन मनायै |||
verses.transliteration: yadāram akrann ṛbhavaḥ pitṛbhyām pariviṣṭī veṣaṇā daṃsanābhiḥ ād id devānām upa sakhyam āyan dhīrāsaḥ puṣṭim avahan manāyai

translations.griffith: What time the Rbus had with care and marvels done proper service to assist their Parents,  They won the friendship of the Gods; the Sages carried away the fruit of their devotion.

verses.sanskrit: पुनर ये चक्रुः पितरा युवाना सना यूपेव जरणा शयाना ते वाजो विभ्वां रभुर इन्द्रवन्तो मधुप्सरसो नो ऽवन्तु यज्ञम |||
verses.transliteration: punar ye cakruḥ pitarā yuvānā sanā yūpeva jaraṇā śayānā te vājo vibhvāṃ ṛbhur indravanto madhupsaraso no 'vantu yajñam

translations.griffith: May they who made their Parents, who were lying like posts that moulder, young again for ever,—  May Vāja, Vibhvan, Ṛbhu, joined with Indra , protect our sacrifice, the Soma-lovers.

verses.sanskrit: यत संवत्सम रभवो गाम अरक्षन यत संवत्सम रभवो मा अपिंशन यत संवत्सम अभरन भासो अस्यास ताभिः शमीभिर अम्र्तत्वम आशुः |||
verses.transliteration: yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavo ghām arakṣan yat saṃvatsam ṛbhavo mā apiṃśan yat saṃvatsam abharan bhāso asyās tābhiḥ śamībhir amṛtatvam āśuḥ

translations.griffith: As for a year the Ṛbhus kept the Milch-cow, throughout a year fashioned and formed her body,  And through a year's space still sustained her brightness, through these their labours they were made immortal.

verses.sanskrit: जयेष्ठ आह चमसा दवा करेति कनीयान तरीन कर्णवामेत्य आह कनिष्ठ आह चतुरस करेति तवष्ट रभवस तत पनयद वचो वः |||
verses.transliteration: jyeṣṭha āha camasā dvā kareti kanīyān trīn kṛṇavāmety āha kaniṣṭha āha caturas kareti tvaṣṭa ṛbhavas tat panayad vaco vaḥ

translations.griffith: Two beakers let us make,—thus said the eldest. Let us make three,—this was the younger's sentence.  Four beakers let us make,—thus spoke the youngest. Tvaṣṭar approved this rede of yours, O Ṛbhus.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यम ऊचुर नर एवा हि चक्रुर अनु सवधाम रभवो जग्मुर एताम विभ्राजमानांश चमसां अहेवावेनत तवष्टा चतुरो दद्र्श्वान |||
verses.transliteration: satyam ūcur nara evā hi cakrur anu svadhām ṛbhavo jaghmur etām vibhrājamānāṃś camasāṃ ahevāvenat tvaṣṭā caturo dadṛśvān

translations.griffith: The men spake truth and even so they acted: this Godlike way of theirs the Ṛbhus followed.  And Tvaṣṭar, when he looked on the four beakers resplendent as the day, was moved with envy.

verses.sanskrit: दवादश दयून यद अगोह्यस्यातिथ्ये रणन्न रभवः ससन्तः सुक्षेत्राक्र्ण्वन्न अनयन्त सिन्धून धन्वातिष्ठन्न ओषधीर निम्नम आपः |||
verses.transliteration: dvādaśa dyūn yad aghohyasyātithye raṇann ṛbhavaḥ sasantaḥ sukṣetrākṛṇvann anayanta sindhūn dhanvātiṣṭhann oṣadhīr nimnam āpaḥ

translations.griffith: When for twelve days the Ṛbhus joyed reposing as guests of him who never may be hidden,  They made fair fertile fields, they brought the rivers. Plants spread o’er deserts, waters filled the hollows.

verses.sanskrit: रथं ये चक्रुः सुव्र्तं नरेष्ठां ये धेनुं विश्वजुवं विश्वरूपाम त आ तक्षन्त्व रभवो रयिं नः सववसः सवपसः सुहस्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: rathaṃ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṃ nareṣṭhāṃ ye dhenuṃ viśvajuvaṃ viśvarūpām ta ā takṣantv ṛbhavo rayiṃ naḥ svavasaḥ svapasaḥ suhastāḥ

translations.griffith: May they who formed the swift car, bearing Heroes, and the Cow omniform and all-impelling,  Even may they form wealth for us,—the Ṛbhus, dexterous-handed, deft in work and gracious.

verses.sanskrit: अपो हय एषाम अजुषन्त देवा अभि करत्वा मनसा दीध्यानाः वाजो देवानाम अभवत सुकर्मेन्द्रस्य रभुक्षा वरुणस्य विभ्वा |||
verses.transliteration: apo hy eṣām ajuṣanta devā abhi kratvā manasā dīdhyānāḥ vājo devānām abhavat sukarmendrasya ṛbhukṣā varuṇasya vibhvā

translations.griffith: So in their work the Gods had satisfaction, pondering it with thought and mental insight.  The Gods’ expert artificer was Vāja, Indra's Ṛbhukṣan, Varuṇa's was Vibhvan.

verses.sanskrit: ये हरी मेधयोक्था मदन्त इन्द्राय चक्रुः सुयुजा ये अश्वा ते रायस पोषं दरविणान्य अस्मे धत्त रभवः कषेमयन्तो न मित्रम |||
verses.transliteration: ye harī medhayokthā madanta indrāya cakruḥ suyujā ye aśvā te rāyas poṣaṃ draviṇāny asme dhatta ṛbhavaḥ kṣemayanto na mitram

translations.griffith: They who made glad with sacrifice and praises, wrought the two Bays, his docile Steeds, for Indra,—  Ṛbhus, as those who wish a friend to prosper, bestow upon us gear and growth of riches.

verses.sanskrit: इदाह्नः पीतिम उत वो मदं धुर न रते शरान्तस्य सख्याय देवाः ते नूनम अस्मे रभवो वसूनि तर्तीये अस्मिन सवने दधात |||
verses.transliteration: idāhnaḥ pītim uta vo madaṃ dhur na ṛte śrāntasya sakhyāya devāḥ te nūnam asme ṛbhavo vasūni tṛtīye asmin savane dadhāta

translations.griffith: This day have they set gladdening drink before you. Not without toil are Gods inclined to friendship.  Therefore do ye who are so great, O Ṛbhus, vouchsafe us treasures at this third libation.

verses.sanskrit: रभुर विभ्वा वाज इन्द्रो नो अछेमं यज्ञं रत्नधेयोप यात इदा हि वो धिषणा देव्य अह्नाम अधात पीतिं सम मदा अग्मता वः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhur vibhvā vāja indro no achemaṃ yajñaṃ ratnadheyopa yāta idā hi vo dhiṣaṇā devy ahnām adhāt pītiṃ sam madā aghmatā vaḥ

translations.griffith: To this our sacrifice come Ṛbhu, Vibhvan, Vāja, and Indra with the gift of riches,  Because this day hath Dhiṣaṇā the Goddess set drink for you: the gladdening draughts have reached you.

verses.sanskrit: विदानासो जन्मनो वाजरत्ना उत रतुभिर रभवो मादयध्वम सं वो मदा अग्मत सम पुरंधिः सुवीराम अस्मे रयिम एरयध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: vidānāso janmano vājaratnā uta ṛtubhir ṛbhavo mādayadhvam saṃ vo madā aghmata sam puraṃdhiḥ suvīrām asme rayim erayadhvam

translations.griffith: Knowing your birth and rich in gathered treasure, Ṛbhus, rejoice together with the Ṛtus.  The gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you: send ye us riches with good store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit: अयं वो यज्ञ रभवो ऽकारि यम आ मनुष्वत परदिवो दधिध्वे पर वो ऽछा जुजुषाणासो अस्थुर अभूत विश्वे अग्रियोत वाजाः |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vo yajña ṛbhavo 'kāri yam ā manuṣvat pradivo dadhidhve pra vo 'chā jujuṣāṇāso asthur abhūta viśve aghriyota vājāḥ

translations.griffith: For you was made this sacrifice, O Ṛbhus, which ye, like men, won for yourselves aforetime.  To you come all who find in you their pleasure: ye all were—even the two elder—Vājas.

verses.sanskrit: अभूद उ वो विधते रत्नधेयम इदा नरो दाशुषे मर्त्याय पिबत वाजा रभवो ददे वो महि तर्तीयं सवनम मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: abhūd u vo vidhate ratnadheyam idā naro dāśuṣe martyāya pibata vājā ṛbhavo dade vo mahi tṛtīyaṃ savanam madāya

translations.griffith: Now for the mortal worshipper, O Heroes, for him who served you, was the gift of riches.  Drink, Vājas, Ṛbhus! unto you is offered, to gladden you, the third and great libation.

verses.sanskrit: आ वाजा यातोप न रभुक्षा महो नरो दरविणसो गर्णानाः आ वः पीतयो ऽभिपित्वे अह्नाम इमा अस्तं नवस्व इव गमन |||
verses.transliteration: ā vājā yātopa na ṛbhukṣā maho naro draviṇaso ghṛṇānāḥ ā vaḥ pītayo 'bhipitve ahnām imā astaṃ navasva iva ghman

translations.griffith: Come to us, Heroes, Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans, glorified for the sake of mighty treasure.  These draughts approach you as the day is closing, as cows, whose calves are newly-born, their stable.

verses.sanskrit: आ नपातः शवसो यातनोपेमं यज्ञं नमसा हूयमानाः सजोषसः सूरयो यस्य च सथ मध्वः पात रत्नधा इन्द्रवन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: ā napātaḥ śavaso yātanopemaṃ yajñaṃ namasā hūyamānāḥ sajoṣasaḥ sūrayo yasya ca stha madhvaḥ pāta ratnadhā indravantaḥ

translations.griffith: Come to this sacrifice of ours, ye Children of Strength, invoked with humble adoration.  Drink of this meath, Wealth-givers, joined with Indra with whom ye are in full accord, ye Princes.

verses.sanskrit: सजोषा इन्द्र वरुणेन सोमं सजोषाः पाहि गिर्वणो मरुद्भिः अग्रेपाभिर रतुपाभिः सजोषा गनास्पत्नीभी रत्नधाभिः सजोषाः |||
verses.transliteration: sajoṣā indra varuṇena somaṃ sajoṣāḥ pāhi ghirvaṇo marudbhiḥ aghrepābhir ṛtupābhiḥ sajoṣā ghnāspatnībhī ratnadhābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Close knit with Varuṇa drink the Soma, Indra; close-knit, Hymn-lover! with the Maruts drink it:  Close-knit with drinkers first, who drink in season; close-knit with heavenly Dames who give us treasures.

verses.sanskrit: सजोषस आदित्यैर मादयध्वं सजोषस रभवः पर्वतेभिः सजोषसो दैव्येना सवित्रा सजोषसः सिन्धुभी रत्नधेभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sajoṣasa ādityair mādayadhvaṃ sajoṣasa ṛbhavaḥ parvatebhiḥ sajoṣaso daivyenā savitrā sajoṣasaḥ sindhubhī ratnadhebhiḥ

translations.griffith: Rejoice in full accord with the Ādityas, in concord with the Parvatas, O Ṛbhus;  In full accord with Savitar, Divine One; in full accord with floods that pour forth riches.

verses.sanskrit: ये अश्विना ये पितरा य ऊती धेनुं ततक्षुर रभवो ये अश्वा ये अंसत्रा य रधग रोदसी ये विभ्वो नरः सवपत्यानि चक्रुः |||
verses.transliteration: ye aśvinā ye pitarā ya ūtī dhenuṃ tatakṣur ṛbhavo ye aśvā ye aṃsatrā ya ṛdhagh rodasī ye vibhvo naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ

translations.griffith: Ṛbhus, who helped their Parents and the Aśvins, who formed the Milch-cow and the pair of horses,  Made armour, set the heaven and earth asunder,—far- reaching Heroes, they have made good offspring.

verses.sanskrit: ये गोमन्तं वाजवन्तं सुवीरं रयिं धत्थ वसुमन्तम पुरुक्षुम ते अग्रेपा रभवो मन्दसाना अस्मे धत्त ये च रातिं गर्णन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ye ghomantaṃ vājavantaṃ suvīraṃ rayiṃ dhattha vasumantam purukṣum te aghrepā ṛbhavo mandasānā asme dhatta ye ca rātiṃ ghṛṇanti

translations.griffith: Ye who have wealth in cattle and in booty, in heroes, in rich sustenance and treasure,  Such, O ye Ṛbhus, first to drink, rejoicing, give unto us and those who laud our present.

verses.sanskrit: नापाभूत न वो ऽतीत्र्षामानिःशस्ता रभवो यज्ञे अस्मिन सम इन्द्रेण मदथ सम मरुद्भिः सं राजभी रत्नधेयाय देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: nāpābhūta na vo 'tītṛṣāmāniḥśastā ṛbhavo yajñe asmin sam indreṇa madatha sam marudbhiḥ saṃ rājabhī ratnadheyāya devāḥ

translations.griffith: Ye were not far: we have not left you thirsting, blameless in this our sacrifice, O Ṛbhus.  Rejoice you with the Maruts and with Indra, with the Kings, Gods! that ye may give us riches.

verses.sanskrit: इहोप यात शवसो नपातः सौधन्वना रभवो माप भूत अस्मिन हि वः सवने रत्नधेयं गमन्त्व इन्द्रम अनु वो मदासः |||
verses.transliteration: ihopa yāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo māpa bhūta asmin hi vaḥ savane ratnadheyaṃ ghamantv indram anu vo madāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Come hither, O ye Sons of Strength, ye Ṛbhus; stay not afar, ye Children of Sudhanvan.  At this libation is your gift of treasure. Let gladdening draughts approach you after Indra's.

verses.sanskrit: आगन्न रभूणाम इह रत्नधेयम अभूत सोमस्य सुषुतस्य पीतिः सुक्र्त्यया यत सवपस्यया चं एकं विचक्र चमसं चतुर्धा |||
verses.transliteration: āghann ṛbhūṇām iha ratnadheyam abhūt somasya suṣutasya pītiḥ sukṛtyayā yat svapasyayā caṃ ekaṃ vicakra camasaṃ caturdhā

translations.griffith: Hither is come the Ṛbhus' gift of riches; here was the drinking of the well-pressed Soma,  Since by dexterity and skill as craftsmen ye made the single chalice to be fourfold

verses.sanskrit: वय अक्र्णोत चमसं चतुर्धा सखे वि शिक्षेत्य अब्रवीत अथैत वाजा अम्र्तस्य पन्थां गणं देवानाम रभवः सुहस्ताः |||
verses.transliteration: vy akṛṇota camasaṃ caturdhā sakhe vi śikṣety abravīta athaita vājā amṛtasya panthāṃ ghaṇaṃ devānām ṛbhavaḥ suhastāḥ

translations.griffith: Ye made fourfold the chalice that wag single: ye spake these words and said, O Friend, assist us;  Then, Vājas! gained the path of life eternal, deft-handed Ṛbhus, to the Gods’ assembly.

verses.sanskrit: किम्मयः सविच चमस एष आस यं काव्येन चतुरो विचक्र अथा सुनुध्वं सवनम मदाय पात रभवो मधुनः सोम्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: kimmayaḥ svic camasa eṣa āsa yaṃ kāvyena caturo vicakra athā sunudhvaṃ savanam madāya pāta ṛbhavo madhunaḥ somyasya

translations.griffith: Out of what substance was that chalice fashioned which ye made fourfold by your art and wisdom?  Now for the gladdening draught press out the liquor, and drink, O Ṛbhus, of die meath of Soma.

verses.sanskrit: शच्याकर्त पितरा युवाना शच्याकर्त चमसं देवपानम शच्या हरी धनुतराव अतष्टेन्द्रवाहाव रभवो वाजरत्नाः |||
verses.transliteration: śacyākarta pitarā yuvānā śacyākarta camasaṃ devapānam śacyā harī dhanutarāv ataṣṭendravāhāv ṛbhavo vājaratnāḥ

translations.griffith: Ye with your cunning made your Parents youthful; the cup, for Gods to drink, ye formed with cunning;  With cunning, Ṛbhus, rich in treasure, fashioned the two swift Tawny Steeds who carry Indra.

verses.sanskrit: यो वः सुनोत्य अभिपित्वे अह्नां तीव्रं वाजासः सवनम मदाय तस्मै रयिम रभवः सर्ववीरम आ तक्षत वर्षणो मन्दसानाः |||
verses.transliteration: yo vaḥ sunoty abhipitve ahnāṃ tīvraṃ vājāsaḥ savanam madāya tasmai rayim ṛbhavaḥ sarvavīram ā takṣata vṛṣaṇo mandasānāḥ

translations.griffith: Whoso pours out for you, when days are closing, the sharp libation for your joy, O Vājas,  For him, O mighty Ṛbhus, ye, rejoicing, have fashioned wealth with plenteous store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit: परातः सुतम अपिबो हर्यश्व माध्यंदिनं सवनं केवलं ते सम रभुभिः पिबस्व रत्नधेभिः सखींर यां इन्द्र चक्र्षे सुक्र्त्या |||
verses.transliteration: prātaḥ sutam apibo haryaśva mādhyaṃdinaṃ savanaṃ kevalaṃ te sam ṛbhubhiḥ pibasva ratnadhebhiḥ sakhīṃr yāṃ indra cakṛṣe sukṛtyā

translations.griffith: Lord of Bay Steeds, at dawn the juice thou drankest: thine, only thine, is the noonday libation.  Now drink thou with the wealth-bestowing Ṛbhus, whom for their skill thou madest friends, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: ये देवासो अभवता सुक्र्त्या शयेना इवेद अधि दिवि निषेद ते रत्नं धात शवसो नपातः सौधन्वना अभवताम्र्तासः |||
verses.transliteration: ye devāso abhavatā sukṛtyā śyenā ived adhi divi niṣeda te ratnaṃ dhāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā abhavatāmṛtāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye, whom your artist skill hath raised to Godhead have set you down above in heaven like falcons.  So give us riches, Children of Sudhanvan, O Sons of Strength; ye have become immortal.

verses.sanskrit: यत तर्तीयं सवनं रत्नधेयम अक्र्णुध्वं सवपस्या सुहस्ताः तद रभवः परिषिक्तं व एतत सम मदेभिर इन्द्रियेभिः पिबध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: yat tṛtīyaṃ savanaṃ ratnadheyam akṛṇudhvaṃ svapasyā suhastāḥ tad ṛbhavaḥ pariṣiktaṃ va etat sam madebhir indriyebhiḥ pibadhvam

translations.griffith: The third libation, that bestoweth treasure, which ye have won by skill, ye dexterous-handed,—  This drink hath been effused for you, O Ṛbhus . drink it with high delight, with joy like Indra's.

verses.sanskrit: अनश्वो जातो अनभीशुर उक्थ्यो रथस तरिचक्रः परि वर्तते रजः महत तद वो देव्यस्य परवाचनं दयाम रभवः पर्थिवीं यच च पुष्यथ |||
verses.transliteration: anaśvo jāto anabhīśur ukthyo rathas tricakraḥ pari vartate rajaḥ mahat tad vo devyasya pravācanaṃ dyām ṛbhavaḥ pṛthivīṃ yac ca puṣyatha

translations.griffith: THE car that was not made for horses or for reins, three-wheeled, worthy of lauds, rolls round the firmament.  That is the great announcement of your Deity, that, O ye Ṛbhus, ye sustain the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: रथं ये चक्रुः सुव्र्तं सुचेतसो ऽविह्वरन्तम मनसस परि धयया तां ऊ नव अस्य सवनस्य पीतय आ वो वाजा रभवो वेदयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: rathaṃ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṃ sucetaso 'vihvarantam manasas pari dhyayā tāṃ ū nv asya savanasya pītaya ā vo vājā ṛbhavo vedayāmasi

translations.griffith: Ye Sapient Ones who made the lightly-rolling car out of your mind, by thought, the car that never errs,  You, being such, to drink of this drink-offering, you, O ye Vājas, and ye Ṛbhus, we invoke.

verses.sanskrit: तद वो वाजा रभवः सुप्रवाचनं देवेषु विभ्वो अभवन महित्वनम जिव्री यत सन्ता पितरा सनाजुरा पुनर युवाना चरथाय तक्षथ |||
verses.transliteration: tad vo vājā ṛbhavaḥ supravācanaṃ deveṣu vibhvo abhavan mahitvanam jivrī yat santā pitarā sanājurā punar yuvānā carathāya takṣatha

translations.griffith: O Vājas, Ṛbhus, reaching far, among the Gods this was your exaltation gloriously declared,  In that your aged Parents, worn with length of days, ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.

verses.sanskrit: एकं वि चक्र चमसं चतुर्वयं निश चर्मणो गाम अरिणीत धीतिभिः अथा देवेष्व अम्र्तत्वम आनश शरुष्टी वाजा रभवस तद व उक्थ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ekaṃ vi cakra camasaṃ caturvayaṃ niś carmaṇo ghām ariṇīta dhītibhiḥ athā deveṣv amṛtatvam ānaśa śruṣṭī vājā ṛbhavas tad va ukthyam

translations.griffith: The chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold, and by your wisdom brought the Cow forth from the hide.  So quickly, mid the Gods, ye gained immortal life. Vājas and Ṛbhus, your great work must be extolled.

verses.sanskrit: रभुतो रयिः परथमश्रवस्तमो वाजश्रुतासो यम अजीजनन नरः विभ्वतष्टो विदथेषु परवाच्यो यं देवासो ऽवथा स विचर्षणिः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhuto rayiḥ prathamaśravastamo vājaśrutāso yam ajījanan naraḥ vibhvataṣṭo vidatheṣu pravācyo yaṃ devāso 'vathā sa vicarṣaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: Wealth from the Ṛbhus is most glorious in renown, that which the Heroes, famed for vigour, have produced.  In synods must be sung the car which Vibhvan wrought: that which ye favour, Gods! is famed among mankind.

verses.sanskrit: स वाज्य अर्वा स रषिर वचस्यया स शूरो अस्ता पर्तनासु दुष्टरः स रायस पोषं स सुवीर्यं दधे यं वाजो विभ्वां रभवो यम आविषुः |||
verses.transliteration: sa vājy arvā sa ṛṣir vacasyayā sa śūro astā pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraḥ sa rāyas poṣaṃ sa suvīryaṃ dadhe yaṃ vājo vibhvāṃ ṛbhavo yam āviṣuḥ

translations.griffith: Strong is the steed, the man a sage in eloquence, the bowman is a hero hard to beat in fight,  Great store of wealth and manly power hath he obtained whom Vāja, Vibhvan, Ṛbhus have looked kindly on.

verses.sanskrit: शरेष्ठं वः पेशो अधि धायि दर्शतं सतोमो वाजा रभवस तं जुजुष्टन धीरासो हि षठा कवयो विपश्चितस तान व एना बरह्मणा वेदयामसि |||
verses.transliteration: śreṣṭhaṃ vaḥ peśo adhi dhāyi darśataṃ stomo vājā ṛbhavas taṃ jujuṣṭana dhīrāso hi ṣṭhā kavayo vipaścitas tān va enā brahmaṇā vedayāmasi

translations.griffith: To you hath been assigned the fairest ornament, the hymn of praise: Vājas and Ṛbhus, joy therein;  For ye have lore and wisdom and poetic skill: as such, with this our prayer we call on you to come.

verses.sanskrit: यूयम अस्मभ्यं धिषणाभ्यस परि विद्वांसो विश्वा नर्याणि भोजना दयुमन्तं वाजं वर्षशुष्मम उत्तमम आ नो रयिम रभवस तक्षता वयः |||
verses.transliteration: yūyam asmabhyaṃ dhiṣaṇābhyas pari vidvāṃso viśvā naryāṇi bhojanā dyumantaṃ vājaṃ vṛṣaśuṣmam uttamam ā no rayim ṛbhavas takṣatā vayaḥ

translations.griffith: According to the wishes of our hearts may ye, who have full knowledge of all the delights of men,  Fashion for us, O Ṛbhus, power and splendid wealth, rich in high courage, excellent, and vital strength.

verses.sanskrit: इह परजाम इह रयिं रराणा इह शरवो वीरवत तक्षता नः येन वयं चितयेमात्य अन्यान तं वाजं चित्रम रभवो ददा नः |||
verses.transliteration: iha prajām iha rayiṃ rarāṇā iha śravo vīravat takṣatā naḥ yena vayaṃ citayemāty anyān taṃ vājaṃ citram ṛbhavo dadā naḥ

translations.griffith: Bestowing on us here riches and offspring, here fashion fame for us befitting heroes.  Vouchsafe us wealth of splendid sort, O Ṛbhus, that we may make us more renowned than others.

verses.sanskrit: उप नो वाजा अध्वरम रभुक्षा देवा यात पथिभिर देवयानैः यथा यज्ञम मनुषो विक्ष्व आसु दधिध्वे रण्वाः सुदिनेष्व अह्नाम |||
verses.transliteration: upa no vājā adhvaram ṛbhukṣā devā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ yathā yajñam manuṣo vikṣv āsu dadhidhve raṇvāḥ sudineṣv ahnām

translations.griffith: COME to our sacrifice, Vājas, Ṛbhukṣans, Gods, by the paths which Gods are wont to travel,  As ye, gay Gods, accept in splendid weather the sacrifice among these folk of Manus.

verses.sanskrit: ते वो हर्दे मनसे सन्तु यज्ञा जुष्टासो अद्य घर्तनिर्णिजो गुः पर वः सुतासो हरयन्त पूर्णाः करत्वे दक्षाय हर्षयन्त पीताः |||
verses.transliteration: te vo hṛde manase santu yajñā juṣṭāso adya ghṛtanirṇijo ghuḥ pra vaḥ sutāso harayanta pūrṇāḥ kratve dakṣāya harṣayanta pītāḥ

translations.griffith: May these rites please you in your heart and spirit; may the drops clothed in oil this day approach you.  May the abundant juices bear you onward to power and strength, and, when imbibed, delight you.

verses.sanskrit: तर्युदायं देवहितं यथा व सतोमो वाजा रभुक्षणो ददे वः जुह्वे मनुष्वद उपरासु विक्षु युष्मे सचा बर्हद्दिवेषु सोमम |||
verses.transliteration: tryudāyaṃ devahitaṃ yathā va stomo vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo dade vaḥ juhve manuṣvad uparāsu vikṣu yuṣme sacā bṛhaddiveṣu somam

translations.griffith: Your threefold going near is God-appointed, so praise is given you, Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans.  So, Manus-like, mid younger folk I offer, to you who are aloft in heaven, the Soma.

verses.sanskrit: पीवोश्वाः शुचद्रथा हि भूतायःशिप्रा वाजिनः सुनिष्काः इन्द्रस्य सूनो शवसो नपातो ऽनु वश चेत्य अग्रियम मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: pīvoaśvāḥ śucadrathā hi bhūtāyaḥśiprā vājinaḥ suniṣkāḥ indrasya sūno śavaso napāto 'nu vaś cety aghriyam madāya

translations.griffith: Strong, with fair chains of gold and jaws of iron, ye have a splendid car and well-fed horses.  Ye Sons of Strength, ye progeny of Indra, to you the best is offered to delight you.

verses.sanskrit: रभुम रभुक्षणो रयिं वाजे वाजिन्तमं युजम इन्द्रस्वन्तं हवामहे सदासातमम अश्विनम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛbhum ṛbhukṣaṇo rayiṃ vāje vājintamaṃ yujam indrasvantaṃ havāmahe sadāsātamam aśvinam

translations.griffith: Ṛbhukṣans! him, for handy wealth, the mightiest comrade in the fight,  Him, Indra's equal, we invoke, most bounteous ever, rich in steeds.

verses.sanskrit: सेद रभवो यम अवथ यूयम इन्द्रश च मर्त्यम स धीभिर अस्तु सनिता मेधसाता सो अर्वता |||
verses.transliteration: sed ṛbhavo yam avatha yūyam indraś ca martyam sa dhībhir astu sanitā medhasātā so arvatā

translations.griffith: The mortal man whom, Ṛbhus, ye and Indra favour with your help,  Must be successful, by his thoughts, at sacrifice and with the steed.

verses.sanskrit: वि नो वाजा रभुक्षणः पथश चितन यष्टवे अस्मभ्यं सूरय सतुता विश्वा आशास तरीषणि |||
verses.transliteration: vi no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ pathaś citana yaṣṭave asmabhyaṃ sūraya stutā viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi

translations.griffith: O Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans, free for us the paths to sacrifice,  Ye Princes, lauded, that we may press forward to each point of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: तं नो वाजा रभुक्षण इन्द्र नासत्या रयिम सम अश्वं चर्षणिभ्य आ पुरु शस्त मघत्तये |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇa indra nāsatyā rayim sam aśvaṃ carṣaṇibhya ā puru śasta maghattaye

translations.griffith: O Vājas and Ṛbhukṣans, ye Nāsatyas, Indra, bless this wealth,  And, before other men's, the steed, that ample riches may be won.

verses.sanskrit: उतो हि वां दात्रा सन्ति पूर्वा या पूरुभ्यस तरसदस्युर नितोशे कषेत्रासां ददथुर उर्वरासां घनं दस्युभ्यो अभिभूतिम उग्रम |||
verses.transliteration: uto hi vāṃ dātrā santi pūrvā yā pūrubhyas trasadasyur nitośe kṣetrāsāṃ dadathur urvarāsāṃ ghanaṃ dasyubhyo abhibhūtim ughram

translations.griffith: FROM you two came the gifts in days aforetime which Trasadasyu granted to the Pūrus.  Ye gave the winner of our fields and plough-lands, and the strong smiter who subdued the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit: उत वाजिनम पुरुनिष्षिध्वानं दधिक्राम उ ददथुर विश्वक्र्ष्टिम रजिप्यं शयेनम परुषितप्सुम आशुं चर्क्र्त्यम अर्यो नर्पतिं न शूरम |||
verses.transliteration: uta vājinam puruniṣṣidhvānaṃ dadhikrām u dadathur viśvakṛṣṭim ṛjipyaṃ śyenam pruṣitapsum āśuṃ carkṛtyam aryo nṛpatiṃ na śūram

translations.griffith: And ye gave mighty Dadhikrās, the giver of many gifts, who visiteth all people,  Impetuous hawk, swift and of varied colour, like a brave King whom each true man must honour.

verses.sanskrit: यं सीम अनु परवतेव दरवन्तं विश्वः पूरुर मदति हर्षमाणः पड्भिर गर्ध्यन्तम मेधयुं न शूरं रथतुरं वातम इव धरजन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ sīm anu pravateva dravantaṃ viśvaḥ pūrur madati harṣamāṇaḥ paḍbhir ghṛdhyantam medhayuṃ na śūraṃ rathaturaṃ vātam iva dhrajantam

translations.griffith: Whom, as ’twere down a precipice, swift rushing, each Pūru praises and his heart rejoices,—  Springing forth like a hero fain for battle, whirling the car and flying like the tempest.

verses.sanskrit: यः समारुन्धानो गध्या समत्सु सनुतरश चरति गोषु गछन आविर्र्जीको विदथा निचिक्यत तिरो अरतिम पर्य आप आयोः |||
verses.transliteration: yaḥ smārundhāno ghadhyā samatsu sanutaraś carati ghoṣu ghachan āvirṛjīko vidathā nicikyat tiro aratim pary āpa āyoḥ

translations.griffith: Who gaineth precious booty in the combats and moveth, winning spoil, among the cattle;  Shown in bright colour, looking on the assemblies, beyond the churl, to worship of the living.

verses.sanskrit: उत समैनं वस्त्रमथिं न तायुम अनु करोशन्ति कषितयो भरेषु नीचायमानं जसुरिं न शयेनं शरवश चाछा पशुमच च यूथम |||
verses.transliteration: uta smainaṃ vastramathiṃ na tāyum anu krośanti kṣitayo bhareṣu nīcāyamānaṃ jasuriṃ na śyenaṃ śravaś cāchā paśumac ca yūtham

translations.griffith: Loudly the folk cry after him in battles, as ’twere a thief who steals away a garment;  Speeding to glory, or a herd of cattle, even as a hungry falcon swooping downward.

verses.sanskrit: उत समासु परथमः सरिष्यन नि वेवेति शरेणिभी रथानाम सरजं कर्ण्वानो जन्यो न शुभ्वा रेणुं रेरिहत किरणं ददश्वान |||
verses.transliteration: uta smāsu prathamaḥ sariṣyan ni veveti śreṇibhī rathānām srajaṃ kṛṇvāno janyo na śubhvā reṇuṃ rerihat kiraṇaṃ dadaśvān

translations.griffith: And, fain to come forth first amid these armies, this way and that with rows of cars he rushes,  Gay like a bridesman, making him a garland, tossing the dust, champing the rein that holds him.

verses.sanskrit: उत सय वाजी सहुरिर रतावा शुश्रूषमाणस तन्वा समर्ये तुरं यतीषु तुरयन्न रजिप्यो ऽधि भरुवोः किरते रेणुम रञ्जन |||
verses.transliteration: uta sya vājī sahurir ṛtāvā śuśrūṣamāṇas tanvā samarye turaṃ yatīṣu turayann ṛjipyo 'dhi bhruvoḥ kirate reṇum ṛñjan

translations.griffith: And that strong Steed, victorious and faithful, obedient with his body in the combat,  Speeding straight on amid the swiftly pressing, casts o’er his brows the dust he tosses upward.

verses.sanskrit: उत समास्य तन्यतोर इव दयोर रघायतो अभियुजो भयन्ते यदा सहस्रम अभि षीम अयोधीद दुर्वर्तुः समा भवति भीम रञ्जन |||
verses.transliteration: uta smāsya tanyator iva dyor ṛghāyato abhiyujo bhayante yadā sahasram abhi ṣīm ayodhīd durvartuḥ smā bhavati bhīma ṛñjan

translations.griffith: And at his thunder, like the roar of heaven, those who attack tremble and are affrighted;  For when he fights against embattled thousands, dread is he in his striving; none may stay him.

verses.sanskrit: उत समास्य पनयन्ति जना जूतिं कर्ष्टिप्रो अभिभूतिम आशोः उतैनम आहुः समिथे वियन्तः परा दधिक्रा असरत सहस्रैः |||
verses.transliteration: uta smāsya panayanti janā jūtiṃ kṛṣṭipro abhibhūtim āśoḥ utainam āhuḥ samithe viyantaḥ parā dadhikrā asarat sahasraiḥ

translations.griffith: The people praise the overpowering swiftness of this fleet Steed who giveth men abundance.  Of him they say when drawing back from battle. Dadhikrās hath sped forward with his thousands.

verses.sanskrit: आ दधिक्राः शवसा पञ्च कर्ष्टीः सूर्य इव जयोतिषापस ततान सहस्रसाः शतसा वाज्य अर्वा पर्णक्तु मध्वा सम इमा वचांसि |||
verses.transliteration: ā dadhikrāḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya iva jyotiṣāpas tatāna sahasrasāḥ śatasā vājy arvā pṛṇaktu madhvā sam imā vacāṃsi

translations.griffith: Dadhikrās hath o’erspread the Fivefold People with vigour, as the Sun lightens the waters.  May the strong Steed who winneth hundreds, thousands, requite with sweetness these my words and praises.

verses.sanskrit: आशुं दधिक्रां तम उ नु षटवाम दिवस पर्थिव्या उत चर्किराम उछन्तीर माम उषसः सूदयन्त्व अति विश्वानि दुरितानि पर्षन |||
verses.transliteration: āśuṃ dadhikrāṃ tam u nu ṣṭavāma divas pṛthivyā uta carkirāma uchantīr mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantv ati viśvāni duritāni parṣan

translations.griffith: Now give we praise to Dadhikrās the rapid, and mention in our laud the Earth and Heaven.  May the Dawns flushing move me to exertion, and bear me safely over every trouble.

verses.sanskrit: महश चर्कर्म्य अर्वतः करतुप्रा दधिक्राव्णः पुरुवारस्य वर्ष्णः यम पूरुभ्यो दीदिवांसं नाग्निं ददथुर मित्रावरुणा ततुरिम |||
verses.transliteration: mahaś carkarmy arvataḥ kratuprā dadhikrāvṇaḥ puruvārasya vṛṣṇaḥ yam pūrubhyo dīdivāṃsaṃ nāghniṃ dadathur mitrāvaruṇā taturim

translations.griffith: I praise the mighty Steed who fills my spirit, the Stallion Dadhikrāvan rich in bounties,  Whom, swift of foot and shining bright as Agni, ye, Varuṇa and Mitra, gave to Pūrus.

verses.sanskrit: यो अश्वस्य दधिक्राव्णो अकारीत समिद्धे अग्ना उषसो वयुष्टौ अनागसं तम अदितिः कर्णोतु स मित्रेण वरुणेना सजोषाः |||
verses.transliteration: yo aśvasya dadhikrāvṇo akārīt samiddhe aghnā uṣaso vyuṣṭau anāghasaṃ tam aditiḥ kṛṇotu sa mitreṇa varuṇenā sajoṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Him who hath honoured, when the flame is kindled at break of dawn, the Courser Dadhikrāvan,  Him, of one mind with Varuṇa and Mitra may Aditi make free from all transgression.

verses.sanskrit: दधिक्राव्ण इष ऊर्जो महो यद अमन्महि मरुतां नाम भद्रम सवस्तये वरुणम मित्रम अग्निं हवामह इन्द्रं वज्रबाहुम |||
verses.transliteration: dadhikrāvṇa iṣa ūrjo maho yad amanmahi marutāṃ nāma bhadram svastaye varuṇam mitram aghniṃ havāmaha indraṃ vajrabāhum

translations.griffith: When we remember mighty Dadhikrāvan our food and strength, then the blest name of Maruts,  Varuṇa, Mitra, we invoke for welfare, and Agni, and the thunder-wielding Indra.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रम इवेद उभये वि हवयन्त उदीराणा यज्ञम उपप्रयन्तः दधिक्राम उ सूदनम मर्त्याय ददथुर मित्रावरुणा नो अश्वम |||
verses.transliteration: indram ived ubhaye vi hvayanta udīrāṇā yajñam upaprayantaḥ dadhikrām u sūdanam martyāya dadathur mitrāvaruṇā no aśvam

translations.griffith: Both sides invoke him as they call on Indra when they stir forth and turn to sacrificing.  To us have Varuṇa and Mitra granted the Courser Dadhikrās, a guide for mortals.

verses.sanskrit: दधिक्राव्णो अकारिषं जिष्णोर अश्वस्य वाजिनः सुरभि नो मुखा करत पर ण आयूंषि तारिषत |||
verses.transliteration: dadhikrāvṇo akāriṣaṃ jiṣṇor aśvasya vājinaḥ surabhi no mukhā karat pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat

translations.griffith: So have I glorified with praise strong Dadhikrāvan, conquering Steed.  Sweet may he make our mouths; may he prolong the days we have to live.

verses.sanskrit: दधिक्राव्ण इद उ नु चर्किराम विश्वा इन माम उषसः सूदयन्तु अपाम अग्नेर उषसः सूर्यस्य बर्हस्पतेर आङगिरसस्य जिष्णोः |||
verses.transliteration: dadhikrāvṇa id u nu carkirāma viśvā in mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu apām aghner uṣasaḥ sūryasya bṛhaspater āṅghirasasya jiṣṇoḥ

translations.griffith: LET us recite the praise of Dadhikrāvan: may all the Mornings move me to exertion;  Praise of the Lord of Waters, Dawn, and Agni, Bṛhaspati Son of Aṅgiras, and Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: सत्वा भरिषो गविषो दुवन्यसच छरवस्याद इष उषसस तुरण्यसत सत्यो दरवो दरवरः पतंगरो दधिक्रावेषम ऊर्जं सवर जनत |||
verses.transliteration: satvā bhariṣo ghaviṣo duvanyasac chravasyād iṣa uṣasas turaṇyasat satyo dravo dravaraḥ pataṃgharo dadhikrāveṣam ūrjaṃ svar janat

translations.griffith: Brave, seeking war and booty, dwelling with the good and with the swift, may he hasten the food of Dawn.  May he the true, the fleet, the lover of the course, the bird-like Dadhikrāvan, bring food, strength, and light.

verses.sanskrit: उत समास्य दरवतस तुरण्यतः पर्णं न वेर अनु वाति परगर्धिनः शयेनस्येव धरजतो अङकसम परि दधिक्राव्णः सहोर्जा तरित्रतः |||
verses.transliteration: uta smāsya dravatas turaṇyataḥ parṇaṃ na ver anu vāti praghardhinaḥ śyenasyeva dhrajato aṅkasam pari dadhikrāvṇaḥ sahorjā taritrataḥ

translations.griffith: His pinion, rapid runner, fans him m his way, as of a bird that hastens onward to its aim,  And, as it were a falcon's gliding through the air, strikes Dadhikrāvan's side as he speeds on with might.

verses.sanskrit: उत सय वाजी कषिपणिं तुरण्यति गरीवायाम बद्धो अपिकक्ष आसनि करतुं दधिक्रा अनु संतवीत्वत पथाम अङकांस्य अन्व आपनीफणत |||
verses.transliteration: uta sya vājī kṣipaṇiṃ turaṇyati ghrīvāyām baddho apikakṣa āsani kratuṃ dadhikrā anu saṃtavītvat pathām aṅkāṃsy anv āpanīphaṇat

translations.griffith: Bound by the neck and by the flanks and by the mouth, the vigorous Courser lends new swiftness to his speed.  Drawing himself together, as his strength allows, Dadhikrās springs along the windings of the paths.

verses.sanskrit: हंसः शुचिषद वसुर अन्तरिक्षसद धोता वेदिषद अतिथिर दुरोणसत नर्षद वरसद रतसद वयोमसद अब्जा गोजा रतजा अद्रिजा रतम |||
verses.transliteration: haṃsaḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir duroṇasat nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā ghojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtam

translations.griffith: The Haṁsa homed in light, the Vasu in mid-air, the priest beside the altar, in the house the guest,  Dweller in noblest place, mid men, in truth, in sky, born of flood, kine, truth, mountain, he is holy Law.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रा को वां वरुणा सुम्नम आप सतोमो हविष्मां अम्र्तो न होता यो वां हर्दि करतुमां अस्मद उक्तः पस्पर्शद इन्द्रावरुणा नमस्वान |||
verses.transliteration: indrā ko vāṃ varuṇā sumnam āpa stomo haviṣmāṃ amṛto na hotā yo vāṃ hṛdi kratumāṃ asmad uktaḥ pasparśad indrāvaruṇā namasvān

translations.griffith: WHAT laud, O Indra-Varuṇa, with oblation, hath like the Immortal Priest obtained your favour?  Hath our effectual laud, addressed with homage, touched you, O Indra-Varuṇa, in spirit?

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रा ह यो वरुणा चक्र आपी देवौ मर्तः सख्याय परयस्वान स हन्ति वर्त्रा समिथेषु शत्रून अवोभिर वा महद्भिः स पर शर्ण्वे |||
verses.transliteration: indrā ha yo varuṇā cakra āpī devau martaḥ sakhyāya prayasvān sa hanti vṛtrā samitheṣu śatrūn avobhir vā mahadbhiḥ sa pra śṛṇve

translations.griffith: He who with dainty food hath won you, Indra and Varuṇa, Gods, as his allies to friendship,  Slayeth the Vṛtras and his foes in battles, and through your mighty favours is made famous.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रा ह रत्नं वरुणा धेष्ठेत्था नर्भ्यः शशमानेभ्यस ता यदी सखाया सख्याय सोमैः सुतेभिः सुप्रयसा मादयैते |||
verses.transliteration: indrā ha ratnaṃ varuṇā dheṣṭhetthā nṛbhyaḥ śaśamānebhyas tā yadī sakhāyā sakhyāya somaiḥ sutebhiḥ suprayasā mādayaite

translations.griffith: Indra and Varuṇa are most liberal givers of treasure to the men who toil to serve them,  When they, as Friends inclined to friendship, honoured with dainty food, delight in flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रा युवं वरुणा दिद्युम अस्मिन्न ओजिष्ठम उग्रा नि वधिष्टं वज्रम यो नो दुरेवो वर्कतिर दभीतिस तस्मिन मिमाथाम अभिभूत्य ओजः |||
verses.transliteration: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā didyum asminn ojiṣṭham ughrā ni vadhiṣṭaṃ vajram yo no durevo vṛkatir dabhītis tasmin mimāthām abhibhūty ojaḥ

translations.griffith: Indra and Varuṇa, ye hurl, O Mighty, on him your strongest flashing bolt of thunder  Who treats us ill, the robber and oppressor: measure on him your overwhelming vigour.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रा युवं वरुणा भूतम अस्या धियः परेतारा वर्षभेव धेनोः सा नो दुहीयद यवसेव गत्वी सहस्रधारा पयसा मही गौः |||
verses.transliteration: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā bhūtam asyā dhiyaḥ pretārā vṛṣabheva dhenoḥ sā no duhīyad yavaseva ghatvī sahasradhārā payasā mahī ghauḥ

translations.griffith: O Indra-Varuṇa, be ye the lovers of this my song, as steers who love the milch-Cow.  Milk may it yield us as, gone forth to pasture, the great Cow pouring out her thousand rivers.

verses.sanskrit: तोके हिते तनय उर्वरासु सूरो दर्शीके वर्षणश च पौंस्ये इन्द्रा नो अत्र वरुणा सयाताम अवोभिर दस्मा परितक्म्यायाम |||
verses.transliteration: toke hite tanaya urvarāsu sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaś ca pauṃsye indrā no atra varuṇā syātām avobhir dasmā paritakmyāyām

translations.griffith: For fertile fields, for worthy sons and grandsons, for the Sun's beauty and for steer-like vigour,  May Indra-Varuṇa with gracious favours work marvels for us in the stress of battle.

verses.sanskrit: युवाम इद धय अवसे पूर्व्याय परि परभूती गविषः सवापी वर्णीमहे सख्याय परियाय शूरा मंहिष्ठा पितरेव शम्भू |||
verses.transliteration: yuvām id dhy avase pūrvyāya pari prabhūtī ghaviṣaḥ svāpī vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya priyāya śūrā maṃhiṣṭhā pitareva śambhū

translations.griffith: For you, as Princes, for your ancient kindness, good comrades of the man who seeks for booty,  We choose to us for the dear bond of friendship, most liberal Heroes bringing bliss like parents.

verses.sanskrit: ता वां धियो ऽवसे वाजयन्तीर आजिं न जग्मुर युवयूः सुदानू शरिये न गाव उप सोमम अस्थुर इन्द्रं गिरो वरुणम मे मनीषाः |||
verses.transliteration: tā vāṃ dhiyo 'vase vājayantīr ājiṃ na jaghmur yuvayūḥ sudānū śriye na ghāva upa somam asthur indraṃ ghiro varuṇam me manīṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Showing their strength, these hymns for grace, Free-givers I have gone to you, devoted, as to battle.  For glory have they gone, as milk to Soma, to Indra-Varuṇa my thoughts and praises.

verses.sanskrit: इमा इन्द्रं वरुणम मे मनीषा अग्मन्न उप दरविणम इछमानाः उपेम अस्थुर जोष्टार इव वस्वो रघ्वीर इव शरवसो भिक्षमाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: imā indraṃ varuṇam me manīṣā aghmann upa draviṇam ichamānāḥ upem asthur joṣṭāra iva vasvo raghvīr iva śravaso bhikṣamāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: To Indra and to Varuṇa, desirous of gaining wealth have these my thoughts proceeded.  They have come nigh to you as treasure-lovers, like mares, fleet-footed, eager for the glory.

verses.sanskrit: अश्व्यस्य तमना रथ्यस्य पुष्टेर नित्यस्य रायः पतयः सयाम ता चक्राणा ऊतिभिर नव्यसीभिर अस्मत्रा रायो नियुतः सचन्ताम |||
verses.transliteration: aśvyasya tmanā rathyasya puṣṭer nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma tā cakrāṇā ūtibhir navyasībhir asmatrā rāyo niyutaḥ sacantām

translations.griffith: May we ourselves be lords of during riches, of ample sustenance for car and hones.  So may the Twain who work with newest succours bring yoked teams hitherward to us and riches.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो बर्हन्ता बर्हतीभिर ऊती इन्द्र यातं वरुण वाजसातौ यद दिद्यवः पर्तनासु परक्रीळान तस्य वां सयाम सनितार आजेः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no bṛhantā bṛhatībhir ūtī indra yātaṃ varuṇa vājasātau yad didyavaḥ pṛtanāsu prakrīḷān tasya vāṃ syāma sanitāra ājeḥ

translations.griffith: Come with your mighty succours, O ye Mighty; come, Indra-Varuṇa, to us in battle.  What time the flashing arrows play in combat, may we through you be winners in the contest.

verses.sanskrit: मम दविता राष्ट्रं कषत्रियस्य विश्वायोर विश्वे अम्र्ता यथा नः करतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कर्ष्टेर उपमस्य वव्रेः |||
verses.transliteration: mama dvitā rāṣṭraṃ kṣatriyasya viśvāyor viśve amṛtā yathā naḥ kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ

translations.griffith: I AM the royal Ruler, mine is empire, as mine who sway all life are all Immortals.  Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

verses.sanskrit: अहं राजा वरुणो मह्यं तान्य असुर्याणि परथमा धारयन्त करतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कर्ष्टेर उपमस्य वव्रेः |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ rājā varuṇo mahyaṃ tāny asuryāṇi prathamā dhārayanta kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ

translations.griffith: I am King Varuṇa. To me were given these first existing high celestial powers.  Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

verses.sanskrit: अहम इन्द्रो वरुणस ते महित्वोर्वी गभीरे रजसी सुमेके तवष्टेव विश्वा भुवनानि विद्वान सम ऐरयं रोदसी धारयं च |||
verses.transliteration: aham indro varuṇas te mahitvorvī ghabhīre rajasī sumeke tvaṣṭeva viśvā bhuvanāni vidvān sam airayaṃ rodasī dhārayaṃ ca

translations.griffith: I Varuṇa am Indra: in their greatness, these the two wide deep fairly-fashioned regions,  These the two world-halves have I, even as Tvaṣṭar knowing all beings, joined and held together.

verses.sanskrit: अहम अपो अपिन्वम उक्षमाणा धारयं दिवं सदन रतस्य रतेन पुत्रो अदितेर रतावोत तरिधातु परथयद वि भूम |||
verses.transliteration: aham apo apinvam ukṣamāṇā dhārayaṃ divaṃ sadana ṛtasya ṛtena putro aditer ṛtāvota tridhātu prathayad vi bhūma

translations.griffith: I made to flow the moisture-shedding waters, and set the heaven firm in the scat of Order.  By Law the Son of Aditi, Law Observer, hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure.

verses.sanskrit: मां नरः सवश्वा वाजयन्तो मां वर्ताः समरणे हवन्ते कर्णोम्य आजिम मघवाहम इन्द्र इयर्मि रेणुम अभिभूत्योजाः |||
verses.transliteration: māṃ naraḥ svaśvā vājayanto māṃ vṛtāḥ samaraṇe havante kṛṇomy ājim maghavāham indra iyarmi reṇum abhibhūtyojāḥ

translations.griffith: Heroes with noble horses, fain for battle, selected warriors, call on me in combat.  I Indra Maghavan, excite the conflict; I stir the dust, Lord of surpassing vigour.

verses.sanskrit: अहं ता विश्वा चकरं नकिर मा दैव्यं सहो वरते अप्रतीतम यन मा सोमासो ममदन यद उक्थोभे भयेते रजसी अपारे |||
verses.transliteration: ahaṃ tā viśvā cakaraṃ nakir mā daivyaṃ saho varate apratītam yan mā somāso mamadan yad ukthobhe bhayete rajasī apāre

translations.griffith: All this I did. The Gods’ own conquering power never impedeth me whom none opposeth.  When lauds and Soma juice have made me joyful, both the unbounded regions are affrighted.

verses.sanskrit: विदुष ते विश्वा भुवनानि तस्य ता पर बरवीषि वरुणाय वेधः तवं वर्त्राणि शर्ण्विषे जघन्वान तवं वर्तां अरिणा इन्द्र सिन्धून |||
verses.transliteration: viduṣ te viśvā bhuvanāni tasya tā pra bravīṣi varuṇāya vedhaḥ tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi śṛṇviṣe jaghanvān tvaṃ vṛtāṃ ariṇā indra sindhūn

translations.griffith: All beings know these deeds of thine thou tellest this unto Varuṇa, thou great Disposer!  Thou art renowned as having slain the Vṛtras. Thou madest flow the floods that were obstructed.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकम अत्र पितरस त आसन सप्त रषयो दौर्गहे बध्यमाने त आयजन्त तरसदस्युम अस्या इन्द्रं न वर्त्रतुरम अर्धदेवम |||
verses.transliteration: asmākam atra pitaras ta āsan sapta ṛṣayo daurghahe badhyamāne ta āyajanta trasadasyum asyā indraṃ na vṛtraturam ardhadevam

translations.griffith: Our fathers then were these, the Seven his, what time the son of Durgaha was captive.  For her they gained by sacrifice Trasadasyu, a demi-god, like Indra, conquering foemen.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुकुत्सानी हि वाम अदाशद धव्येभिर इन्द्रावरुणा नमोभिः अथा राजानं तरसदस्युम अस्या वर्त्रहणं ददथुर अर्धदेवम |||
verses.transliteration: purukutsānī hi vām adāśad dhavyebhir indrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ athā rājānaṃ trasadasyum asyā vṛtrahaṇaṃ dadathur ardhadevam

translations.griffith: The spouse of Purukutsa gave oblations to you, O Indra-Varuṇa, with homage.  Then unto her ye gave King Trasadasyu, the demi-god, the slayer of the foeman.

verses.sanskrit: राया वयं ससवांसो मदेम हव्येन देवा यवसेन गावः तां धेनुम इन्द्रावरुणा युवं नो विश्वाहा धत्तम अनपस्फुरन्तीम |||
verses.transliteration: rāyā vayaṃ sasavāṃso madema havyena devā yavasena ghāvaḥ tāṃ dhenum indrāvaruṇā yuvaṃ no viśvāhā dhattam anapasphurantīm

translations.griffith: May we, possessing much, delight in riches, Gods in oblations and the kine in pasture;  And that Milch-cow who shrinks not from the milking, O Indra-Varuṇa, give to us daily.

verses.sanskrit: क उ शरवत कतमो यज्ञियानां वन्दारु देवः कतमो जुषाते कस्येमां देवीम अम्र्तेषु परेष्ठां हर्दि शरेषाम सुष्टुतिं सुहव्याम |||
verses.transliteration: ka u śravat katamo yajñiyānāṃ vandāru devaḥ katamo juṣāte kasyemāṃ devīm amṛteṣu preṣṭhāṃ hṛdi śreṣāma suṣṭutiṃ suhavyām

translations.griffith: WHO will hear, who of those who merit worship, which of all Gods take pleasure in our homage?  On whose heart shall we lay this laud celestial, rich with fair offerings, dearest to Immortals?

verses.sanskrit: को मर्ळाति कतम आगमिष्ठो देवानाम उ कतमः शम्भविष्ठः रथं कम आहुर दरवदश्वम आशुं यं सूर्यस्य दुहिताव्र्णीत |||
verses.transliteration: ko mṛḷāti katama āghamiṣṭho devānām u katamaḥ śambhaviṣṭhaḥ rathaṃ kam āhur dravadaśvam āśuṃ yaṃ sūryasya duhitāvṛṇīta

translations.griffith: Who will be gracious? Who will come most quickly of all the Gods? Who will  bring bliss most largely?  What car do they call swift with rapid coursers? That which the Daughter of the Sun elected.

verses.sanskrit: मक्षू हि षमा गछथ ईवतो दयून इन्द्रो न शक्तिम परितक्म्यायाम दिव आजाता दिव्या सुपर्णा कया शचीनाम भवथः शचिष्ठा |||
verses.transliteration: makṣū hi ṣmā ghachatha īvato dyūn indro na śaktim paritakmyāyām diva ājātā divyā suparṇā kayā śacīnām bhavathaḥ śaciṣṭhā

translations.griffith: So many days do ye come swiftly hither, as Indra to give help in stress of battle.  Descended from the sky, divine, strong-pinioned, by which of all your powers are ye most mighty?

verses.sanskrit: का वाम भूद उपमातिः कया न आश्विना गमथो हूयमाना को वाम महश चित तयजसो अभीक उरुष्यतम माध्वी दस्रा न ऊती |||
verses.transliteration: kā vām bhūd upamātiḥ kayā na āśvinā ghamatho hūyamānā ko vām mahaś cit tyajaso abhīka uruṣyatam mādhvī dasrā na ūtī

translations.griffith: What is the prayer that we should bring you, Aśvins, whereby ye come to us when invocated?  Whether of you confronts e’en great betrayal? Lovers of sweetness, Dasras, help and save us.

verses.sanskrit: उरु वां रथः परि नक्षति दयाम आ यत समुद्राद अभि वर्तते वाम मध्वा माध्वी मधु वाम परुषायन यत सीं वाम पर्क्षो भुरजन्त पक्वाः |||
verses.transliteration: uru vāṃ rathaḥ pari nakṣati dyām ā yat samudrād abhi vartate vām madhvā mādhvī madhu vām pruṣāyan yat sīṃ vām pṛkṣo bhurajanta pakvāḥ

translations.griffith: In the wide space your chariot reacheth heaven, what time it turneth hither from the ocean.  Sweets from your sweet shall drop, lovers of sweetness! These have they dressed for you as dainty viands.

verses.sanskrit: सिन्धुर ह वां रसया सिञ्चद अश्वान घर्णा वयो ऽरुषासः परि गमन तद ऊ षु वाम अजिरं चेति यानं येन पती भवथः सूर्यायाः |||
verses.transliteration: sindhur ha vāṃ rasayā siñcad aśvān ghṛṇā vayo 'ruṣāsaḥ pari ghman tad ū ṣu vām ajiraṃ ceti yānaṃ yena patī bhavathaḥ sūryāyāḥ

translations.griffith: Let Sindhu with his wave bedew your horses: in fiery glow have the red birds come hither.  Observed of all was that your rapid going, whereby ye were the Lords of Sūrya's Daughter.

verses.sanskrit: इहेह यद वां समना पप्र्क्षे सेयम अस्मे सुमतिर वाजरत्ना उरुष्यतं जरितारं युवं ह शरितः कामो नासत्या युवद्रिक |||
verses.transliteration: iheha yad vāṃ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā uruṣyataṃ jaritāraṃ yuvaṃ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik

translations.griffith: Whene’er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty.  Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nāsatyas, is my wish directed.

verses.sanskrit: तं वां रथं वयम अद्या हुवेम पर्थुज्रयम अश्विना संगतिं गोः यः सूर्यां वहति वन्धुरायुर गिर्वाहसम पुरुतमं वसूयुम |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vāṃ rathaṃ vayam adyā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṃghatiṃ ghoḥ yaḥ sūryāṃ vahati vandhurāyur ghirvāhasam purutamaṃ vasūyum

translations.griffith: WE will invoke this day your car, far-spreading, O Aśvins, even the gathering, of the sunlight,—  Car praised in hymns, most ample, rich in treasure, fitted with seats, the car that beareth Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: युवं शरियम अश्विना देवता तां दिवो नपाता वनथः शचीभिः युवोर वपुर अभि पर्क्षः सचन्ते वहन्ति यत ककुहासो रथे वाम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ śriyam aśvinā devatā tāṃ divo napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ yuvor vapur abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāso rathe vām

translations.griffith: Aśvins, ye gained that glory by your Godhead, ye Sons of Heaven, by your own might and power.  Food followeth close upon your bright appearing when stately horses in your chariot draw you.

verses.sanskrit: को वाम अद्या करते रातहव्य ऊतये वा सुतपेयाय वार्कैः रतस्य वा वनुषे पूर्व्याय नमो येमानो अश्विना ववर्तत |||
verses.transliteration: ko vām adyā karate rātahavya ūtaye vā sutapeyāya vārkaiḥ ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namo yemāno aśvinā vavartat

translations.griffith: Who bringeth you to-day for help with offered oblation, or with hymns to drink the juices?  Who, for the sacrifice's ancient lover, turneth you hither, Aśvins, offering homage?

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्ययेन पुरुभू रथेनेमं यज्ञं नासत्योप यातम पिबाथ इन मधुनः सोम्यस्य दधथो रत्नं विधते जनाय |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyayena purubhū rathenemaṃ yajñaṃ nāsatyopa yātam pibātha in madhunaḥ somyasya dadhatho ratnaṃ vidhate janāya

translations.griffith: Borne on your golden car, ye omnipresent! come to this sacrifice of ours, Nāsatyas.  Drink of the pleasant liquor of the Soma give riches to the people who adore you.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो यातं दिवो अछा पर्थिव्या हिरण्ययेन सुव्र्ता रथेन मा वाम अन्ये नि यमन देवयन्तः सं यद ददे नाभिः पूर्व्या वाम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no yātaṃ divo achā pṛthivyā hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ saṃ yad dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām

translations.griffith: Come hitherward to us from earth, from heaven, borne on your golden chariot rolling lightly.  Suffer not other worshippers to stay you here are ye bound by earlier bonds of friendship.

verses.sanskrit: नू नो रयिम पुरुवीरम बर्हन्तं दस्रा मिमाथाम उभयेष्व अस्मे नरो यद वाम अश्विना सतोमम आवन सधस्तुतिम आजमीळ्हासो अग्मन |||
verses.transliteration: nū no rayim puruvīram bṛhantaṃ dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣv asme naro yad vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīḷhāso aghman

translations.griffith: Now for us both, mete out, O Wonder-Workers, riches exceeding great with store of heroes,  Because the men have sent you praise, O Aśvins, and Ajamīlhas come to the laudation.

verses.sanskrit: इहेह यद वां समना पप्र्क्षे सेयम अस्मे सुमतिर वाजरत्ना उरुष्यतं जरितारं युवं ह शरितः कामो नासत्या युवद्रिक |||
verses.transliteration: iheha yad vāṃ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā uruṣyataṃ jaritāraṃ yuvaṃ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik

translations.griffith: Whene’er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty.  Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nāsatyas, is my wish directed.

verses.sanskrit: एष सय भानुर उद इयर्ति युज्यते रथः परिज्मा दिवो अस्य सानवि पर्क्षासो अस्मिन मिथुना अधि तरयो दर्तिस तुरीयो मधुनो वि रप्शते |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa sya bhānur ud iyarti yujyate rathaḥ parijmā divo asya sānavi pṛkṣāso asmin mithunā adhi trayo dṛtis turīyo madhuno vi rapśate

translations.griffith: YONDER goes up that light: your chariot is yoked that travels round upon the summit of this heaven.  Within this car are stored three kindred shares of food, and a skin filled with meath is rustling as the fourth.

verses.sanskrit: उद वाम पर्क्षासो मधुमन्त ईरते रथा अश्वास उषसो वयुष्टिषु अपोर्णुवन्तस तम आ परीव्र्तं सवर ण शुक्रं तन्वन्त आ रजः |||
verses.transliteration: ud vām pṛkṣāso madhumanta īrate rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu aporṇuvantas tama ā parīvṛtaṃ svar ṇa śukraṃ tanvanta ā rajaḥ

translations.griffith: Forth come your viands rich with store of pleasant meath, and cars and horses at the flushing of the dawn,  Stripping the covering from the surrounded gloom, and spreading through mid-air bright radiance like the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: मध्वः पिबतम मधुपेभिर आसभिर उत परियम मधुने युञ्जाथां रथम आ वर्तनिम मधुना जिन्वथस पथो दर्तिं वहेथे मधुमन्तम अश्विना |||
verses.transliteration: madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhir āsabhir uta priyam madhune yuñjāthāṃ ratham ā vartanim madhunā jinvathas patho dṛtiṃ vahethe madhumantam aśvinā

translations.griffith: Drink of the meath with lips accustomed to the draught; harness for the meath's sake the chariot that ye love.  Refresh the way ye go, refresh the paths with meath: hither, O Aśvins, bring the skin that holds the meath.

verses.sanskrit: हंसासो ये वाम मधुमन्तो अस्रिधो हिरण्यपर्णा उहुव उषर्बुधः उदप्रुतो मन्दिनो मन्दिनिस्प्र्शो मध्वो न मक्षः सवनानि गछथः |||
verses.transliteration: haṃsāso ye vām madhumanto asridho hiraṇyaparṇā uhuva uṣarbudhaḥ udapruto mandino mandinispṛśo madhvo na makṣaḥ savanāni ghachathaḥ

translations.griffith: The swans ye have are friendly, rich in store of meath, gold-pinioned, strong to draw, awake at early morn,  Swimming the flood, exultant, fain for draughts that cheer: ye come like flies to our libations of the meath.

verses.sanskrit: सवध्वरासो मधुमन्तो अग्नय उस्रा जरन्ते परति वस्तोर अश्विना यन निक्तहस्तस तरणिर विचक्षणः सोमं सुषाव मधुमन्तम अद्रिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: svadhvarāso madhumanto aghnaya usrā jarante prati vastor aśvinā yan niktahastas taraṇir vicakṣaṇaḥ somaṃ suṣāva madhumantam adribhiḥ

translations.griffith: Well knowing solemn rites and rich in meath, the fires sing to the morning Aśvins at the break of day,  When with pure hands the prudent energetic priest hath with the stones pressed out the Soma rich in meath.

verses.sanskrit: आकेनिपासो अहभिर दविध्वतः सवर ण शुक्रं तन्वन्त आ रजः सूरश चिद अश्वान युयुजान ईयते विश्वां अनु सवधया चेतथस पथः |||
verses.transliteration: ākenipāso ahabhir davidhvataḥ svar ṇa śukraṃ tanvanta ā rajaḥ sūraś cid aśvān yuyujāna īyate viśvāṃ anu svadhayā cetathas pathaḥ

translations.griffith: The rays advancing nigh, chasing with day the gloom, spread through the firmament bright radiance like the Sun;  And the Sun harnessing his horses goeth forth: ye through your Godlike nature let his paths be known.

verses.sanskrit: पर वाम अवोचम अश्विना धियंधा रथः सवश्वो अजरो यो अस्ति येन सद्यः परि रजांसि याथो हविष्मन्तं तरणिम भोजम अछ |||
verses.transliteration: pra vām avocam aśvinā dhiyaṃdhā rathaḥ svaśvo ajaro yo asti yena sadyaḥ pari rajāṃsi yātho haviṣmantaṃ taraṇim bhojam acha

translations.griffith: Devout in thought I have declared, O Aśvins, your chariot with good steeds, which lasts for ever,  Wherewith ye travel swiftly through the regions to the prompt worshipper who brings oblation.

verses.sanskrit: अग्रम पिबा मधूनां सुतं वायो दिविष्टिषु तवं हि पूर्वपा असि |||
verses.transliteration: aghram pibā madhūnāṃ sutaṃ vāyo diviṣṭiṣu tvaṃ hi pūrvapā asi

translations.griffith: DRINK the best draught of Soma-juice, O Vāyu, at our holy rites:  For thou art he who drinketh first.

verses.sanskrit: शतेना नो अभिष्टिभिर नियुत्वां इन्द्रसारथिः वायो सुतस्य तर्म्पतम |||
verses.transliteration: śatenā no abhiṣṭibhir niyutvāṃ indrasārathiḥ vāyo sutasya tṛmpatam

translations.griffith: Come, team-drawn, with thy hundred helps, with Indra, seated in the car,  Vāyu, and drink your fill of juice.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां सहस्रं हरय इन्द्रवायू अभि परयः वहन्तु सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ sahasraṃ haraya indravāyū abhi prayaḥ vahantu somapītaye

translations.griffith: May steeds a thousand bring you both, Indra. and Vāyu, hitherward  To drink the Soma, to the feast.

verses.sanskrit: रथं हिरण्यवन्धुरम इन्द्रवायू सवध्वरम आ हि सथाथो दिविस्प्र्शम |||
verses.transliteration: rathaṃ hiraṇyavandhuram indravāyū svadhvaram ā hi sthātho divispṛśam

translations.griffith: For ye, O Indra-Vāyu, mount the golden-seated car that aids  The sacrifice, that reaches heaven.

verses.sanskrit: रथेन पर्थुपाजसा दाश्वांसम उप गछतम इन्द्रवायू इहा गतम |||
verses.transliteration: rathena pṛthupājasā dāśvāṃsam upa ghachatam indravāyū ihā ghatam

translations.griffith: On far-refulgent chariot come unto the man who offers gifts:  Come, Indra-Vāyu, hitherward.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रवायू अयं सुतस तं देवेभिः सजोषसा पिबतं दाशुषो गर्हे |||
verses.transliteration: indravāyū ayaṃ sutas taṃ devebhiḥ sajoṣasā pibataṃ dāśuṣo ghṛhe

translations.griffith: Here, Indra-Vāyu, is the juice: drink it, accordant with the Gods,  Within the giver's dwelling-place.

verses.sanskrit: इह परयाणम अस्तु वाम इन्द्रवायू विमोचनम इह वां सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: iha prayāṇam astu vām indravāyū vimocanam iha vāṃ somapītaye

translations.griffith: Hither, O Indra-Vāyu, be your journey here unyoke your steeds,  Here for your draught of Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: वायो शुक्रो अयामि ते मध्वो अग्रं दिविष्टिषु आ याहि सोमपीतये सपार्हो देव नियुत्वता |||
verses.transliteration: vāyo śukro ayāmi te madhvo aghraṃ diviṣṭiṣu ā yāhi somapītaye spārho deva niyutvatā

translations.griffith: Vāyu, the bright is offered thee, best of the meath at holy rites.  Come thou to drink the Soma juice, God, longed-for, on thy team-drawn car.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रश च वायव एषां सोमानाम पीतिम अर्हथः युवां हि यन्तीन्दवो निम्नम आपो न सध्र्यक |||
verses.transliteration: indraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ somānām pītim arhathaḥ yuvāṃ hi yantīndavo nimnam āpo na sadhryak

translations.griffith: O Vāyu, thou and Indra are meet drinkers of these Soma-draughts,  For unto you the drops proceed as waters gather to the vale.

verses.sanskrit: वायव इन्द्रश च शुष्मिणा सरथं शवसस पती नियुत्वन्ता न ऊतय आ यातं सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: vāyav indraś ca śuṣmiṇā sarathaṃ śavasas patī niyutvantā na ūtaya ā yātaṃ somapītaye

translations.griffith: O Indra-Vāyu, mighty Twain, speeding together, Lords of Strength,  Come to our succour with your team, that ye may drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: या वां सन्ति पुरुस्प्र्हो नियुतो दाशुषे नरा अस्मे ता यज्ञवाहसेन्द्रवायू नि यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: yā vāṃ santi puruspṛho niyuto dāśuṣe narā asme tā yajñavāhasendravāyū ni yachatam

translations.griffith: The longed-for teams which ye possess, O Heroes, for the worshipper,  Turn to us, Indra-Vāyu, ye to whom the sacrifice is paid.

verses.sanskrit: विहि होत्रा अवीता विपो न रायो अर्यः वायव आ चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: vihi hotrā avītā vipo na rāyo aryaḥ vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye

translations.griffith: TASTE offerings never tasted yet, as bards enjoy the foeman's wealth.  O Vāyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

verses.sanskrit: निर्युवाणो अशस्तीर नियुत्वां इन्द्रसारथिः वायव आ चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: niryuvāṇo aśastīr niyutvāṃ indrasārathiḥ vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Removing curses, drawn by teams, with Indra, seated by thy side,  O Vāyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

verses.sanskrit: अनु कर्ष्णे वसुधिती येमाते विश्वपेशसा वायव आ चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī yemāte viśvapeśasā vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye

translations.griffith: The two dark treasuries of wealth that wear  all beauties wait on thee.  O Vāyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

verses.sanskrit: वहन्तु तवा मनोयुजो युक्तासो नवतिर नव वायव आ चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: vahantu tvā manoyujo yuktāso navatir nava vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye

translations.griffith: May nine-and-ninety harnessed steeds who yoke them at thy will bring thee.  O Vāyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

verses.sanskrit: वायो शतं हरीणां युवस्व पोष्याणाम उत वा ते सहस्रिणो रथ आ यातु पाजसा |||
verses.transliteration: vāyo śataṃ harīṇāṃ yuvasva poṣyāṇām uta vā te sahasriṇo ratha ā yātu pājasā

translations.griffith: Harness, O Vāyu, to thy car a hundred well-fed tawny steeds,  Yea, or a thousand steeds, and let thy chariot come to us with might.

verses.sanskrit: इदं वाम आस्य हविः परियम इन्द्राब्र्हस्पती उक्थम मदश च शस्यते |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ vām āsy haviḥ priyam indrābṛhaspatī uktham madaś ca śasyate

translations.griffith: DEAR is this offering in your mouth, O Indra and Bṛhaspati:  Famed is the laud, the gladdening draught.

verses.sanskrit: अयं वाम परि षिच्यते सोम इन्द्राब्र्हस्पती चारुर मदाय पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ vām pari ṣicyate soma indrābṛhaspatī cārur madāya pītaye

translations.griffith: This lovely Soma is effused, O Indra and Bṛhaspati,  For you, to drink it and rejoice.

verses.sanskrit: आ न इन्द्राब्र्हस्पती गर्हम इन्द्रश च गछतम सोमपा सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā na indrābṛhaspatī ghṛham indraś ca ghachatam somapā somapītaye

translations.griffith: As Soma-drinkers to our house come, Indra and Bṛhaspati-and Indra-to drink Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मे इन्द्राब्र्हस्पती रयिं धत्तं शतग्विनम अश्वावन्तं सहस्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: asme indrābṛhaspatī rayiṃ dhattaṃ śataghvinam aśvāvantaṃ sahasriṇam

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe us riches hundredfold, O Indra, and Bṛhaspati,  With store of horses, thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राब्र्हस्पती वयं सुते गीर्भिर हवामहे अस्य सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: indrābṛhaspatī vayaṃ sute ghīrbhir havāmahe asya somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: O Indra. and Bṛhaspati, we call you when the meath is shed,  With songs, to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: सोमम इन्द्राब्र्हस्पती पिबतं दाशुषो गर्हे मादयेथां तदोकसा |||
verses.transliteration: somam indrābṛhaspatī pibataṃ dāśuṣo ghṛhe mādayethāṃ tadokasā

translations.griffith: Drink, Indra and Bṛhaspati, the Soma in the giver's house:  Delight yourselves abiding there.

verses.sanskrit: यस तस्तम्भ सहसा वि जमो अन्तान बर्हस्पतिस तरिषधस्थो रवेण तम परत्नास रषयो दीध्यानाः पुरो विप्रा दधिरे मन्द्रजिह्वम |||
verses.transliteration: yas tastambha sahasā vi jmo antān bṛhaspatis triṣadhastho raveṇa tam pratnāsa ṛṣayo dīdhyānāḥ puro viprā dadhire mandrajihvam

translations.griffith: Him who with might hath propped earth's ends, who sitteth in threefold seat, Bṛhaspati, with thunder,  Him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages, deep-thinking, holy singers, set before them.

verses.sanskrit: धुनेतयः सुप्रकेतम मदन्तो बर्हस्पते अभि ये नस ततस्रे पर्षन्तं सर्प्रम अदब्धम ऊर्वम बर्हस्पते रक्षताद अस्य योनिम |||
verses.transliteration: dhunetayaḥ supraketam madanto bṛhaspate abhi ye nas tatasre pṛṣantaṃ sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatād asya yonim

translations.griffith: Wild in their course, in well-marked wise rejoicing were they, Bṛhaspati, who pressed around us.  Preserve Bṛhaspati, the stall uninjured, this company's raining, ever-moving birthplace.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पते या परमा परावद अत आ त रतस्प्र्शो नि षेदुः तुभ्यं खाता अवता अद्रिदुग्धा मध्व शचोतन्त्य अभितो विरप्शम |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvad ata ā ta ṛtaspṛśo ni ṣeduḥ tubhyaṃ khātā avatā adridughdhā madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati, from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal.  For thee were dug wells springing from the mountain, which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिः परथमं जायमानो महो जयोतिषः परमे वयोमन सप्तास्यस तुविजातो रवेण वि सप्तरश्मिर अधमत तमांसि |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāno maho jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman saptāsyas tuvijāto raveṇa vi saptaraśmir adhamat tamāṃsi

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati, when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven,  Strong, with his sevenfold mouth, with noise of thunder, with his seven rays, blew and dispersed the darkness.

verses.sanskrit: स सुष्टुभा स रक्वता गणेन वलं रुरोज फलिगं रवेण बर्हस्पतिर उस्रिया हव्यसूदः कनिक्रदद वावशतीर उद आजत |||
verses.transliteration: sa suṣṭubhā sa ṛkvatā ghaṇena valaṃ ruroja phalighaṃ raveṇa bṛhaspatir usriyā havyasūdaḥ kanikradad vāvaśatīr ud ājat

translations.griffith: With the loud-shouting band who sang his praises, with thunder, he destroyed obstructive Vala.  Bṛhaspati thundering drave forth the cattle, the lowing cows who make oblations ready.

verses.sanskrit: एवा पित्रे विश्वदेवाय वर्ष्णे यज्ञैर विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः बर्हस्पते सुप्रजा वीरवन्तो वयं सयाम पतयो रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: evā pitre viśvadevāya vṛṣṇe yajñair vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ bṛhaspate suprajā vīravanto vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām

translations.griffith: Serve we with sacrifices, gifts, and homage even thus the Steer of all the Gods, the Father.  Bṛhaspati, may we be lords of riches, with noble progeny and store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit: स इद राजा परतिजन्यानि विश्वा शुष्मेण तस्थाव अभि वीर्य्ण बर्हस्पतिं यः सुभ्र्तम बिभर्ति वल्गूयति वन्दते पूर्वभाजम |||
verses.transliteration: sa id rājā pratijanyāni viśvā śuṣmeṇa tasthāv abhi vīryṇa bṛhaspatiṃ yaḥ subhṛtam bibharti valghūyati vandate pūrvabhājam

translations.griffith: Surely that King by power and might heroic hath made him lord of all his foes' posses-ions,  Who cherishes Bṛhaspati well-tended, adorns and worships him as foremost sharer.

verses.sanskrit: स इत कषेति सुधित ओकसि सवे तस्मा इळा पिन्वते विश्वदानीम तस्मै विशः सवयम एवा नमन्ते यस्मिन बरह्मा राजनि पूर्व एति |||
verses.transliteration: sa it kṣeti sudhita okasi sve tasmā iḷā pinvate viśvadānīm tasmai viśaḥ svayam evā namante yasmin brahmā rājani pūrva eti

translations.griffith: In his own house he dwells in peace and comfort: to him for ever holy food flows richly.  To him the people with free will pay homage-the King with whom the Brahman hath precedence.

verses.sanskrit: अप्रतीतो जयति सं धनानि परतिजन्यान्य उत या सजन्या अवस्यवे यो वरिवः कर्णोति बरह्मणे राजा तम अवन्ति देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: apratīto jayati saṃ dhanāni pratijanyāny uta yā sajanyā avasyave yo varivaḥ kṛṇoti brahmaṇe rājā tam avanti devāḥ

translations.griffith: He, unopposed, is master of the riches of his own subjects and of hostile people.  The Gods uphold that King with their protection who helps the Brahman when he seeks his favour.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रश च सोमम पिबतम बर्हस्पते ऽसमिन यज्ञे मन्दसाना वर्षण्वसू आ वां विशन्त्व इन्दवः सवाभुवो ऽसमे रयिं सर्ववीरं नि यछतम |||
verses.transliteration: indraś ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate 'smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū ā vāṃ viśantv indavaḥ svābhuvo 'sme rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ ni yachatam

translations.griffith: Indra, Bṛhaspati, rainers of treasure, rejoicing at this sacrifice drink the Soma.  Let the abundant drops sink deep within you: vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हस्पत इन्द्र वर्धतं नः सचा सा वां सुमतिर भूत्व अस्मे अविष्टं धियो जिग्र्तम पुरंधीर जजस्तम अर्यो वनुषाम अरातीः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspata indra vardhataṃ naḥ sacā sā vāṃ sumatir bhūtv asme aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jighṛtam puraṃdhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ

translations.griffith: Bṛhaspati and Indra, make us prosper may this be your benevolence to us-ward.  Assist our holy thoughts, wake up our spirit: weaken the hatred of our foe and rivals.

verses.sanskrit: इदम उ तयत पुरुतमम पुरस्ताज जयोतिस तमसो वयुनावद अस्थात नूनं दिवो दुहितरो विभातीर गातुं कर्णवन्न उषसो जनाय |||
verses.transliteration: idam u tyat purutamam purastāj jyotis tamaso vayunāvad asthāt nūnaṃ divo duhitaro vibhātīr ghātuṃ kṛṇavann uṣaso janāya

translations.griffith: FORTH from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hatb mounted.  Now verily the far-refulgent Mornings, Daughters of Heaven, bring welfare to the people.

verses.sanskrit: अस्थुर उ चित्रा उषसः पुरस्तान मिता इव सवरवो ऽधवरेषु वय ऊ वरजस्य तमसो दवारोछन्तीर अव्रञ छुचयः पावकाः |||
verses.transliteration: asthur u citrā uṣasaḥ purastān mitā iva svaravo 'dhvareṣu vy ū vrajasya tamaso dvārochantīr avrañ chucayaḥ pāvakāḥ

translations.griffith: The richly-coloured Dawns have mounted eastward, like pillars planted at our sacrifices,  And, flushing far, splendid and purifying, unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness.

verses.sanskrit: उछन्तीर अद्य चितयन्त भोजान राधोदेयायोषसो मघोनीः अचित्रे अन्तः पणयः ससन्त्व अबुध्यमानास तमसो विमध्ये |||
verses.transliteration: uchantīr adya citayanta bhojān rādhodeyāyoṣaso maghonīḥ acitre antaḥ paṇayaḥ sasantv abudhyamānās tamaso vimadhye

translations.griffith: Dispelling gloom this day the wealthy Mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures.  In the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened.

verses.sanskrit: कुवित स देवीः सनयो नवो वा यामो बभूयाद उषसो वो अद्य येना नवग्वे अङगिरे दशग्वे सप्तास्ये रेवती रेवद ऊष |||
verses.transliteration: kuvit sa devīḥ sanayo navo vā yāmo babhūyād uṣaso vo adya yenā navaghve aṅghire daśaghve saptāsye revatī revad ūṣa

translations.griffith: O Goddesses, is this your car, I ask you, ancient this day, or is it new, ye Mornings,  Wherewith, rich Dawns, ye seek with wealth Navagva, Daśagva Aṅgira, the seven-toned singer?

verses.sanskrit: यूयं हि देवीर रतयुग्भिर अश्वैः परिप्रयाथ भुवनानि सद्यः परबोधयन्तीर उषसः ससन्तं दविपाच चतुष्पाच चरथाय जीवम |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ hi devīr ṛtayughbhir aśvaiḥ pariprayātha bhuvanāni sadyaḥ prabodhayantīr uṣasaḥ sasantaṃ dvipāc catuṣpāc carathāya jīvam

translations.griffith: With horses harnessed by eternal Order, Goddesses, swiftly round the worlds ye travel,  Arousing from their rest, O Dawns, the sleeping, and all that lives, man, bird, and beast, to motion.

verses.sanskrit: कव सविद आसां कतमा पुराणी यया विधाना विदधुर रभूणाम शुभं यच छुभ्रा उषसश चरन्ति न वि जञायन्ते सद्र्शीर अजुर्याः |||
verses.transliteration: kva svid āsāṃ katamā purāṇī yayā vidhānā vidadhur ṛbhūṇām śubhaṃ yac chubhrā uṣasaś caranti na vi jñāyante sadṛśīr ajuryāḥ

translations.griffith: Which among these is eldest, and where is she through whom they fixed the Ṛbhus' regulations?  What time the splendid Dawns go forth for splendour, they are not known apart, alike, unwasting.

verses.sanskrit: ता घा ता भद्रा उषसः पुरासुर अभिष्टिद्युम्ना रतजातसत्याः यास्व ईजानः शशमान उक्थै सतुवञ छंसन दरविणं सद्य आप |||
verses.transliteration: tā ghā tā bhadrā uṣasaḥ purāsur abhiṣṭidyumnā ṛtajātasatyāḥ yāsv ījānaḥ śaśamāna ukthai stuvañ chaṃsan draviṇaṃ sadya āpa

translations.griffith: Blest were these Dawns of old, shining with succour, true with the truth that springs from holy Order;  With whom the toiling worshipper, by praises, hymning and lauding, soon attained to riches.

verses.sanskrit: ता आ चरन्ति समना पुरस्तात समानतः समना पप्रथानाः रतस्य देवीः सदसो बुधाना गवां न सर्गा उषसो जरन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: tā ā caranti samanā purastāt samānataḥ samanā paprathānāḥ ṛtasya devīḥ sadaso budhānā ghavāṃ na sarghā uṣaso jarante

translations.griffith: Hither from eastward all at once they travel, from one place spreading in the selfsame manner.  Awaking, from the seat of holy Order the Godlike Dawns come nigh like troops of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: ता इन नव एव समना समानीर अमीतवर्णा उषसश चरन्ति गूहन्तीर अभ्वम असितं रुशद्भिः शुक्रास तनूभिः शुचयो रुचानाः |||
verses.transliteration: tā in nv eva samanā samānīr amītavarṇā uṣasaś caranti ghūhantīr abhvam asitaṃ ruśadbhiḥ śukrās tanūbhiḥ śucayo rucānāḥ

translations.griffith: Thus they go forth with undiminished colours, these Mornings similar, in self-same fashion,  Concealing the gigantic might of darkness with radiant bodies bright and pure and shining.

verses.sanskrit: रयिं दिवो दुहितरो विभातीः परजावन्तं यछतास्मासु देवीः सयोनाद आ वः परतिबुध्यमानाः सुवीर्यस्य पतयः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: rayiṃ divo duhitaro vibhātīḥ prajāvantaṃ yachatāsmāsu devīḥ syonād ā vaḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: O Goddesses, O Heaven's refulgent Daughters, bestow upon us wealth with store of children.  As from our pleasant place of rest ye rouse us may we be masters of heroic vigour.

verses.sanskrit: तद वो दिवो दुहितरो विभातीर उप बरुव उषसो यज्ञकेतुः वयं सयाम यशसो जनेषु तद दयौश च धत्ताम पर्थिवी च देवी |||
verses.transliteration: tad vo divo duhitaro vibhātīr upa bruva uṣaso yajñaketuḥ vayaṃ syāma yaśaso janeṣu tad dyauś ca dhattām pṛthivī ca devī

translations.griffith: Well-skilled in lore of sacrifice, ye Daughters of Heaven, refulgent Dawns, I thus address you.  May we be glorious among the people. May Heaven vouchsafe us this, and Earth the Goddess,

verses.sanskrit: परति षया सूनरी जनी वयुछन्ती परि सवसुः दिवो अदर्शि दुहिता |||
verses.transliteration: prati ṣyā sūnarī janī vyuchantī pari svasuḥ divo adarśi duhitā

translations.griffith: THIS Lady, giver of delight, after her Sister shining forth, Daughter of Heaven, hath shown herself.-

verses.sanskrit: अश्वेव चित्रारुषी माता गवाम रतावरी सखाभूद अश्विनोर उषाः |||
verses.transliteration: aśveva citrāruṣī mātā ghavām ṛtāvarī sakhābhūd aśvinor uṣāḥ

translations.griffith: Unfailing, Mother of the Kine, in colour like a bright red mare,  The Dawn became the Aśvins' Friend.

verses.sanskrit: उत सखास्य अश्विनोर उत माता गवाम असि उतोषो वस्व ईशिषे |||
verses.transliteration: uta sakhāsy aśvinor uta mātā ghavām asi utoṣo vasva īśiṣe

translations.griffith: Yea, and thou art the Aśvins' Friend, the Mother of the Kine art thou:  O Dawn thou rulest over wealth.

verses.sanskrit: यावयद्द्वेषसं तवा चिकित्वित सून्र्तावरि परति सतोमैर अभुत्स्महि |||
verses.transliteration: yāvayaddveṣasaṃ tvā cikitvit sūnṛtāvari prati stomair abhutsmahi

translations.griffith: Thinking of thee, O joyous One, as her who driveth hate away,  We woke to meet thee with our lauds.

verses.sanskrit: परति भद्रा अद्र्क्षत गवां सर्गा न रश्मयः ओषा अप्रा उरु जरयः |||
verses.transliteration: prati bhadrā adṛkṣata ghavāṃ sarghā na raśmayaḥ oṣā aprā uru jrayaḥ

translations.griffith: Our eyes behold thy blessed rays like troops of cattle loosed to feed.  Dawn hath filled full the wide expanse.

verses.sanskrit: आपप्रुषी विभावरि वय आवर जयोतिषा तमः उषो अनु सवधाम अव |||
verses.transliteration: āpapruṣī vibhāvari vy āvar jyotiṣā tamaḥ uṣo anu svadhām ava

translations.griffith: When thou hast filled it, Fulgent One! thou layest bare the gloom with light.  After thy nature aid us, Dawn.

verses.sanskrit: आ दयां तनोषि रश्मिभिर आन्तरिक्षम उरु परियम उषः शुक्रेण शोचिषा |||
verses.transliteration: ā dyāṃ tanoṣi raśmibhir āntarikṣam uru priyam uṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā

translations.griffith: Thou overspreadest heaven with rays, the dear wide region of mid-air.  With thy bright shining lustre, Dawn.

verses.sanskrit: तद देवस्य सवितुर वार्यम महद वर्णीमहे असुरस्य परचेतसः छर्दिर येन दाशुषे यछति तमना तन नो महां उद अयान देवो अक्तुभिः |||
verses.transliteration: tad devasya savitur vāryam mahad vṛṇīmahe asurasya pracetasaḥ chardir yena dāśuṣe yachati tmanā tan no mahāṃ ud ayān devo aktubhiḥ

translations.griffith: OF Savitar the God, the sapient Asura, we crave this great gift which is worthy of our choice,  Wherewith he freely grants his worshiper defence. This with his rays the Great God hath vouchsafed to us.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो धर्ता भुवनस्य परजापतिः पिशङगं दरापिम परति मुञ्चते कविः विचक्षणः परथयन्न आप्र्णन्न उर्व अजीजनत सविता सुम्नम उक्थ्यम |||
verses.transliteration: divo dhartā bhuvanasya prajāpatiḥ piśaṅghaṃ drāpim prati muñcate kaviḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ prathayann āpṛṇann urv ajījanat savitā sumnam ukthyam

translations.griffith: Sustainer of the heaven, Lord of the whole world's life, the Sage, he putteth on his golden-coloured mail.  Clear-sighted, spreading far, filling the spacious realm, Savitar hath brought forth bliss that deserveth laud.

verses.sanskrit: आप्रा रजांसि दिव्यानि पार्थिवा शलोकं देवः कर्णुते सवाय धर्मणे पर बाहू अस्राक सविता सवीमनि निवेशयन परसुवन्न अक्तुभिर जगत |||
verses.transliteration: āprā rajāṃsi divyāni pārthivā ślokaṃ devaḥ kṛṇute svāya dharmaṇe pra bāhū asrāk savitā savīmani niveśayan prasuvann aktubhir jaghat

translations.griffith: He hath filled full the regions of the heaven and earth: the God for his own strengthening waketh up the hymn.  Savitar hath stretched out his arms to cherish life, producing with his rays and lulling all that moves.

verses.sanskrit: अदाभ्यो भुवनानि परचाकशद वरतानि देवः सविताभि रक्षते परास्राग बाहू भुवनस्य परजाभ्यो धर्तव्रतो महो अज्मस्य राजति |||
verses.transliteration: adābhyo bhuvanāni pracākaśad vratāni devaḥ savitābhi rakṣate prāsrāgh bāhū bhuvanasya prajābhyo dhṛtavrato maho ajmasya rājati

translations.griffith: Lighting all living creatures, ne’er to be deceived, Savitar, God, protects each holy ordinance.  He hath stretched out his arms to all the folk of earth, and, with his laws observed, rules his own mighty course.

verses.sanskrit: तरिर अन्तरिक्षं सविता महित्वना तरी रजांसि परिभुस तरीणि रोचना तिस्रो दिवः पर्थिवीस तिस्र इन्वति तरिभिर वरतैर अभि नो रक्षति तमना |||
verses.transliteration: trir antarikṣaṃ savitā mahitvanā trī rajāṃsi paribhus trīṇi rocanā tisro divaḥ pṛthivīs tisra invati tribhir vratair abhi no rakṣati tmanā

translations.griffith: Savitar thrice surrounding with his mightiness mid-air, three regions, and the triple sphere of light,  Sets the three heavens in motion and the threefold earth, and willingly protects us with his triple law.
