verses.sanskrit: बर्हत्सुम्नः परसवीता निवेशनो जगत सथातुर उभयस्य यो वशी स नो देवः सविता शर्म यछत्व अस्मे कषयाय तरिवरूथम अंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhatsumnaḥ prasavītā niveśano jaghata sthātur ubhayasya yo vaśī sa no devaḥ savitā śarma yachatv asme kṣayāya trivarūtham aṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Most gracious God, who brings to life and lulls to rest, he who controls the world, what moves not and what moves,  May he vouchsafe us shelter,—Savitar the God,—for tranquil life, with triple bar against distress.

verses.sanskrit: आगन देव रतुभिर वर्धतु कषयं दधातु नः सविता सुप्रजाम इषम स नः कषपाभिर अहभिश च जिन्वतु परजावन्तं रयिम अस्मे सम इन्वतु |||
verses.transliteration: āghan deva ṛtubhir vardhatu kṣayaṃ dadhātu naḥ savitā suprajām iṣam sa naḥ kṣapābhir ahabhiś ca jinvatu prajāvantaṃ rayim asme sam invatu

translations.griffith: With the year's seasons hath Savitar, God, come nigh: may he prosper our home, give food and noble sons.  May he invigorate us through the days and nights, and may he send us opulence with progeny.

verses.sanskrit: अभूद देवः सविता वन्द्यो नु न इदानीम अह्न उपवाच्यो नर्भिः वि यो रत्ना भजति मानवेभ्यः शरेष्ठं नो अत्र दरविणं यथा दधत |||
verses.transliteration: abhūd devaḥ savitā vandyo nu na idānīm ahna upavācyo nṛbhiḥ vi yo ratnā bhajati mānavebhyaḥ śreṣṭhaṃ no atra draviṇaṃ yathā dadhat

translations.griffith: Now must we praise and honour Savitar the God: at this time of the day the men must call to him,  Him who distributes wealth to Manu's progeny, that he may grant us here riches most excellent.

verses.sanskrit: देवेभ्यो हि परथमं यज्ञियेभ्यो ऽमर्तत्वं सुवसि भागम उत्तमम आद इद दामानं सवितर वय ्र्णुषे ऽनूचीना जीविता मानुषेभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: devebhyo hi prathamaṃ yajñiyebhyo 'mṛtatvaṃ suvasi bhāgham uttamam ād id dāmānaṃ savitar vy rṇuṣe 'nūcīnā jīvitā mānuṣebhyaḥ

translations.griffith: For thou at first producest for the holy Gods the noblest of all portions, immortality:  Thereafter as a gift to men, O Savitar, thou openest existence, life succeeding life.

verses.sanskrit: अचित्ती यच चक्र्मा दैव्ये जने दीनैर दक्षैः परभूती पूरुषत्वता देवेषु च सवितर मानुषेषु च तवं नो अत्र सुवताद अनागसः |||
verses.transliteration: acittī yac cakṛmā daivye jane dīnair dakṣaiḥ prabhūtī pūruṣatvatā deveṣu ca savitar mānuṣeṣu ca tvaṃ no atra suvatād anāghasaḥ

translations.griffith: If we, men as we are, have sinned against the Gods through want of thought, in weakness, or through insolence,  Absolve us from the guilt and make us free from sin, O Savitar, alike among both Gods and men.

verses.sanskrit: न परमिये सवितुर दैव्यस्य तद यथा विश्वम भुवनं धारयिष्यति यत पर्थिव्या वरिमन्न आ सवङगुरिर वर्ष्मन दिवः सुवति सत्यम अस्य तत |||
verses.transliteration: na pramiye savitur daivyasya tad yathā viśvam bhuvanaṃ dhārayiṣyati yat pṛthivyā varimann ā svaṅghurir varṣman divaḥ suvati satyam asya tat

translations.griffith: None may impede that power of Savitar the God whereby he will maintain the universal world.  What the fair-fingered God brings forth on earth's expanse or in the height of heaven, that work of his stands sure.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रज्येष्ठान बर्हद्भ्यः पर्वतेभ्यः कषयां एभ्यः सुवसि पस्त्यावतः यथा-यथा पतयन्तो वियेमिर एवैव तस्थुः सवितः सवाय ते |||
verses.transliteration: indrajyeṣṭhān bṛhadbhyaḥ parvatebhyaḥ kṣayāṃ ebhyaḥ suvasi pastyāvataḥ yathā-yathā patayanto viyemira evaiva tasthuḥ savitaḥ savāya te

translations.griffith: To lofty hills thou sendest those whom Indra leads, and givest fixed abodes with houses unto these.  However they may fly and draw themselves apart, still, Savitar, they stand obeying thy behest.

verses.sanskrit: ये ते तरिर अहन सवितः सवासो दिवे-दिवे सौभगम आसुवन्ति इन्द्रो दयावाप्र्थिवी सिन्धुर अद्भिर आदित्यैर नो अदितिः शर्म यंसत |||
verses.transliteration: ye te trir ahan savitaḥ savāso dive-dive saubhagham āsuvanti indro dyāvāpṛthivī sindhur adbhir ādityair no aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat

translations.griffith: May the libations poured to thee thrice daily, day after day, O Savitar, bring us blessing.  May Indra, Heaven, Earth, Sindhu with the Waters, Aditi with Ādityas, give us shelter.

verses.sanskrit: को वस तराता वसवः को वरूता दयावाभूमी अदिते तरासीथां नः सहीयसो वरुण मित्र मर्तात को वो ऽधवरे वरिवो धाति देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: ko vas trātā vasavaḥ ko varūtā dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṃ naḥ sahīyaso varuṇa mitra martāt ko vo 'dhvare varivo dhāti devāḥ

translations.griffith: WHO of you, Vasus, saveth? who protecteth? O Heaven and Earth and Aditi, preserve us,  Varuṇa., Mitra, from the stronger mortal. Gods, which of you at sacrifice giveth comfort?

verses.sanskrit: पर ये धामानि पूर्व्याण्य अर्चान वि यद उछान वियोतारो अमूराः विधातारो वि ते दधुर अजस्रा रतधीतयो रुरुचन्त दस्माः |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye dhāmāni pūrvyāṇy arcān vi yad uchān viyotāro amūrāḥ vidhātāro vi te dadhur ajasrā ṛtadhītayo rurucanta dasmāḥ

translations.griffith: They who with laud extol the ancient statutes, when they shine forth infallible dividers,  Have ordered as perpetual Ordainers, and beamed as holy-thoughted Wonder-Workers.

verses.sanskrit: पर पस्त्याम अदितिं सिन्धुम अर्कैः सवस्तिम ईळे सख्याय देवीम उभे यथा नो अहनी निपात उषासानक्ता करताम अदब्धे |||
verses.transliteration: pra pastyām aditiṃ sindhum arkaiḥ svastim īḷe sakhyāya devīm ubhe yathā no ahanī nipāta uṣāsānaktā karatām adabdhe

translations.griffith: The Housewife Goddess, Aditi, and Sindhu, the Goddess Svasti I implore for friendship:  And may the unobstructed Night and Morning both, day and night, provide for our protection.

verses.sanskrit: वय अर्यमा वरुणश चेति पन्थाम इषस पतिः सुवितं गातुम अग्निः इन्द्राविष्णू नर्वद उ षु सतवाना शर्म नो यन्तम अमवद वरूथम |||
verses.transliteration: vy aryamā varuṇaś ceti panthām iṣas patiḥ suvitaṃ ghātum aghniḥ indrāviṣṇū nṛvad u ṣu stavānā śarma no yantam amavad varūtham

translations.griffith: Aryaman, Varuṇa have disclosed the pathway, Agni as Lord of Strength the road to welfare.  Lauded in manly mode may Indra-Viṣṇu grant us their powerful defence and shelter.

verses.sanskrit: आ पर्वतस्य मरुताम अवांसि देवस्य तरातुर अव्रि भगस्य पात पतिर जन्याद अंहसो नो मित्रो मित्रियाद उत न उरुष्येत |||
verses.transliteration: ā parvatasya marutām avāṃsi devasya trātur avri bhaghasya pāt patir janyād aṃhaso no mitro mitriyād uta na uruṣyet

translations.griffith: I have besought the favour of the Maruts, of Parvata, of Bhaga God who rescues.  From trouble caused by man the Lord preserve us; from woe sent by his friend let Mitra save us.

verses.sanskrit: नू रोदसी अहिना बुध्न्येन सतुवीत देवी अप्येभिर इष्टैः समुद्रं न संचरणे सनिष्यवो घर्मस्वरसो नद्यो अप वरन |||
verses.transliteration: nū rodasī ahinā budhnyena stuvīta devī apyebhir iṣṭaiḥ samudraṃ na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavo gharmasvaraso nadyo apa vran

translations.griffith: Agree, through these our watery oblations, Goddesses, Heaven and Earth, with Ahibudhnya.  As if to win the sea, the Gharma-heaters have opened, as they come anear, the rivers.

verses.sanskrit: देवैर नो देव्य अदितिर नि पातु देवस तराता तरायताम अप्रयुछन नहि मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धासिम अर्हामसि परमियं सान्व अग्नेः |||
verses.transliteration: devair no devy aditir ni pātu devas trātā trāyatām aprayuchan nahi mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsim arhāmasi pramiyaṃ sānv aghneḥ

translations.griffith: May Goddess Aditi with Gods defend us, save us the saviour God with care unceasing.  We dare not stint the sacred food of Mitra and Varuṇa upon the back of Agni.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर ईशे वसव्यस्याग्निर महः सौभगस्य तान्य अस्मभ्यं रासते |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir īśe vasavyasyāghnir mahaḥ saubhaghasya tāny asmabhyaṃ rāsate

translations.griffith: Agni is Sovran Lord of wealth, Agni of great prosperity:  May he bestow these gifts on us.

verses.sanskrit: उषो मघोन्य आ वह सून्र्ते वार्या पुरु अस्मभ्यं वाजिनीवति |||
verses.transliteration: uṣo maghony ā vaha sūnṛte vāryā puru asmabhyaṃ vājinīvati

translations.griffith: Hither to us, rich pleasant Dawn, bring many things to be desired,  Thou who hast ample store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: तत सु नः सविता भगो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा इन्द्रो नो राधसा गमत |||
verses.transliteration: tat su naḥ savitā bhagho varuṇo mitro aryamā indro no rādhasā ghamat

translations.griffith: So then may Bhaga, Savitar, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Indra, with bounty come to us.

verses.sanskrit: मही दयावाप्र्थिवी इह जयेष्ठे रुचा भवतां शुचयद्भिर अर्कैः यत सीं वरिष्ठे बर्हती विमिन्वन रुवद धोक्षा पप्रथानेभिर एवैः |||
verses.transliteration: mahī dyāvāpṛthivī iha jyeṣṭhe rucā bhavatāṃ śucayadbhir arkaiḥ yat sīṃ variṣṭhe bṛhatī viminvan ruvad dhokṣā paprathānebhir evaiḥ

translations.griffith: MAY mighty Heaven and Earth, most meet for honour, be present here with light and gleaming splendours;  When, fixing them apart, vast, most extensive, the Steer roars loudly in far-reaching courses.

verses.sanskrit: देवी देवेभिर यजते यजत्रैर अमिनती तस्थतुर उक्षमाणे रतावरी अद्रुहा देवपुत्रे यज्ञस्य नेत्री शुचयद्भिर अर्कैः |||
verses.transliteration: devī devebhir yajate yajatrair aminatī tasthatur ukṣamāṇe ṛtāvarī adruhā devaputre yajñasya netrī śucayadbhir arkaiḥ

translations.griffith: The Goddesses with Gods, holy with holy, the Two stand pouring out their rain, exhaustless:  Faithful and guileless, having Gods for children, leaders of sacrifice with shining splendours.

verses.sanskrit: स इत सवपा भुवनेष्व आस य इमे दयावाप्र्थिवी जजान उर्वी गभीरे रजसी सुमेके अवंशे धीरः शच्या सम ऐरत |||
verses.transliteration: sa it svapā bhuvaneṣv āsa ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna urvī ghabhīre rajasī sumeke avaṃśe dhīraḥ śacyā sam airat

translations.griffith: Sure in the worlds he was a skilful Craftsman, he who produced these Twain the Earth and Heaven.  Wise, with his power he brought both realms, together spacious and deep, well-fashioned, unsupported.

verses.sanskrit: नू रोदसी बर्हद्भिर नो वरूथैः पत्नीवद्भिर इषयन्ती सजोषाः उरूची विश्वे यजते नि पातं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū rodasī bṛhadbhir no varūthaiḥ patnīvadbhir iṣayantī sajoṣāḥ urūcī viśve yajate ni pātaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ

translations.griffith: O Heaven and Earth, with one accord promoting, with high protection as of Queens, our welfare,  Far-reaching, universal, holy, guard us. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit: पर वाम महि दयवी अभ्य उपस्तुतिम भरामहे शुची उप परशस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: pra vām mahi dyavī abhy upastutim bharāmahe śucī upa praśastaye

translations.griffith: To both of you, O Heaven and Earth, we bring our lofty song of praise,  Pure Ones! to glorify you both.

verses.sanskrit: पुनाने तन्वा मिथः सवेन दक्षेण राजथः ऊह्याथे सनाद रतम |||
verses.transliteration: punāne tanvā mithaḥ svena dakṣeṇa rājathaḥ ūhyāthe sanād ṛtam

translations.griffith: Ye sanctify each other's form, by your own proper might ye rule,  And from of old observe the Law.

verses.sanskrit: मही मित्रस्य साधथस तरन्ती पिप्रती रतम परि यज्ञं नि षेदथुः |||
verses.transliteration: mahī mitrasya sādhathas tarantī pipratī ṛtam pari yajñaṃ ni ṣedathuḥ

translations.griffith: Furthering and fulfilling, ye, O Mighty, perfect Mitra's Law.  Ye sit around our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: कषेत्रस्य पतिना वयं हितेनेव जयामसि गाम अश्वम पोषयित्न्व आ स नो मर्ळातीद्र्शे |||
verses.transliteration: kṣetrasya patinā vayaṃ hiteneva jayāmasi ghām aśvam poṣayitnv ā sa no mṛḷātīdṛśe

translations.griffith: WE through the Master of the Field, even as through a friend, obtain  What nourisheth our kine and steeds. In such may he be good to us.

verses.sanskrit: कषेत्रस्य पते मधुमन्तम ऊर्मिं धेनुर इव पयो अस्मासु धुक्ष्व मधुश्चुतं घर्तम इव सुपूतम रतस्य नः पतयो मर्ळयन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: kṣetrasya pate madhumantam ūrmiṃ dhenur iva payo asmāsu dhukṣva madhuścutaṃ ghṛtam iva supūtam ṛtasya naḥ patayo mṛḷayantu

translations.griffith: As the cow yieldeth milk, pour for us freely, Lord of the Field, the wave that beareth sweetness,  Distilling meath, well-purified like butter, and let the. Lords of holy Law be gracious.

verses.sanskrit: मधुमतीर ओषधीर दयाव आपो मधुमन नो भवत्व अन्तरिक्षम कषेत्रस्य पतिर मधुमान नो अस्त्व अरिष्यन्तो अन्व एनं चरेम |||
verses.transliteration: madhumatīr oṣadhīr dyāva āpo madhuman no bhavatv antarikṣam kṣetrasya patir madhumān no astv ariṣyanto anv enaṃ carema

translations.griffith: Sweet be the plants for us. the heavens, the waters, and full of sweets for us be air's mid-region.  May the Field's Lord for us be full of sweetness, and may we follow after him uninjured.

verses.sanskrit: शुनं वाहाः शुनं नरः शुनं कर्षतु लाङगलम शुनं वरत्रा बध्यन्तां शुनम अष्ट्राम उद इङगय |||
verses.transliteration: śunaṃ vāhāḥ śunaṃ naraḥ śunaṃ kṛṣatu lāṅghalam śunaṃ varatrā badhyantāṃ śunam aṣṭrām ud iṅghaya

translations.griffith: Happily work our steers and men, may the plough furrow happily.  Happily be the traces bound; happily may he ply the goad.

verses.sanskrit: शुनासीराव इमां वाचं जुषेथां यद दिवि चक्रथुः पयः तेनेमाम उप सिञ्चतम |||
verses.transliteration: śunāsīrāv imāṃ vācaṃ juṣethāṃ yad divi cakrathuḥ payaḥ tenemām upa siñcatam

translations.griffith: Śuna and Sīra, welcome ye this laud, and with the milk which ye have made in heaven  Bedew ye both this earth of ours.

verses.sanskrit: अर्वाची सुभगे भव सीते वन्दामहे तवा यथा नः सुभगाससि यथा नः सुफलाससि |||
verses.transliteration: arvācī subhaghe bhava sīte vandāmahe tvā yathā naḥ subhaghāsasi yathā naḥ suphalāsasi

translations.griffith: Auspicious Sītā, come thou near: we venerate and worship thee  That thou mayst bless and prosper us and bring us fruits abundantly.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रः सीतां नि गर्ह्णातु ताम पूषानु यछतु सा नः पयस्वती दुहाम उत्तराम-उत्तरां समाम |||
verses.transliteration: indraḥ sītāṃ ni ghṛhṇātu tām pūṣānu yachatu sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarām-uttarāṃ samām

translations.griffith: May Indra press the furrow down, may Pūṣan guide its course aright.  May she, as rich in milk, be drained for us through each succeeding year.

verses.sanskrit: शुनं नः फाला वि कर्षन्तु भूमिं शुनं कीनाशा अभि यन्तु वाहैः शुनम पर्जन्यो मधुना पयोभिः शुनासीरा शुनम अस्मासु धत्तम |||
verses.transliteration: śunaṃ naḥ phālā vi kṛṣantu bhūmiṃ śunaṃ kīnāśā abhi yantu vāhaiḥ śunam parjanyo madhunā payobhiḥ śunāsīrā śunam asmāsu dhattam

translations.griffith: Happily let the shares turn up the plough-land, happily go the ploughers with the oxen.  With meath and milk Parjanya make us happy. Grant us prosperity, Śuna and Sīra.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्राद ऊर्मिर मधुमां उद आरद उपांशुना सम अम्र्तत्वम आनट घर्तस्य नाम गुह्यं यद अस्ति जिह्वा देवानाम अम्र्तस्य नाभिः |||
verses.transliteration: samudrād ūrmir madhumāṃ ud ārad upāṃśunā sam amṛtatvam ānaṭ ghṛtasya nāma ghuhyaṃ yad asti jihvā devānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ

translations.griffith: FORTH from the ocean sprang the wave of sweetness: together with the stalk it turned to Amṛta,  That which is holy oil's mysterious title: but the Gods’ tongue is truly Amṛta's centre.

verses.sanskrit: वयं नाम पर बरवामा घर्तस्यास्मिन यज्ञे धारयामा नमोभिः उप बरह्मा शर्णवच छस्यमानं चतुःश्र्ङगो ऽवमीद गौर एतत |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ nāma pra bravāmā ghṛtasyāsmin yajñe dhārayāmā namobhiḥ upa brahmā śṛṇavac chasyamānaṃ catuḥśṛṅgho 'vamīd ghaura etat

translations.griffith: Let us declare aloud the name of Ghṛta, and at this sacrifice hold it up with homage.  So let the Brahman hear the praise we utter. This hath the four-horned Buffalo emitted.

verses.sanskrit: चत्वारि शर्ङगा तरयो अस्य पादा दवे शीर्षे सप्त हस्तासो अस्य तरिधा बद्धो वर्षभो रोरवीति महो देवो मर्त्यां आ विवेश |||
verses.transliteration: catvāri śṛṅghā trayo asya pādā dve śīrṣe sapta hastāso asya tridhā baddho vṛṣabho roravīti maho devo martyāṃ ā viveśa

translations.griffith: Four are his horns, three are the feet that bear him; his heads are two, his hands are seven in number.  Bound with a triple bond the Steer roars loudly: the mighty God hath entered in to mortals.

verses.sanskrit: तरिधा हितम पणिभिर गुह्यमानं गवि देवासो घर्तम अन्व अविन्दन इन्द्र एकं सूर्य एकं जजान वेनाद एकं सवधया निष टतक्षुः |||
verses.transliteration: tridhā hitam paṇibhir ghuhyamānaṃ ghavi devāso ghṛtam anv avindan indra ekaṃ sūrya ekaṃ jajāna venād ekaṃ svadhayā niṣ ṭatakṣuḥ

translations.griffith: That oil in triple shape the Gods discovered laid down within the Cow, concealed by Paṇis.  Indra produced one shape, Sūrya another: by their own power they formed the third from Vena.

verses.sanskrit: एता अर्षन्ति हर्द्यात समुद्राच छतव्रजा रिपुणा नावचक्षे घर्तस्य धारा अभि चाकशीमि हिरण्ययो वेतसो मध्य आसाम |||
verses.transliteration: etā arṣanti hṛdyāt samudrāc chatavrajā ripuṇā nāvacakṣe ghṛtasya dhārā abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayo vetaso madhya āsām

translations.griffith: From inmost reservoir in countless channels flow down these rivers which the foe beholds not.  I look upon the streams of oil descending, and lo! the Golden Reed is there among them.

verses.sanskrit: सम्यक सरवन्ति सरितो न धेना अन्तर हर्दा मनसा पूयमानाः एते अर्षन्त्य ऊर्मयो घर्तस्य मर्गा इव कषिपणोर ईषमाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: samyak sravanti sarito na dhenā antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ ete arṣanty ūrmayo ghṛtasya mṛghā iva kṣipaṇor īṣamāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: Like rivers our libations flow together, cleansing themselves in inmost heart and spirit.  The streams of holy oil pour swiftly downward like the wild beasts that fly before the bowman.

verses.sanskrit: सिन्धोर इव पराध्वने शूघनासो वातप्रमियः पतयन्ति यह्वाः घर्तस्य धारा अरुषो न वाजी काष्ठा भिन्दन्न ऊर्मिभिः पिन्वमानः |||
verses.transliteration: sindhor iva prādhvane śūghanāso vātapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvāḥ ghṛtasya dhārā aruṣo na vājī kāṣṭhā bhindann ūrmibhiḥ pinvamānaḥ

translations.griffith: As rushing down the rapids of a river, flow swifter than the wind the vigorous currents,  The streams of oil in swelling fluctuation like a red courser bursting through the fences.

verses.sanskrit: अभि परवन्त समनेव योषाः कल्याण्यः समयमानासो अग्निम घर्तस्य धाराः समिधो नसन्त ता जुषाणो हर्यति जातवेदाः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi pravanta samaneva yoṣāḥ kalyāṇyaḥ smayamānāso aghnim ghṛtasya dhārāḥ samidho nasanta tā juṣāṇo haryati jātavedāḥ

translations.griffith: Like women at a gathering fair to look on and gently smiling, they incline to Agni.  The streams of holy oil attain the fuel, and Jātavedas joyfully receives them.

verses.sanskrit: कन्या इव वहतुम एतवा उ अञ्ज्य अञ्जाना अभि चाकशीमि यत्र सोमः सूयते यत्र यज्ञो घर्तस्य धारा अभि तत पवन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: kanyā iva vahatum etavā u añjy añjānā abhi cākaśīmi yatra somaḥ sūyate yatra yajño ghṛtasya dhārā abhi tat pavante

translations.griffith: As maidens dock themselves with gay adornment to join the bridal feast, I now behold them.  Where Soma flows and sacrifice is ready, thither the streams of holy oil are running.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्य अर्षत सुष्टुतिं गव्यम आजिम अस्मासु भद्रा दरविणानि धत्त इमं यज्ञं नयत देवता नो घर्तस्य धारा मधुमत पवन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: abhy arṣata suṣṭutiṃ ghavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta imaṃ yajñaṃ nayata devatā no ghṛtasya dhārā madhumat pavante

translations.griffith: Send to our eulogy a herd of cattle bestow upon us excellent possessions.  Bear to the Gods the sacrifice we offer the streams of oil flow pure and full of sweetness.

verses.sanskrit: धामन ते विश्वम भुवनम अधि शरितम अन्तः समुद्रे हर्द्य अन्तर आयुषि अपाम अनीके समिथे य आभ्र्तस तम अश्याम मधुमन्तं त ऊर्मिम |||
verses.transliteration: dhāman te viśvam bhuvanam adhi śritam antaḥ samudre hṛdy antar āyuṣi apām anīke samithe ya ābhṛtas tam aśyāma madhumantaṃ ta ūrmim

translations.griffith: The universe depends upon thy power and might within the sea, within the heart, within all life.
